description: Be the first player with the most chips after ten rounds.  Game is played based on musical chairs where players try to collect three matching character cards plus one kevin card.  The first player to collect them grabs a pawn from the center of the board.

title: Beat the 8 Ball
description:
Players try to have the highest score at the end of three rounds of play or to be the first player to score ten or more points.  Each player releases their ball along the track to score points before the eight ball drops and blocks the scoring track.

The Beat The Eight Ball game from Ideal is a game of patience and skill. After the Eight Ball is set spinning in the funnel each player must decide when to release their own marble. Beating the Eight Ball at all gives you points, coming in after it takes points away. More points are given the later your ball is so it pays to take chances.

Further description given by Sam Cancilla at http://www.Samstoybox.com

title: The Addams Family Family Reunion Game
types: Children's Game Horror Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Be the first player to collect the four party guests on your invitation card and the food token to win.

You get to take a wonderfully wacky trip around the mansion with Gomez, Morticia, Uncle Fester, Lurch, Pugsley and Wenesday. The object is to bring 4 guests and the food to the party. Along the way, you'll run into some of the funniest and strangest situations ever! You might land in the graveyard where you dig up three guests. Or you can rest on the bed of nails and lose a turn. If you are lucky enough you may land on the TRAP DOOR and then you can go to any space on the board.
Land on THINGS space and you pick a THING card. Do you have any relatives over 500 years old? If so take a guest card. If you are wearing black go to any space in the graveyard. Just about anything can happen when you go to The Addams Family Reunion. The first player to bring 4 guests and the food to the party wins the game

title: Ant Eater
description: Players try to catch their color ants with their anteater which is done by moving the anteater arm back and forth so the ants move through the guide and into the holding area.

title: Beverly Hills 90210 Survey Game
description: Be the first player to reach the finish space by correctly guessing how teens across the country voted on 90210 situations and teen themes. Game comes with a gameboard, 4 voting discs, card tray, card reader, 200 cards, 6 plastic pointers, 4 pawns

title: Batman: The Animated Series – 3D Board Game
types: Children's Game Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description: Batman has fallen asleep at his computer.  He dreams the cave has been invaded by criminals and Robin is in danger.  Your objective is to earn the highest score as you help Batman capture the villains and save Robin.

title: Bank On It!
description: Be the first player to reach the Tag Sale at the center of the board with enough money to buy a secret prize.

title: Are You Afraid of the Dark?
types: Children's Game Horror Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Are you ready to be initiated into the Midnight Society?  You and your friends will be sent on a journey through the scariest places ever imagined.  If you overcome all of the obstacles, gain points in categories such as knowledge, strength, courage, and be the first one back to the campfire you too will be a member of the Midnight Society.  Players must accumulate a total of six points in each of the six categories and return to the campfire to win.

title: Party Lines
description: Player write responses to a phrase read off a card. Players then try to guess who gave what response. Points are scored for a correct guess and for stumping all other players.

title: Elephant Ride
description: Be the first player to climb on the elephants back and you are the king of the jungle.  Each player builds a stack of monkeys by placing tiles on top of each other on his side of the board by matching the colors on the top and bottom of each tile.

title: Foot Loose
description: Footloose is a unique game that combines physical activity with simple board game strategies.  Invented by a physical education teacher, Footloose enhances both large and small motor skills, as well as color recognition.  It is an ideal game for the very young game player whose energy level prohibits quiet game play.  There are several variations of play that progress in difficulty.

title: Flip for Fun
types: Children's Game Educational Memory Word Game
description:
A sure-fire way to make a happy mix of children and travel.  Two flipper trays with two sets of eight cards for a total of 16 games.  
Games include: Learn to Spell, Alphabet, Observation, Detour, Make-a-Match, States and Capitals, Build-A-Car, Battleship, Dot Blocko, Ghost, Word Squares, Dominoes, Crazy Eights and Twenty One.

title: Home Alone 2 Action Contraption Game
types: Children's Game Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description: Game is set up in the mousetrap fashion.  Try to make it to the finish square and avoid being knocked over by one of the traps.  Traps include the paint bucket, fire escape, toolbox, toilet and ladder.

title: Cluche
mechanisms: Co-operative PlayDice RollingRoll / Spin and Move
description: Cluch is played in 2-4 teams. Teams earn points by guessing clichs from clues given by teammates. Time limit is enforced by a 60 second sand timer.

title: Events
description:
Part of the 3M Bookshelf Series.

From the back of the box:

EVENTS is the exciting, memory-jogging game of historic happenings where skillful questioning leads to the identity of history-making incidents and occurrences. As Historian, you pick the event and provide the identifying clues - in other turns, identify events from the fewest clues to score the most points! Ever-changing, ever-challenging fun for history buffs and gamesters alike, 4 to 8 players, teens and adults. Bookshelf case contains colorful world map, locale indicator, record sheets and Events Playbook with complete rules plus handy reference section listing over 300 historic happenings.

title: Jogo do Conan
types: Adventure Children's Game Comic Book / Strip Fantasy Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanisms: Campaign / Battle Card DrivenRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Conan the Barbarian must destroy a magical talisman and kill the monster on the mountain, going across a forest and avoiding fireballs, before the night falls.

It is really a two-player game, but the rules state it can be played by more players as two teams.

title: Mind*Link
description:
Working in partnership, each partner spins to get a letter. Now, the partners have 30 seconds to see if they can individually come up with the same 'phrase' using the 2-letter acronym. Bonus points if even 1 word matches.

If not, then they can try to make the 3 or 4 words into some sort of sentence. If they pass the judging, then they can move on.

It's labeled as 'The Spellepathic Word Game'.

title: The Nancy Drew Mystery Game
description: Nancy Drew is the ingenious daughter of a famous lawyer, and she herself is deeply interested in mystery cases. Her interest often involves her in dangerous and exciting situations. In this game she is working on one of her many cases. The players in the game try to locate her and find out which case she is trying to solve.

title: New England Trivia
description: 3,000 great questions covering the New England States. For independent play or with any category trivia game. Six categories to enliven your next party: Prior Times, Pro-Am Sports, Sightseeing, Culture, The Land, Etcetera .

title: Race Cards
description:
Each of up to six players is a driver in a  NASCAR  race. By drawing and playing a hand of cards, the goal is to be the first to complete 200 laps. However, your opponents will try to slow you down by forcing you to pit for tires, fuel, repairs...or even worse. A good  RACE CARD  driver will play both offensively, by playing as many  Lap Cards  as possible, and defensively by slowing down his or her opponents. When someone is too far ahead, rival drivers might even have to gang up on the leader in order to close the gap.

Re-implementation of Mille Bornes

title: William the Conqueror: 1066
description:
William the Conqueror - 1066 is a two or three player tactical wargame which recreates the Battles of Stamford Bridge and Senlac Hill (more commonly known as the Battle of Hastings), the most decisive battles ever fought on English soil. The results of these battles profoundly changed the course of English history and language. At Stamford Bridge, the Viking invasion of England was repulsed by the Anglo-Saxon army, while three weeks later, at Senlac Hill, the Norman invaders successfully defeated the Anglo-Saxon army and were able to conquer the whole of England. The outcome of the Battle of Senlac Hill was a direct result of the Battle of Stamford Bridge. In a campaign game, players play the Battle of Stamford Bridge first. Then the Battle of Senlac Hill is played with an order of battle determined by the outcome of the Battle of Stamford Bridge. Either game may be played independently of the other.

1066 uses a revolutionary innovation in wargaming entitled the MOVEMENT RESOLUTION SYSTEM. There is no die to throw nor any card to choose. The result of an attack depends entirely upon how intelligently you move, not the luck of the die. The MOVEMENT RESOLUTION SYSTEM consists of the attacker moving adjacent to an enemy unit, then both players moving one hex simultaneously. The result of this move determines the result of the attack.

title: Master Criminals!
description: Master Criminals! is a mystery card game of high intrigue. You assume the role of both Chief Investigator and Master Criminal. Are you clever enough to avoid detection while pursuing your fellow felons?

title: When Darkness Comes: This Is Not Happening
types: Dice Expansion for Base-game Horror Science Fiction
description:
What if everything you thought was real was a figment of someone else's imagination?

This is an expansion for When Darkness Comes. If focuses on cybernetic/dreamworld themes where players are not limited by the laws of physics and even reality itself can be altered.

Components: 5 New Scenarios, 2 board tiles, 24 New encounter disks, a self contained GM run adventure and new rules additions

title: Miami Vice: The Game
description:
For the player who acts as the Miami Vice Team, the object of the game is for him to apprehend the criminals forces (cars) and/or to get to the target drop before the criminal does.

For the player who acts as the criminals team, the object of the game is to get to the target drop before the Miami Vice team does and if possible, to eliminate the Miami Vice forces (cars).

title: The Last Starfighter Combat Game
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Starfighters of opposing forces clash in space. Laser beams cut through ships as they explode and die. Torpedoes smash into others igniting them in great balls of fire. The two forces are fighting for control of the galaxy and both sides feel the need to win this battle. Your commander sends in reinforcements constantly until finally it is your time. You don your flight suit and climb into your ship then you realize that it's all up to you for you are The Last Starfighter
Players choose to be pilots for the Rylosians, striving to save the galaxy or pilots of the dread Ko-Dan armada attempting to subjugate the civilized worlds. The Last Starfighter uses a simple system for simultaneous action. Players plan their [sic] moves, and plot them on an easy-to-use plotting sheet, hoping to outmaneuver their opponents. Then they execute their moves, get the enemy in their sights and FIRE!
This game includes 78 colorful playing pieces, a 17-x 22-inch map sheet, rulebook, a pad of plotting sheets and 2 dice. Everything you need for a galaxy of fun.

title: Going to Jerusalem
description: Going to Jerusalem is a Bible game that is based upon the New Testament. Like all fine games, it is both interesting and entertaining, and at the same time its play familiarizes both children and adults with the best-known verses in the New Testament. The Revised Standard Version of the Bible has been selected for use in this game because it has been approved for teaching in most church schools. Those who are familiar with other versions of the Bible will find it interesting to compare the verses in their own Bibles with those that are used in the play of this game.  Going to Jerusalem is designed primarily for home play but is adaptable for use in school and church classes.

title: Computer Rage
description: Computer Rage is a game in which from two to four players attempt to move their playing pieces (Programs) from start (Input) to finish (Output).  The first player to accomplish this is the winner.  The game involves both luck and skill, the outcome being determined both by probability and strategy. There are many parallels between the play of Computer Rage and the operations of a modern computer system as explained in the supplement to these rules.

title: The Dick Tracy Game
types: Comic Book / Strip Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Play The Dick Tracy Game. Join America's most popular detective in a last ditch attempt to round up the colorful cast of villains and save the city. Capture Big Boy Caprice, Flattop, Pruneface, and the mysterious Blank in their hideouts. Win points by stopping crimes.

title: Generosity
description: GENEROSITY encourages basic Christian values through lifelike, situational play.  The object of the game is to lay up treasure in heaven by serving others through properly motivated generosity. Dealing with real-life issues like occupation, proper use of money, marriage, having a family, helping your neighbor, and having a right attitude, each step on the full-color game board presents a thrilling challenge and exciting opportunities for adding to your Heavenly Treasure Chest. Win or lose, the whole family will have an opportunity to learn and exercise Christian principles through this fun-filled family game.

title: All My Children
types: Bluffing Card Game Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanisms: Hand ManagementPoint to Point MovementPress Your LuckRole PlayingRoll / Spin and MoveTrick-taking
description: Pine Valley appears to be a quiet community, but beneath that thin veneer of respectability lie powerful passions and petty jealousies, wild emotions and dark machinations. For this is the home of Erica Kane and Palmer Cortlandt, of Tad Martin and Phoebe Tyler-Wallingford. This is the home of All My Children.  All My Children is a game of romance and intrigue in which each player takes the part of one of the major stars of the show, and attempts to fulfill goals to reach ultimate happiness.

title: Arizona Trivia
description: Arizona Trivia provides an entertaining way to learn more about Arizona. Each game contains a colorful game board (map of Arizona) as well as 1,000 interesting questions covering places, people, leisure, cactus, sports, politics, history and geography. When a question is answered correctly, the person continues with a roll of the die. The first person to make a complete tour of the state, wins! If you like Arizona, you'll love Arizona Trivia!

title: Goosebumps: One Day at Horrorland Game
description: Welcome to HorrorLand, the scary amusement park where you and your friends play for your lives! Complete a ride to collect its ride token. Hang on as you whirl around in a coffin on the Wheel of Fear! Then be sure to run fast across the Horror Bridge before you get knocked off! Ready for the scariest ride of all? Use a ticket card to go down the towering Doom Slide. But watch out! Someone may play a card and release the rides' hidden skulls. They'll roll down and take you with them! The first player to survive all three rides must race back to the Entrance to win!

title: G.I. Joe Mission: Cobra H.Q. Game
description:
Cobra Commander has drawn up secret plans to attain world domination.  The G.I. Joe team is ready to take on the COBRA henchmen and get the plans.  As part of the team, you must sneak through the jungle to find the hidden boats that will take you across the crocodile infested river to COBRA H.Q.  Beware of booby traps and COBRA operatives along the way.  You will need to defeat them before you can advance.  Once you reach the island, you must secure the plans and then escape to safety.  The first team member to return to their starting place with the secret plans is the winner!  Congratulations, you've saved the world from the evils of COBRA!

Box Contents:  Gameboard, 4 G.I. JOE pawns with plastic stands, 36 game tiles, 2 dice and the instructions.

title: Tatchanka: Ukraine, 1919-21
description:
Tatchanka - Ukraine, 1919-21 is a strategic simulation of one of the last parts of the Russian Civil War, the three-year struggle in the Ukraine after World War I.

Components

- One 22x34 black and white map, covering the area from Kharkov in the north, Taganrog in the east, Perekop in the south to Kiev/Odessa in the west.

- One 8-page brown and white rules booklet

- One 11x17 black and white play accessory sheet

- 201 die-cut 1/2 counters:

89 Reds (black on red), 14 Makhnovists (red on black), 32 Ukrainian Nationalists (black on white), 51 Whites (blue on white), 6 French (black on blue), 5 Greek (black on light blue), 4 blanks (red)

The inside of the play accessory chart contains nine charts and tables and the outside forms the cover the artwork of which is reproduced at the start of this article on the previous page (hand-drawn illustration of two Makhnovists firing a machine gun from a horse-drawn Tatchanka).  Only 200 copies were printed making this a very rare game.

title: Into the Forest
description:
The cards in this game represent animals and plants that are found in a temperate zone forest.  Each card lists what the animal eats and what it is eaten by.

The game works just like the natural food relationships in the forest with players eating and being eaten just as they would in the wild.

title: Route 66: The Great American Road Trip Game
description:
This game simulates a cross-country trip from New York to Los Angeles, along I-80 to Chicago and US 66 from Chicago to LA. As you take the trip, you land on challenges, which could include performances, fill in the blanks, trivia, true/false questions, roadside assistance, drawing pictures, quick list making, speed answering, or geographical. You might also get sent to a Tourist Trap, where you might have to tell a story, answer a geographical question, or do some performance.

Game includes board, 4 tokens, 320 postcards with challenges, 80 side trip cards, 1d3, 12 police tickets, 4 wind power cards, 1 answer revealer, and rules.

The game is also adaptable to team play.

title: Get Ready for Shabbos
description:
From the box: A challenging game for children, and a bingo game for adults. The rest of the rules are in Hebrew.

It appears that there are cards illustrating Jewish values, objects, and practices. It looks like these cards have to be matched up in some way.

title: Blackout
description:
The object of BLACKOUT is to win the game by having the greatest net investment in power plants on the board.

Each player owns and operates a power company.  Each player strives to improve his competitive position by investing in new regions and power plants, upgrading existing power plants and acquiring competitors' regions and plants through acquisition and foreclosure.

Blackout my be played with two, three or four players.  A complete game with four usually takes 1 to 2 hours.

The game consists of a playing board, 1 die, 4 markers, 140 power plants, 31 IMPACT CARDS, 40 mortgage cards, 4 value charts and over 250 Billion Dollars in play money to acquire power plants and avoid a blackout.

BLACKOUT is a fascinating game of strategy and luck.  It is an easy game to play, but new challenges appear with each play, and situations change rapidly.  The outcome may not be apparent until the last play.

title: Ta-Ka-Radi
description:
A balancing tower building game.  Apparently based on an African game.  It is very similar to Jenga, but predates it.

You build a tower out of the narrow edges of 50 wooden blocks.  Each level has three blocks, and the next level is built at right angles to the previous level.  Each player takes a block from below the top and transfers it to the top level.  Players can use two hands, but no physical interaction between the players is allowed.  The player who makes the tower fall loses.  Everyone else wins.

title: Punto
description:
Punto (Point) is a special bonus for sweeping the table as players compete for the most cards, golds, and sevens in this easy-to-learn game.

Punto also comes with rules for Briscola (Trump).

Both are light trick-taking games using a deck of 40 cards- 4 suits (Cups, Gold, Swords and Clubs) numbered 1-10.

Re-implements:

    Scopa

title: One More Time
description: Each player has a peg board having a row of holes on the bottom step and on the top. The holes are numbered from 1 to 11 with two special 12 holes. The idea is for a player to move his pegs from the bottom to the top and back again in numerical sequence (1,2,3, etc.). The roll of the three numbered dice determines which peg (or pegs) may be moved. Players take turns rolling the dice and moving pegs, if possible. Any player rolling a double or triple may roll again, ONE MORE TIME.

title: Marblehead
description:
You put the cardboard face around the clear plastic head and fill it with marbles. Each player gets their own plastic tray which fits under the head to collect marbles that drop out of the head after one stuck a finger through a single hole in the head.

Be the player to accumulate the most marbles by sticking your finger through the holes in the head.

title: The Lone Ranger & Tonto
types: Adventure American West Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Someone has done something somewhere and The Lone Ranger  Tonto are here to figure it out! This roll and move game pits players against each other to solve the crime.

Before play begins, 'location cards' are drawn randomly and placed face-down on the board. On his/her first move, a player must draw an 'evil deed' and 'outlaw' card then roll the dice to move. Players may move any direction around the board or through the middle of the board.

As play continues, participants will land on spaces and draw cards that allow or force the exchange of evil deed, location or outlaw cards with other players. The objective is to collect a set of three cards that are part of a sequence (as indicated on the cards).

The first to present a sequence on his/her turn is the winner!

title: Logus Sr.
types: Abstract Strategy Action / Dexterity Puzzle Word Game
mechanisms: Area MovementHand ManagementPattern BuildingSimultaneous Action SelectionTile Placement
description: Players form words using a tray 4 X 5 containing 18 letters. Words are formed by rearranging the letters within the tray.

title: Little House on the Prairie
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Be the first player to move all five members of your family into the safety of the Little House.  Doing this won't be easy.  You'll have to move your family past three dangerous situations: an Indian war party, a wolf pack and a prairie fire.

title: Double-Play Baseball
description: Double-Play Baseball follows all the rules for playing professional baseball.  The game is played in nine innings.  The nine dice represent the batting team.  The single white and black pitcher die represent the fielding team.  Use the score board and pegs to keep track of each inning and game score.

title: Fast-Break Basketball
description:
Fast-Break Basketball is a dice-rolling game that emulates a three-a-side basketball match

Each player uses three dice to represent their players: forward, center, and guard.  Each die has a custom face with its special symbol.  The game's main mechanic is that an attacker (the one in possession of the ball) succeeds in his or her action by rolling a number higher than or equal to the defender's; special symbols tend to trump numbers.

The dice are placed on the board such that the centers face off against each other, while the forwards go against the guards.  The game starts with a roll-off between the centers.  The winner gains the ball (represented by the offensive marker), which grants a bonus to the attacker's dice rolls.  Only forwards and centers can take shots to score points; the guards steal the ball.  All positions can pass among each other.

The first player to reach an agreed-on score wins and ends the game.

title: Let's Eat Out
description:
Let's Eat Out is (actually) a children's game based on the same mechanics as Candy Land.

Players draw cards depicting various pictures of fast foods. Once a card is drawn, he/she moves his/her playing piece to the next icon on the board with that picture. A special card may be drawn that forces a player to move to one of 6 special squares, which can even be disadvantageous. There are also two shortcuts on the board that bypass certain sections.

The winner is the first player to make it Home (the last space).

title: Airhead
description: Players stack hats on the body while the head floats higher and higher.  Be careful not to let the head fall or the hats fall.

title: Egg Race
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description: Be the first player to land on finish after passing the bridge, the slide, the birdhouse and the merry-go-round while your pawn balances an egg in its spoon.

title: Good Ol' Charlie Brown Game
types: Children's Game Comic Book / Strip Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Be the first player to collect the most picture cards of their character while moving around the board.

title: Snoopy's Doghouse Game
description: Everyone is helping Snoopy build a new doghouse.  All the parts are there but you must spin the spinner to get the parts you need.

title: Velveteen Rabbit Game. The
description: Be the first player to collect one each of the four different picture cards and return along the path to the nursery by exact count.

title: Boggle Jr. Numbers
description: Boggle Jr. Numbers is a childrens game for Ages 3 - 6. Using colorful picture/number cards and eight number cubes they get to play games that teach simple counting, simple addition, and how to make change.

title: Pathfinder
description:
The object of the game is to place plastic ivory tiles on the board to score points by 1) maneuvering the path to CONNECT with Scoring Areas, and 2) making CLOSE OFFS. There are 164 tiles and a playing board with the rules printed inside the lid.

This is not the same as MB's Pathfinder game made in the 70's.

title: The Game of Guided Missile
types: Action / Dexterity Aviation / Flight Fighting Wargame
description: The Game of Guided Missile is basically a small box about 8  x 11 with a sturdy and shiny cardboard insert inside, folded to produce a play AND 2 scoring areas. The play area / board has pictures of various planes sitting on the ground at the airport, and there are holes in the board. The object is to spin a small metal top, trying to get it to land on a hole that sits on a picture of one of the planes, bombing, and thereby eliminating them.

title: Computerized Arcade
description:
This arcade is made up of 12 different games;
1. SONG WRITER: Game memorizes notes that you input and then plays them back.
2. ORGAN: Play the notes on the arcade like an organ.
3. REPEAT: Play the notes in the order that the Arcade plays them.
4. TORPEDO: Try to sink the enemy submarine.
5. TAG-IT: Try to press the buttons as fast as you can after they light up. If you do it quick enough you catch the mole.
6. ROULETTE: Computerized cassino roulette.
7. BASEBALL: A playing board that comes with the game allows you to play Baseball.
8. REPEAT PLUS: You press the button, your friend repeats your button and then adds one then you press the last two buttons and then add one.
9. TREASURE HUNT: Find Ali Baba's 3 treasures.
10. COMPETE: Who can react fastest?
11. FIRE AWAY: Alien invaders must be destroyed.
12. HIDE N' SEEK: Arcade makes 3 color secret code. You try to find it.

This game requires four C batteries.

title: Rocket Race
description:
A vintage game titled as An exciting Space-ship race around the Solar System.

Up to 8 can play. After you have punched out a rocket ship for each player (and the artwork on the playing pieces is awful), everyone has to start at Earth. You have to assemble the Spinner - oops! the Space Compass - and when it is ready, the game can start. Spin the Space Compass and move along the track towards Venus (marked with an A) the amount of spaces that you spun. There are 12 spaces in total with a letter next to them. If you land exactly on one, you must obey the instructions. The first to get back to Earth, wins.

title: Tactilo
description: An educational game where the players use their sense of touch to identify the objects on their own personal game card. Players reach into a bag filled with small wooden objects and try to retrieve one of their pieces without looking into the bag.

title: Battle for the Galaxy: Zylatron
description:
In the year 5,000 in the galaxy of Zylatron, wars are no longer fought.

Supremacy is decided on the Great Board of Zylatron.
When you play the game, you become one of the battle planners of the galaxy of Zylatron. There are 5 main planets in the galaxy- Zull, Amazar, Zarb, Opton,, and the central planet of Zylon.

Your aim is to gain control of the galaxy (ie.control of the board) by landing a warrior on the enemy control headquarters position or by taking off the board all the other players' warriors.

A tactical game, using a colorful gameboard and interlocking playing pieces in the form of battle stars, star fighters, warriors, and missiles.

title: Shoot
description: French hex and counter game of soccer simulation. Includes several teams and a pretty big playing field. Every player has his own stats printed on the counter. Low complexity. Counter and playing field quality are about the same quality as most Steve Jacksson games.

title: Showdown/31
description: A gang of Old West characters greets you on this deck: A Marshal, A Gambler, and A Dance Hall Queen. All ages can play SHOWDOWN/31, but the game can challenge the skills of the best. When a call of SHOWDOWN or LAST DRAW VARMINTS rings out, hang on to your hats.

title: Graduation Card Game
description: This is a card game based on the famous Japanese PC game Graduation. The aim of the game is to provide proper guidance to 5 different girls and help them graduate.

title: The Jetsons Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description: Be the first to collect an Elroy card and all three pieces of the Jetsons family member that matches your pawn.

title: Patty Duke Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Patty and Cathy Duke, the cute look-alike cousin like to do things together.  In this game, the players have fun matching cards of Patty and Cathy doing the same things.
As players move around the path on the board, they try to stop on certain squares so that they can pick a green card showing Patty or Cathy doing the same thing as a red Cathy or Patty card in their own hand.  When a player has matched a green card from the board with a red card from his hand, both cards are discarded and out of the game.  The first player to discard all of his cards is the winner.

title: Double Dragon
description: The winner is the first player to successfully fight his or her way around the game board to Jimmy's Hideout to rescue Marian.  You will pass through the slum section, the industrial section, the forest section and the hideout section on the rocky road to victory.

title: Trolls The Magic Wish Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: There's trouble in Troll Valley, and we need your help.  The nasty, ugly Gools have been capturing Trolls and taking them back to their den.  Please help find the Trolls that are hiding along the valley path and release the captured Trolls from the Den of Gools as the finish.  The player who has the most Trolls when the game ends is the winner.

title: Winter Storm
description:
Winter Storm (a/k/a Winter Sturm) is an operational level game on the battles that were fought in Southern Russia from the time of the Soviet counter-offensive at Stalingrad in November of 1942, through February 1943 and the escape of Kleist's First Panzer Army from the Caucasus.

Map sheets show the area from the Volga River to Taganrog on the Mius River.

800 die cut counters.

Two combat resolution tables.

Some charts on the maps and separate.

Rules book plus a scenarios/campaign booklet.

title: Sandlot Slugger
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Electronic Sports
mechanisms: Area MovementCo-operative PlayHand ManagementPick-up and DeliverSimulationSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
A real action baseball game that can be played indoors and out.  Slugging Sam, the mechanical batter, actually hits the ball.  The player at bat can make Sam hit a high fly, medium fly or a line drive in any direction.  The height of the fly is secretly changed by adjusting the ball holder, and the direction changed by turning batting platform.  
The object of the game is to hit the ball so that it cannot be caught in the air by the players in the field.  This allows the players at bat to move his runners around the bases and score runs.

title: Aladdin: Sounds of Fun Electronic Talking Board Game
types: Arabian Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Join Aladdin's adventure as he tries to rescue sweet Princess Jasmine from the hourglass where the villain Jafar holds her prisoner.

title: Aladdin: The Magic Carpet Game
types: Arabian Children's Game Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description: Aladdin and his friends are in big trouble, but the magic carpet is ready to ride to their rescue.  So climb aboard, and hang on tight for a fun filled flight.  Eight different gameboard scenes feature Jasmine, Aladdin, Abu or Rajah in a nasty jam.  Spin the Genie spinner to catch the carpet for a flying, floating ride around the gameboard.  When you glide to a landing, play the rescue card that matches the scene, if you can.  Get help from the Genie, he'll gladly grant you three wishes.  Play all of your rescue cards and collect the Genie card, and you'll win.

title: Step by Step
description:
Step by Step uses excellent components to create a climbing game requiring thoughtful placement and sound planning. The game board is a square frame holding nicely-made square pieces. To begin, the frame is populated with one level of pieces on all spaces, except for the center on which five pieces are stacked and stabilized with a rod through the middle. Each player gets a large ball that fits on the hole in the pieces, and the starting position is determined based on the number of players (2-4).

With the goal being to get your ball onto the center tower, you progress by moving your ball anywhere on the same level you start and then placing another piece on an adjacent space (adding a level to that space.) You can move down the structure for free as long as you don't skip a level, but once you move onto a higher level in your turn it is over. Using this mechanism, players try to craft a path to the top of the tower that can't be used by others or use their ball as a blocking point to keep someone off the level you need.

title: Cubicado
description:
The cubes are shaken out arbitrarily onto the board, making a pyramid. Any cubes that may be lying on their own on the edge of the board should be placed on the pyramid as well. The wobblier and higher the pyramid, the better. The start player takes the two sticks and we're off!

The aim is to try and get as many cubes off the pile as possible using the sticks (either one or both of them may be used). But be careful! None of the other cubes must move or your turn is over and the next player can try his luck. And one thing's for sure--all of your opponents are going to be watching you with eyes like saucers. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

title: Spitting Image
types: Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Political
description:
The game is based on the popular 80's television series of the same name...

Each player is a world leader with three scandals to protect.  The object of the game is to expose all the other players' scandals before they expose yours.

No dice are involved.  A player may choose to move between one and six spaces clockwise around the board.  The player then follows any special instructions written on the space that he or she lands on (these include collecting a Dirty Tricks Card, collecting a cash handout from the Hush Fund, calling a Press Conference, using the Shredder, hiding in a Safe House, or Passing The Buck).  A non-player character, the Journalist, is moved the same number of spaces clockwise around the board.  If the journalist lands on a space occupied by another player, one of that player's three scandals is placed in the middle of the board and auctioned off to the highest bidder.  The player who wins the scandal card may then try to expose it by first landing on a Press Conference square, and then making an accusation against the player whose scandal it is.  The accuser may choose to blackmail the accused and accept a cash payment in exchange for a temporary reprieve, or the players contest the accusation using Dirty Tricks.  If the accusation is successful, the scandal is removed from the game and the accuser gets $50 Million as a reward.  If unsuccessful, the accused gets a scandal back and receives $10 Million compensation.  Once all a player's scandals are exposed, he or she is out of the game.  If the player who owns the scandal gets to The Shredder before being accused at a Press Conference, he or she takes the unexposed scandal back.  Play continues until only one world leader remains with any unexposed scandals...  He or she is the winner!

title: Crossbows and Catapults: Trojan Horse and Battle Shield
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Fantasy Medieval
description:
The Trojan Horse and Battle Shield expansions add a Trojan Horse Catapult and Battle Shield Crossbow to Crossbows and Catapults.

The expansions were available both separately and as a two part gift set.

The Trojan horse features a tail catapult launcher, and a compartment in the torso of the horse which houses warriors.  When the horse is hit at the front base of the unit, the horse flies open, ejecting its occupants to the ground.

The Battle Shield is a wheel mounted combat platform that mounts a semi-automatic crossbow in its undercarriage.  This is probably the coolest weapon in the game.  Striking the shield (with a catapult) causes the battle shield to explosively destruct by flinging it's shield down and pulling the frame back, ejecting any riders that may be on the shield platform.

May be used in a standalone game or added to CC basic set as an expansion.

CONTENTS: (for the combined set)
1 Trojan Horse
1 Battle Shield
8 Vikings
8 Barbarians
4 red caroms
4 blue caroms
label sheet

title: Crossbows and Catapults Battling Giants: Cyclops and Minotaur
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Fantasy Medieval
description:
The Battling Giants expansion adds a Cyclops and Minotaur to Crossbows and Catapults.

The expansions were available both separately and as a two part gift set.

The Cyclops is a catapult based carom launcher that holds a carom in its hands and is spring loaded to launch the carom when a button is pressed on its back.

The Minotaur is similar to the cyclops except that it loads its carom in its horns.

May be used in a standalone game or added to CC basic set as an expansion.

CONTENTS: (for the combined set)
1 Minotaur
1 Cyclops
4 red caroms
4 blue caroms
8 barbarians
8 vikings
label sheet

title: Jack Diamond Electronic Blackjack
description: Jack Diamond is more than just an electronic dealer - he's also a coach. Listen to the tips from this remarkable talking electronic blackjack dealer. He talks beginners through basic plays, gives helpful hints to intermediate players and mixes up the game a bit for experts. Turn your boring Black Jack game into a casino experience with Jack's colorful commentaries and blackjack lingo.Jack Diamond knows who's who and deals out the cards accordingly. With a scanning eye and bar-coding technology, he reads the value and suit of all the cards and keeps track of who has what and what the totals are. Take Jack's advice when he says things like You've got a 17. Would you like to hit or stay? The book says you should stay or Stay if you have 17 or above and you don't have an ace or a pair. Includes electronic card dealer, chip tray, two decks of bar-coded playing cards, 90 casino chips and instruction booklet.

title: Piratengold
description:
Translated from German spielbox.de:

An exciting board and card game for adventuresome sailors. The fantastic island world of Nyria: Since ancient times sunken treasures and valuable artifacts lie on the bottom of the Nyrian Sea. Adventurous sailors look for lost treasures, in order to attain fame and fortune. They must brave the elements of nature with their sailing boats and their magic powers. They are incessantly provoked by wind and waves and must resist other ambitious treasure hunters. Only under the wise employment of their magic and their sailing abilities will the adventurers succeed in raising the treasures and bringing them into their home port safely.

title: BANG! Dodge City
types: American West Bluffing Card Game Deduction Expansion for Base-game Fighting
description:
Unknown gunmen stalk the city. Try to keep away from them...and for safety's sake be sure to wear a metal plate!

BANG! Dodge City, the second expansion for BANG!, features new characters and cards allowing for play with as few as three players or as many as eight (thanks to a second Renegade card). Dodge City contains two decks of cards to be shuffled together with the original deck. Do you have the cold blood it takes to visit Dodge City?

title: Handicap
description:
The double colored wooden pegs are placed at random in rows in the spaces between the fingers of the hand sculpture, and the hoop is placed over the thumb. Players positions themselves around the hand so that they each can see only one side of the hand and thus only one end and one color of the wooden pegs.

Each player tries to take as many matching pegs (both colors must match) as possible from out of the hand. Here, of course, is where the Handicap comes in. Only the player skilled enough to extract the pairs of pegs of his choice, without letting the others fall out, is likely to win. If the player is successful he can put these pegs aside for the moment.

These pegs are ideally kept until the end of the game, but may be lost during the game if the player is challenged to a Hoop-la Duel. The player can also increase his own collection of pegs by challenging opponents with the same color combination as his own to a duel. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

title: Battlegame Armada
description: This is a unique game, and comes with an oversized book written by Jon Sutherland and Simon Farrell. The game is a simulation of the struggle between the navies and armies of Great Britain and Spain the summer of 1588. Spain wins by occupying London after defeating any English troops in the town. England wins when Spain has no armies left that can reach London and attack. Of course the easiest way for England to achieve this end is to defeat the Spanish Armada.

title: Dirty Xmas
description:
It is Christmas Eve and the eve of Santa Claus's retirement.  Players are competing to succeed him by delivering the most and best presents.  The game is played over twelve rounds, representing the twelve chimes of midnight.  On a round a player must perform any combination of three actions from a total of four possibles or pass, discard and refill. Essentially the actions are place scoring cards (deliver presents) or interfere with your opponents' deliveries. Event cards turn up which affect everyone immediately.  The winner is the player who after the twelfth chime has the highest total of present points in his display, with rules for tie-breaks. A variant is suggested giving a variable game length by shuffling the chime cards into the deck.

By the way, despite the curious title, the game is perfectly suitable for family play!

Home Page : http://www.monpetitcoin.com/createurs/xmas/

title: Crossbows and Catapults Dragon
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Fantasy Medieval
description:
Dragon expansion adds the green dragon to Crossbows and Catapults.  The dragon acts like a Catapult in the game (though I feel it is slightly more accurate than the actual catapults).  The dragon also adds the wizard carom, which is used for special rules in game play.

May be used in a standalone game or added to CC basic set as an expansion.

CONTENTS:
1 Dragon, 4 Warriors(2 each), 6 battle caroms, 2 wizard caroms, label sheet

title: Tunnel Rats: The Escape From TERROR CAVE
types: Adventure Animals Children's Game Comic Book / Strip Electronic Exploration
description:
Players play one of four humanoid Tunnel Rats, each represented by a painted plastic miniature. The rats are trying to find their way out of an ancient underground city through the use of an electronic compass. The pyramid shaped compass contains 16 different maps for the maze board and shows players if they hit an invisible wall (counters are included to represent the walls). The first player to navigate their way out of the maze wins.

Includes special Tunnel Rats Adventure comic book to assist with the theme of the game.

Similar to Lost Treasure, Dark Tower or Electronic Dungeons and Dragons

From Box:
Trapped by a landslide in an ancient underground city, the Tunnel Rats must find their way to the secret passage that will take them back to the surface before their supplies are exhausted. Although there are 16 different routes to the hidden tunnel, they are enclosed by invisible walls that can only be detected by the Tunnel Rats' ELECTRONIC compass.

Determined to be the first to reach the surface, each of the Tunnel Rats takes a starting position on the map of the ruined city. Then the ELECTRONIC compass is turned on and selects one of the secret routes. The first to escape through the secret passage is the winner!

Gameboard is 15x15 grid.

title: Track & Trap
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Players move their elephant mounted hunting parties about a jungle-hunt themed board by using a spinner that dictates their movement as well as special spaces on the board.  Players are hunting a tiger that moves about randomly on the board through cards drawn by players on their turn.  The player that captures the tiger wins.

An attractively painted hunting scene on the board makes the game a nice display piece, but gameplay leaves a great deal to be desired.

title: Lunch Money: Sticks and Stones
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Fighting
description:
This 55-card expansion set is designed to be mixed in with the original Lunch Money card game. New weapons like Chunk, basic attacks like Spank and Evil Eye, defenses like Backlash and Hide, and specialty cards like Tantrum, Cooties, and Wedgy make Lunch Money: Sticks  Stones a necessity for every Lunch Money fan.

Expands

    Lunch Money

title: Kesselring
description:
From the introduction-'Kesselring is a simulation for 2 players of the Allied invasion of southern Italy in late 1943. One player controls the Axis forces led by Field Marshal Albert Kesselring and the other assumes the role of his historical opponent Field Marshal Bernard Law Montgomery. This was first presented in The Wargamer Magazine issue 5, and then released as a boxed edition.

The components consist of the following: a 20 by 30 4-COLOR paper mapsheet; a 4-pages thick paper RULES booklet; a set of 182 cardboard counters; and players will have to provide their own 6-sided DIE prior to play.

The Mapsheet covers an area from just past Rome, south to the 'tip'  'heel' of the Italian peninsula. Also on the Mapsheet are lettered boxes (A-F), directional boxes (NW, NE), a 'Sicily' box, Combat Results Table A  B, Bombardment Results Table, Terrain Defense Value Chart, Allied  German Replacement Points Tracks, German, U.S., British,  Allied Battlegroups boxes, Terrain Effects Chart, Turn Record Track (from Sept.8-'43~Dec.22-'43~each a week long) with Reinforcements/Replacements indicated, German  Allied (?) boxes,  a circular 'Phase Indicator' for use. The COLORS used are BLUE- (Water features), Light BROWN- (Mountain), BROWN- (Roads),  BLACK- (Town/City, Marsh, High Peak, Beaches, Minor/Major Airbases, Intrinsic Supply Source, and the lettering)-there are also places to indicate at Airbases where units on 'On Ground' or 'In Air'.

The game counters are Light GRAY- (Germans, Italians), YELLOW- (British), BROWN-Allied (NZ, Canadians, Indians, French, Italians), GREEN- (U.S.), all with BLACK print on them. There are also some 'silhouette' counters for Artillery, Anti-Aircraft, Fighters, Bombers, Naval, Bridge, Ambush, Demolition, Advanced Airfield, Forts, and other informational markers in various COLORS. There are also 'Break-down (from larger to many smaller units), and 'Battle-group (Remnants) counters included.

The Game Turn consists of the following phases with the Allied Player moving first: 1.Headquarters Phase-BOTH Players determine the disposition of these; 2.Weather Determination Phase; 3.Allied Movement Phase; 4.German Strategic Movement Phase; 5. Allied Tactical Movement Phase; 6.BOTH Players Conduct Bombardments; 7.Allied Combat Phase; 8.Allied Replacements  Reinforcements Phase; 9.German Movement Phase; 10.Allied Strategic Movement Phase; 11.German Tactical Movement Phase; 12.BOTH Players Conduct Bombardments; 13.German Combat Phase; 14.German Replacements  Reinforcements Phase.

Some of the 'Special' Rules cover: Weather; 'Hidden' movement (the lettered boxes-A-F  the [?] counters); Movement from the 'Off-Board' areas Sicily- (Allies),  N.W., N.E.~boxes- (Germans only); Sea Movement/Transfer/Invasions; Naval Guns Support; Ports  Beachheads; Destruction of Ports  Beachhead Supply; Demolitions  Ambushes; Para-drops (Allied only); Forts Construction (Germans only); Commandoes; and the Air Module. OPTIONAL Rules include: Invasion Shore Battery Rule, Optional German Order of Battle, and German Security Units  Engineer's Constructions. An Alternative Scenario is: EAST Coast Invasion. There are also some Clarifications, Errata, and Design  Player's Notes included on the inside last page.

title: MooT
description:
Moot bills itself as the 'toughest word game ever'. Self-published, it has come in various boxes over the years, from cigar boxes to blue and silver cardboard.

Each team (or individual player when playing with a smaller group) rolls a 12-sided die. For 1-3, a Red question is asked, for 4-6 a Green one, for 7-9 a Yellow one, and for 10-12 a Blue one. Each question is worth the number rolled on the die.

The questions are devilishly hard and sometimes feature trick questions. Examples: Which part, the bowl or the grinder, is the mortar? In medieval times, the first hay cut in the season was called the Math. What was the second cut called? (Answer: Aftermath) Most deal with word origins and obscure knowledge. Each card also features a small tidbit of information about the answer.

The first player or team to get to 31 points is the winner. Replay value of the game is somewhat limited since only a single question set was ever produced, but the game is well worth picking up. A nice cerebral change from the usual Trivial Pursuit-type games.

Home Page: http://www.mootgame.com/

title: Picnic Panic
mechanisms: Hand ManagementPattern RecognitionSimultaneous Action SelectionTile Placement
description: Try to rid your hand of food items by placing one on the board each turn until the picnic basket explodes and sends plastic ants everywhere.  If the basket explodes on your turn, you must pick up all the cards that the ants land on.

title: Snardvark
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverPoint to Point MovementSimultaneous Action Selection
description: This is one hungry Snardvark, and hes keeping his eyes out for snacks of some crunchy little snards-just like yours. By moving your snard according to the colors that flip up in the Snardvarks eyes, youre trying to be the first one to race all the way to the tip of his tongue and pop off of it before he can pop you in his mouth.

title: Silly Dillys
description: The Silly Dillys are plastic slinkies with a head on one end and suction cup feet on the other.  Players try to pick up pickle discs with their silly dilly to score points.

title: Exorbitare
mechanisms: Area Control / Area InfluenceDice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSimulation
description:
The game is based on the energy levels within an atom, and it is played on a board representing the Periodic Table of the Elements.  The squares making up the orbits are numbered according to the atomic numbers of the elements from Hydrogen (1) to radon (86).

The number of counters a player has depends on the number of players.  Two players have eight counters each, three players have six counters each, and four players have four counters each.

Players take turns to roll both dice.  The scores obtained on the dice may be used as a total, or as individual dice scores, to move the player's pieces to their best advantage.  For each six thrown, the player may move one piece into play, and roll that dice again.  The player does not have to move a piece into play unless he or she has no pieces in play already.

The players move their pieces along the track until they complete a circuit and land directly on a jump square.  When a piece lands on a jump square it is elevated to the next highest quantum level.  When a piece moves up a level, the controlling player gets an extra roll of one dice.

If a player's piece lands on the same square as an opponent's piece, Blatting occurs.  The piece that is Blatted moves down one energy level whilst the piece doing the Blatting moves up a level.  If a player's piece passes an opponents piece, Zapping occurs.  The piece that is Zapped moves down one energy level, but the piece that Zapped it does not move up.  A piece that is Zapped can Blat any piece that it lands on.  Thus both Blatting and Zapping are subject to chain-reaction.

To win the game a Quantum Jump must be achieved.  This is done by having a piece positioned on the yellow flash square, situated in the fourth energy band, at the same time as there are exactly half the total available number of player-counters in play.

title: Glory
description: Glory embodies a new, fresh experience in bible study and Christian living.  The object of the game is to enter glory and be with the Lord.

title: Guess My Name Game
description: You know the difficulties of trying to describe an item in short and accurate words without using your hands. Players try to guess what the player who is it is describing.  The first to correctly guess the object places a marker on it, and the first to correctly guess 5 objects wins the game. The idea of this game is to guess items which are described by a co-player quickly and correctly in order to get rid of 5 play stones first.

title: Blarney
description: Object of the game is to get the most scoring chips by convincing other players that your invented definition of an obscure word is the real definition.

title: Junior Trivia
description:
This children's game was released at the height of the Trivial Pursuit craze, and is suitable as a stand alone game, or as an addition to other trivia games.

There are 2,592 questions, which are broken down into the following categories:
1. Entertainment/Famous People
2. Sports/Games
3. Science/Computers
4. Literature/Art/Words
5. Geography/Space
6. History/Traditions

The questions are further divided into two skill levels: Level 1 (Ages 5 - 9) and Level 2 (Ages 10 - 13)

This is an excellent game for young trivia buffs.

title: The Smurfs Whirl & Twirl Clumsy Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Comic Book / Strip Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Try to beat Gargamel and your opponents at this exciting card game by matching Smurf character cards to your Smurf playing boards.  Spin the Smurf card dealer and take character cards from Smurf or your opponents.  Give away or trade cards in order to get matching cards before Gargamel wins.

This game is sort of a Lotto game combined with the card shooter from UNO Attack!.  When Clumsy turns towards you, he'll give you a card... it pops out from his gift box. If you need the card, place it on one of your playing boards. Special cards let you trade. Be the first to get all the Smurfs you need to win!

title: Dennis the Menace
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Be the first player to capture Switchblade Sam.  Youll need to collect rope, tape and your wagon in order to capture him.

title: Ask Zandar
description:
This is a game for 1-4 pre-teen to early teenage girls.  On their turn, each player draws a question card, reads it out loud, guesses whether Zandar (an electronic talking version of the old Magic 8 Ball) will answer affirmatively or negatively, waves their hand over the top of Zandar's globe (to trigger a light sensor), and listens to his answer.  If they guessed correctly, they can either take a gem of their color from the pile and put it in front of them or place a gem of their color from in front of them onto the game board.  If they guess incorrectly, they must return a gem from in front them.

The other players can make a side bet during the turn and guess at Zandar's answer.  If they are right, they get a gem of their color.  If they are wrong, they must return a gem of their color.

There's a few other rules to the game, but that is main gist of it.  The first player to place 5 of their gems onto the game board wins and gets to have their fortune read by Zandar.

A highly random game meant mostly as a conversation starter for those playing.

title: Alhambra: The Vizier's Favor
description:
Subtitled as the first extension for Alhambra, The Vizier's Favor (Die Gunst des Wesirs) is as a matter of fact a collection of four separate extensions that can be mixed with the base game in any combination.

1. The primary module is The Vizier's Favor, which allows players to buy a building out of turn but has to be paid with exact amount.

2. The Builders Huts (Die Bauhtte) introduces a number of new tiles that only count in the scoring when other tiles of the same color are built next to them. Hut tiles are free, but their number is limited to three per player.

3. With the The Currency Exchange (Wechselstube), players can buy building tiles by mixing different currencies.

4. The fourth module is a set of bonus cards that are dealt to the players. Each of the tiles shows a particular building. If the matching building is part of your Alhambra, then the bonus card can be revealed and will count as another building of that category.

Owners of the first edition of the game (titled only Alhambra) will notice that the color scheme of the Currency Exchange  does not agree with their currency cards: later editions of the game had differently colored currency cards that can be more easily distinguished from each other.

Expands:

    Alhambra

title: Sjöfartspelet
mechanisms: Modular BoardPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Players take the part of captains of cargo ships transporting merchandise over the Nordic sea during the WWII. The board is perforated and placed over an undulated plastic landscape so that certain areas become shallow. For each of the four different orientations of the board there is a map depicting the shallow areas. 
Two patrol boats move randomly around the board  and the players try to avoid them. Each transport is worth money and points, the first player to reach 25 points and 300.000 Swedish crowns is the winner.

title: The Gumby Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Help Gumby, Pokey, Prickle and Goo find their Groobee friends.  Collect the most Groobee cards as you race to the finish space.

title: The Tiny Tim Game of Beautiful Things
description: The object of the game is to collect beautiful things.  When all of the cards are removed from the playing board, each player totals up his points, the player with the most points is the winner.

title: Where's the Beef?
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Where's the beef is a combination roll and move/memory game.  Food tiles are randomly placed faced down on the board, which is the layout of a typical Wendy's.  Players take turns moving through the restaurant.  When they come across a face down tile they can secretly look at it. Some tiles prescribe certain actions.  Others are food, and have no effect.  Afterward the player returns the tile to the original position. The object is to be the first player to find the 4 hidden The Beef tokens.  When a player believes he knows the locations, he or she announces it, and attempts to flip over all 4 beef tiles.  Failure to do so results in a loss, success results in a win.

title: A Day With Ziggy Game
description: A game where anything can happen and usually does, from the popular comic strip by Tom Wilson.  Ziggy's day is full of many misadventures.  Be the first player to get back to start.

title: Clue Little Detective
description: Be the first little detective to make it from Start in the attic, through the mansion, and out the kitchen door to the safety of the front gate at the Finish.

title: The Little Engine That Could
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description: Players try to obtain toy tokens that match their train car card.  The first player to reach the Town space with a full toy train card wins.

title: The Berenstain Bears Messy Room Game
mechanisms: Hand ManagementPattern RecognitionPick-up and DeliverTile Placement
description: It's a challenging competition to clean up the messiest room in all bear country, brother and sister's outrageous room.  Just be the first to fill your puzzle frame with all nine clean pieces and you win.

title: The Waltons Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
The Waltons Game is a card game that uses images from a 1970s television series.  Its main mechanic involves completing a scene from the show printed on Place cards with the quadrants of that scene printed on Scene cards.

Taking turns, players draw cards into their hand and play them under the rule that Place cards are always played if in hand.  John Boy cards can be used to complete a set if the set already has 3 matching Scene cards.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the round, scoring 1 point for each card in the other players' hands.  The next round then begins anew.  The game ends when a player attains 25 total points, making that player the winner.

title: The Tammy Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: The object of the game is to rearrange your original Tammy cards into a 3 card run and a 4 card run by keeping useful cards and discarding those not needed, always maintaining 7 cards in your hand.  A run is a group of the same Tammy cards.

title: The Wizard of Oz Game
types: Children's Game Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
There's no place like home, there's no place like home... if you have Magic.

In this spin-and-move children's game based on The Wizard of Oz movie by MGM, players race for Home. The key to winning, however, is to arrive Home with a Magic Card in hand. The board depicts colorful characters and places in Oz from the MGM movie, an annual television favorite to recreate Dorothy's magical trip through Oz.

Setup: give each player a pawn and set the 4 Magic Cards on Home.

Play is simple. Youngest player goes first. On her turn, the player spins the spinner. If the spinner points to a number, she moves her pawn that many spaces along the track:


     If the space her pawn lands on is unoccupied and has instructions for continuing the move such as to go ahead or move back a certain number of spaces, follow those instructions immediately.
     If the space her pawn lands on is unoccupied and has an M on it, the player receives a Magic card if she doesn't already have one, or returns her magic to the pile at Home if she does.
     If the space she lands on is already occupied (except Home - only Home may be occupied by more than one pawn), she must move her pawn back until she reaches an unoccupied space. When a player has to move back like this, any instructions on the space she moves back to are ignored.


If the spinner arrow points to Magic Card instead of a number, the player takes a Magic Card if she doesn't have one, or returns her Magic Card if she already has one.

Play continues until someone reaches Home with a Magic Card. If a player reaches Home, but does not have a Magic Card, she can stay there, taking her turn as usual until she spins a Magic Card or another player reaches Home with a Magic Card (or without and spins one first).

There no place like Home.

title: Cabbage Patch Kids Bicycle Race Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Who will win the Tour de Cabbage, the greatest bike race ever?  Which cabbage patch kid will pedal past all the others.  Steer your rider through the gameboard countryside.  But every time you land on a cabbage, look underneath.  The hidden pictures tells you where to go.  It could be a shortcut to the apple orchard or you might get sent back for bike repairs.

title: Gooses Wild
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description: From Start position, players move around spiral of consecutively numbered spaces, observing rules as indicated. First player to move onto space no. 63 by exact count is individual winner, collecting all counters in pot and on the board. The winner then receives a reward from all opponents for each of their counters he has won and counters are returned to their owner before starting next game.

title: M*A*S*H Game
types: Children's Game Medical Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description: Hawkeye Pierce, Major Margaret Houlihan, B.J. Hunnicutt, and Klinger of the M*A*S*H Team, are hard at work once again bringing wounded safely to the chopper pad so the injured can start their journey home.  It's up to you to rescue at least six wounded and get a complete chopper to the chopper pad by moving along the path, in either direction.  You do this by trying to land on M*A*S*H spaces where you can collect wounded and chopper parts.  But be careful, some of the M*A*S*H cards on the M*A*S*H spaces can hinder your rescue mission.  The supply depot can help you complete your chopper so you can make a speedy escape to the chopper pad and send your wounded safely home.  Beware of the fire zone spaces where you will lose a turn and possibly lessen your chances or rescuing your wounded and getting your chopper.  So select your favorite M*A*S*H character from the gameboard, roll the die and begin your rescue mission.

title: Combat Tank Game
types: Children's Game Fighting World War II
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Each player spins for a color tank and a starting space.  Players move in only one direction for each spin except diagonally.  Only one tank per space and no tank can be jumped.  If your tank lands on an enemy space, you must fight by spinning the spinner for the outcome.  The first tank to reach H.Q. wins.

title: Gnomes
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Have you ever seen a Gnome before?  Would you like to?  In this game, you and your opponents travel through Gnomeland looking for the elusive little creatures.  Whoever finds the most Gnomes is the winner.  But beware, the path through Gnomeland can be dangerous, especially when you meet a Troll, the enemy of all Gnomes.

title: Tis The Season: Christmas Trivia
description:
A Christmas-themed trivia game.

The six categories are:
History, Facts, and Figures
Traditions Around the World
Cartoons, Animation, Made for Television Movies, Specials
Carols and Songs
Movies on the Silver Screen
Literature and the Performing Arts

The cards are color-coded and can be used with other trivia games. It contains 1800 Christmas questions. It includes independent game rules.

Examples of the questions:
What romantic tradition did England save while others allowed it to perish? What is Scrooge's favorite two-word phrase?

To play the game one player or teams asks questions of another player or team. (For one player, read the question and answer it without looking at the answer.) If they get it correct, they get asked another question in the next category. If they get it wrong, play moves to the next player or team. The winner is the first person to get enough questions correct to spell the word CHRISTMAS.

title: Peanut Butter & Jelly
description:
Let's race to see who'll be first to match the pieces and make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich in proper sandwich order. Players use a spinner to acquire sandwich components: bread, peanut butter, and jelly.

This is apparently a different game than Peanut Butter & Jelly, which also had an edition from Parker Brothers in 1971.

title: Portsmouth Harbour Trail Game
description:
From the publisher:
Each American Adventure Game has 11*17 game board. All playing pieces are easily cut out and folded or assembled by you. A dice or a spinner is included, along with complete rules which have interpretive information to help you get the most from your game.
Travel the Portsmouth Harbour Trail in competitive game of fun and learning. Experience Portsmouth through four centuries of maritime, architectural and social history.

title: Re-Loaded Questions
description:
Re-Loaded Questions offers 128 new question cards to use in place of or alongside the standard Loaded Questions cards. There is no change to gameplay other than the opportunity for more questions.

Expands:

    Loaded Questions

title: Baseball Card Game
description:
From the box:

Hit! Run! Score! An action packed card game based on Major League strategy.

title: LEGO EXPLORE: My First Builder
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Memory
description:
Player turn over one brick card on each turn and try to match the card with a brick they need to complete a Lego animal project.  The first player to complete their animal wins.

Awards

2003 Årets Børnespil, Childrens Game of the Year Denmark

title: Crossado
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveTile Placement
description:
Each player receives four stones in one color and places them in the corner of the board corresponding to his/her color.

There are two phases.
In the first phase the players place bridges. First the start player places a bridge and then the next player, until all the bridges have been placed on the board.

In the second phase the players roll the die and move their stones along the bridges. Each round only one stone can be moved. The stones can be placed on free spaces only. The players have to move the exact amount of spaces indicated by the die. If a player can't move, he/she has to roll the die three times. If the player doesn't roll a 1 or 6, his/her turn is over.
When the player rolls a 1 or 6, he/she can remove a bridge and place the bridge wherever he/she wants.

The first player to move his/her four stones to the other side of the board wins the game.

title: 3quence
types: Deduction Educational Puzzle Trivia Word Game
description:
3quence is a quaint word based puzzle solving game. Players use a cluefinder (gadget) that holds puzzle cards. The cluefinder has sliding windows that hide and reveal clues printed on the puzzle cards. Players try to guess the answer words based on the clues available. Several types of clues are available and you are allowed to reveal them in any order you wish.

The game feels very similar to scattegories and tribond with a family feud boardgame feel to the cluefinder.

The box tag line:
 A word game.
A knowledge game.
A thinking game. 

Sample puzzle:
Category sample 3quence
----------------- ----------------------
States of the USA Florida, Georgia, Hawaii
mammals lemur, lion, llama
familiar words point, poise, poison

clues might include: for mammals - animals that start with l, or for familiar words - words that start with poi

title: Texas Trivia
description:
A Texas flavored version of a Trivia game.

Players move about the board answering questions to collect tokens AND money (must have one of each token and at least a million bucks to win) in a bid to claim they are as big as Texas.

Trivia questions are asked from one of 5 color coded books that relate to different topics on Texas.

Though not explicitly stated, the game requires at least 5 players or 5 teams of players in order to actually play the game.

Very tongue in cheek handling of Trivia based gaming.

From box:
Rustle up your compadres and kinfolk and you'll have more fun than a thirsty Texan at a Margarita convention.  Try your skill at 5,000 questions in five categories: Texas Sports, Entertainment, No Place but Texas, Cities and Towns, and Lone Star Legends.  It aint easy, Bubba.  You'll hit some dry holes in this game, but you gotta keep drillin' away at the trivia questions till you hit your gusher.  And if you love Texas, you'll strike it rich with Texas Trivia.

title: The Black Hole: Voyage of Fear Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing Science Fiction
description:
Spin the spinner, pray to be the winner.

The Black Hole movie themed game board features a spin and move mechanism with numbered squares with special instructions.  First one to finish line wins.

Includes special dial wheel spinner gadget to spin for movement and dial special instructions.

title: Desert Victory
description:
From the rule booklet.

Desert Victory is a realistic simulation of modern tactical combat that puts you in the role of the commander of a US battalion task force or an Iraqi brigade.  Desert Victory simulates combat in a playable, realistic manner.  Units in Desert Victory represent platoons and sections.  Losses are expressed in individual vehicles and fire teams or squads.  The scale of the map is 250 meters to a square.  Game turns represent ten minutes of actual time.

title: Main Battle Area
description:
From the rule booklet.

Main Battle Area is a realistic simulation of modern tactical combat that puts you in the role of a US battalion task force or Soviet regimental commander.  Main Battle Area simulates combat in a playable, realistic manner.  Units in Main Battle Area represent platoons and sections.  Losses are expressed in individual vehicles and fire teams or squads.  The scale of the map is 250 meters to a square.  Game turns represent ten minutes of actual time.

title: Napoleon's Battles Module 1
types: Dice Expansion for Base-game Fighting Miniatures Napoleonic Wargame

title: Napoleon's Battles Module 2
types: Dice Expansion for Base-game Fighting Miniatures Napoleonic Wargame

title: Napoleon's Leipzig Campaign
description:
Napoleon's Leipzig Campaign is an operational simulation of the great struggle in 1813 for mastery in Europe. The game allows players to assume the role of Napoleon or the Prussian, Austrian, and Russian monarchs who led the coalition determined to eliminate the Napoleonic hegemony.

Napoleon's Leipzig Campaign recreates the salient features of military operations of this period in an easy to learn, playable, challenging and evenly balanced simulation.

Features:
-Army headquarters rated for span of command, tactical abilities and independent command

-Corps units rated for span of command, tactical abilities, independent command, troop morale, and training

-A combat system that integrates leadership, troop quality and morale, employment of reserves and calvary, demoralization, rout and pursuit

-The ability to use calvary in historical roles such as screening, pursuit, and raids

-An operational maneuver map that historically recreates troop marching abilities, restricted lines of communication, the role of fortresses, and the impact of weather

-Careful integration of weather, logistics, movement, and attrition into a playable game system

-Realistic command control restrictions that simulate handicaps and advantages of the respective opponents

-Introductory and Campaign scenarios

-Suitability for use as a campaign game for miniatures players

-Enjoyable solitaire playability

title: Iron Brigade
description:
Sub-title: Its Finest Hour at Gettysburg', and is about this Unit's involvement during the 1st Day of the epic 3-Day Battles that followed. The IRON Brigade at this point, consisted of the following Units: the 19th Indiana Regiment, the 24th Michigan Regiment, plus the 2nd,  7th Wisconsin Regiments commanded by Brig.Gen. -Solomon Meredith, with elements of the 142nd  151st Pennsylvania Regiments. The 6th Wisconsin Regiment had been a part of the original Brigade but had been 'absorbed' due to previous losses into the other units while the 24th Michigan was added later on. They were also known as the 'Black Hat' Brigade due to their distinctive head apparel and were well respected among their foes  peers. There is an excellent photo-depiction of a 're-enactment' group in full uniform on the front cover of the game box complete with their 'ostrich plumed' hats!

The components consist of the following: a thin 'book-case' style cardboard box; a RULES Booklet; a 7-COLOR 17 by 22 paper Map sheet; 2-Sets of cardboard counters (200 total);  Players must provide their OWN (2)~6-sided DICE prior to playing. This is considered to be of Moderate Complexity according to its authors. The game scale is given as: 30-yards across per HEX; Elevation intervals of 10~20-feet; each Strength Point=15-Men; and 1-Turn=6-Minutes.

On the Map sheet are: the Battle Area of a portion of McPherson's Ridge about 1-Mile West of Gettysburg; the Sequence of Play; a Game Turn Track with the 2-Scenarios displayed (a separate Morning~7-Turns  an Afternoon~10-Turns);  a Terrain Key. There are (4)-shades of BROWN to depict varying Elevations as well as Light TAN for the lowest, BLUE for Stream,  GREEN for Woods, while Fences  Contour lines are in BROWN. The Game counters are printed Front  Back with Light BLUE with BLACK print for the Union,  Light GRAY with RED  BLACK print for the Confederates (RED-Morning Scenario, BLACK-Afternoon), and WHITE with RED  BLACK print for informational, replacement Officers,  Strength Point markers.
