mechanisms: Area Control / Area InfluenceArea MovementDice Rolling
description: This game is a variant of the Britannia system, this time set in ancient Italy from 2000 to 200 BC.  Units include Infantry, Archers (really elite infantry), Cavalry and Leaders.

title: Leonardo & Co: The Amazing Science Quiz
description:
A trivia board game where the participants answer multiple choice science questions from one of three question books: Exact Sciences, Biomedical Sciences and Social Sciences.
The questions are often science problems requiring knowledge of scientific principles instead of simple memorization.

title: Camouflage
types: Abstract Strategy Card Game World War I
description:
Camouflage is a card game from 1918 comprised of three games: 

    Camouflage
    Young America Battle Game and Tactics
    Militac




The cards consist of suits of Infantry, Cavalry, Artillery, Engineering Corps and Ammunition. There is also a President Card. Each suit is numbered from 1 to 11. The President card is unique.

Camouflage is a trick taking game for 2 to 6 players. The object of the game is to take as few ammunition cards as possible.

Young America Battle Game and Tactics is for four players every man for himself. The President and Engineering Corps cards are removed from the deck.
The player to the left of the dealer looks for an ammunition card in his hand and if there is one, throws it face up on the table with a spinning motion. He then decides in which direction the card points. The players not pointed to by the card, play cards which are then taken by the person it is pointing to. Continue until all cards are played. Whichever player has the highest points wins the round. The first player to win three rounds wins.

Militac is for four players in two teams of two. In this game the Infantry, Cavalry, Artillery and Engineering Corps cards are used. In this game, there is bidding as in bridge for the number of tricks or corps that can be taken. The first side securing 50 points wins the game.

title: Palio di Siena
description:
From the rules:

The Palio di Siena is a horse race that is held every year at Siena (Italy) on 2 July and 16 August. Ten horses, representing ten districts (of Siena's seventeen), take part in the race.

Simple family game based on one of most famous horse race in the world. Rules in 5 languages.

title: King Kong
mechanisms: Area MovementDice RollingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
This was a tie-in product released with the 1976 remake of King Kong and the box features promotional art from the movie poster.

In this Roll and Move game, players make their way towards King Kong to prevent him from reaching the top of the World Trade Center. King Kong defends himself by spinning and knocking players off the board. Cards can help or hinder players in their mission.

A player wins if he successfully completes five attack missions on King Kong before he reaches the top of the World Trade Center OR if he is the first to complete on attack mission and the Special Mission (rescue the girl in King Kong's right hand).

From the rules:

King Kong is climbing the World Trade Center.  Can you stop him?  As a member of a special attack team, you go up the building after him.  If you can successfully attack him five times, you'll win.  But make one false move and the giant beast will twist and turn to knock you off the board.  Then you must start again.  Suspense mounts as he nears the top.  Who will win?

You...another player or the Mighty KING KONG!?

title: Frederick the Great
types: Age of Reason American Revolutionary War Miniatures Wargame
description: 56 pages of miniatures rules and 6 pages of tables for the Seven Years War with rules for adapting to the American Revolution and the Age of Marlborough.  Scale is 50 men or two guns per figure, 50 yards per inch, and 10 minutes per turn.  No scenarios, but several pages of general army lists.

title: Play and Defend Bridge
description: Pre-determined Hands  are quickly dealt out to the four players. Each hand is given a Goren Bidding and Response Aid which indicates the Dealer and Vulnerability for each hand. These Aids can also be used by the less experienced player as guides in Bidding and Responding. The hands are bid in the normal way. Then bidding can be compared to Gorens suggested bids as indicated on the back of each players aid. The hands are then played according to Gorens Contract. The cards are kept separated in designated spaces on the Game Sheet so they can be  re-played  and compared to Gorens Analysis. Score can be kept to show each partnerships efforts against the suggested Contract.

title: Beginner's Bridge
description: The instructions are so arranged that the beginner progresses in easy steps, gradually learning to play Bridge. At the end, the novice will have learned the Goren Point Count System of playing, which is universally accepted wherever Bridge is played. This system was devised by Charles H. Goren, the worlds leading expert and authority on Bridge, whose aim was to make Bridge EASY and FUN for everyone. This is the way Beginners Bridge works: The book contains step by step directions on playing Bridge. After each step, you will be directed to the Bridge Tutor for some examples to illustrate how the information you have just learned is used. The Bridge Tutor is a device that eliminates the other three players needed to play Bridge! Thus, you can practice by yourself and yet actually simulate a four handed game. You progress, at your own pace, by simply following the easy directions in the book and playing the different hands in the Tutor.

title: Cookie Cop
mechanisms: Hand ManagementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Place the game board on the table. Place the stand in the center and put Officer Longarm onto it. Fit a cookie in each of the 24 slots.

Flip the switch on and press Officer Longarm on his hat. He'll start turning this way and that. Then roll the die.

If you roll a solid color, you can grab a matching cookie while avoiding Officer Longarm's arms. If you roll the rainbow, you can grab one of any color. If you roll the burglar, you can steal one from its opponent.

To grab a cookie, the trick is to avoid Officer Longarm's arms. It's not easy because they will move this way and that. Wait for the best time and quickly grab it out of the slot. If his arms don't touch you, you can keep it. Otherwise, he'll touch you, stop spinning, and his hat will pop up. He then shouts, Hey, put that back!.

When you get caught, you have to put the cookie back.

The first player who collects the required number of cookies wins the game. 
- 6 players: 4 cookies
- 5 players: 5 cookies
- 2-4 players: 6 cookies

title: Passport
description: Before you can scale Mount Everest or stroll the Champs Elysees you have to know where in the world they are.  So get your bags packed and your travel documents in order.  You are about to embark on a journey that could take you anywhere from Beijing to Santiago.  And all you need is your passport.  Just hop on your private jet and the talking computer will direct your travels, asking you questions about the region on which you have landed.  Be the first to collect all your passport stamps, and you win.

title: Animorphs: The Invasion Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Join the animorphs - Jake, Rachel, Cassie, Marco and Tobias - as they fight off the deadly alien invaders.  Head for the trouble spots, like the mall, the school and the beach.  Choose the quickest path - land, air or sea.  Then use a morph card to acquire an animal DNA and make the changes.  Will you travel as an ant?  An eagle?  Or maybe a dolphin?  Change again and again to your best advantage.  At each danger zone, battle Yeerks, Hork Bajir, Taxxons and maybe Visser III himself to collect a card.  Once you have three cards, morph into an elephant and destroy the kandrona ray generator to win.

title: Franklin and the Green Knight Adventure Game
types: Children's Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanisms: MemoryPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Features three unique games in one.
1.  The Green Knight Adventure Game - players relive the adventures of Franklin and Snail and their heroes the green knight and squire boar.  Players journey through a medieval setting amongst dragons and gryphons before soaring with eagle to a far off mountain in search of spring.
2.  Find the Cherry Blossoms Game - players rely on memory and luck while trying to find the hidden chips.
3.  Who's Lost in the Woods Game - one of the Franklin characters is lost, and players work together as a team to find him.

title: The $1,000,000 Chance of a Lifetime Game
description:
From the box:

Now, it is possible for everyone in your family to enjoy all the fun and excitement of one of television's newest and highest rated shows with the new home version of The $1,000,000 Chance of a Lifetime game. Players compete against one and other to solve the clues which will allow them a try at the word puzzle board. The tension and excitement builds as players race to be the first to figure out the clues and solve the word puzzle, but beware of the stinger. With one sting you can lose a valuable, and possibly, a game winning turn. So gather your family and friends around and enjoy the newest and exciting game you will ever play.

While promoted on the show (albeit with a different box during Season 1) and mostly faithful to it, the home adaptation turns the show's giant computer and keyboard into a dry-erase board and a set of plastic tiles (later cardboard letters). The bonus round is not present, either, instead awarding the Million if a player or team wins all three rounds in a game. Further, only 48 puzzles are present, allowing for just 16 games.

Notably, the game also included a contestant application, which is somewhat amusing since the game was given to couples who appeared on the show.

title: Manara Game
types: Card Game Comic Book / Strip Mature / Adult Party Game
description:
From back of game:
A special pack of cards, a true collector's item with 54 illustrations by a master of eroticism with which a special and intriguing game can be played

Players: 2 to 6
Length of game: 20'-30'
Ages 18 and up

Each player gets 3 cards and 3 cards are put on the table. Then each player in turn may exchange 1, 2 or all 3 cards in his hand with the ones on the table. Or he may pass. When all players pass the cards are removed from the table and 3 new added from the remaining pile.
The object is to get 3 cards of the same color in your hand. When you have 3 cards of the same color in your hand then you say 'Manara' and put down the cards in front of you. All cards, except the winning set, are then collected, shuffled and a new hand is dealt. Any player who receives the Manara card may put it down in front of him and receive a new card from the pile immediately.
After 10 deals the players now have a number of sets in front of them and scoring begins. Each set of 3 scores 1 point. If a player have all 6 cards of one color then he receives a bonus point. The player with the Manara card in front of him also receives a bonus point.
According to the rules, the loosing players should now remove one piece of clothing for each point by which they lost to the winner...

((From Hakko504's first impressions thread))

title: Knight Rider
types: Children's Game Dice Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
From the back of the box: 
Michael Knight and KITT face trouble in every direction, along a never ending road. Are you prepared, to help clear up that trouble? You'll earn bonus money every time you clear a Trouble Spot. But you can do so only while driving KITT. So be careful. Because each opponent will try to steal KITT, by winning a Chicken Challenge played with cards. You'll win the game, if you're the player to clear up the most Trouble Spots and earn the most bonus money.

Includes gameboard, special numbered die, 5 car tokens, 10 challenge cards, 16 trouble spots each with a bonus on the back, and instructions.

title: Rough Justice
description: The 32 dice, half black and half white, are rolled at once and placed one at a time on the board on a matching space.  They can be built up in a column to a maximum height of 4 by matching the number showing.  You score by multiplying the top die of columns with your color by the number of dice in the column.

title: Linx
description: The object of Linx is to build chains of cards connecting any two of the four Anchor cards on the table. A chain is a series of cards where each card is linked to both of its neighbors by either a matching number or a matching symbol.

title: Guard Duty
description:
Think FAST. Run FASTER.

Guard Duty is a squad-based, tactical survival game, designed for 2 to 5 players. The objective of the game is for each player to use a team of special forces Bodyguards that they draft to lead a VIP safely through the city to an escape, battling through a gauntlet of opposition and evading a relentless, invincible cybernetic hunter.

All that youll need in order to play the game, other than this book, are a few simple decks of playing cards (1 for each player), the Jokers removed.

This 39-page book contains:

- Simple-to-learn mechanics for moving your squad of bodyguards through the city, and for combating those remorseless hordes of enemies (not to mention tossing a few of them in the way of your fellow competitors)

- 15 fully fleshed-out, over-the-edge, play-balanced bodyguards (Like a cybernetically reconstructed Tyrannosaurus Rex with more gun mounts than a naval cruiser, or a living munitions depot for on-the-go arms distribution) for recruitment into each players 3-man squad.

- Easy-to-reference charts, so you dont have to stop to write anything down or flip back through the manual.

- 3 sheets of fully-colored counters, representing wounds, fatigue and in-game positions.

- An atmospheric setting chronology, in case youre interested in what stakes are at hand.

Game length averages from 1 to 2 and a half hours. Recommended for players 14 years of age or older.

title: die! Die! DIE! The Family Game of Genocidal Warfare
description:
From the designer:

One thing that has always bothered me was the predominance of wargames that espoused some sort of resolution that fell far short of complete annihilation. So I've done something about that -- die! Die! DIE! The Family Game of Genocidal Warfare! is here! die! Die! DIE! is The Family Game of Genocidal Warfare. Players build empires and advance their technology in an effort to smash the others into the dust. The board is customizable each game, and almost infinitely expandable. Using mechanics that are basic and elemental, the game proceeds at a breakneck pace to the end, with piles of bodies in every direction. The perfect game for a Sunday night around the dinner table.

The PDF includes a beautifully rendered color version, and a more inexpensively rendered bw edition (so as to show pity on your printer!).


     http://www.teamfrog.com/diediedie.htm

title: Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot
description:
Bathed in the atomic radiation of a reactor core, strange champions fight to the death, in order to claim the sweet, sweet uranium... and victory!

MNPR Deluxe is a fast-paced, beer 'n pretzels game suitable for all ages. Each player takes on the role of a champion of a powerful (yet somehow down-trodden) secret group, each with access to unique abilities. Then, they beat merry hell out of each other until one competitor stands victorious.

Re-implemented by:

    Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot Deluxe

title: The Last Chance
description: Seraphim Guard's first Print-It-Yourself boardgame comes at you with fists, chairs and bottles flying! In this two player game of barroom brawling as in Hollywood westerns, a group of cowboys collides with a gang of local ne'er-do-wells. Do as much damage as you can before the sheriff comes in and breaks it up! Set the abilities of your team of fighters -- but don't shoot the piano player!

title: Pile On
description: Each player gets 5 blocks.  Try to stack'em, one at a time, as the moving man walks by.  If a block falls down...too bad.  They're yours.  Be the first to pile on all your blocks and win.

title: The Ren & Stimpy Show Log Cereal Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
From the box:
Reach into this package of log cereal and fish around.  What did you find?  If you're the first player to locate the pieces you need to complete your own comic strip puzzle based on one of eight actual TV episodes, you win.  But if anybody finishes the History Eraser strip first, this game never took place.

The Game
Each player has a blank comic strip in front of them. The counters are placed in the box, thus creating a Log Cereal Box. The History Eraser strip is placed in the middle of the table.
In a turn, a player reaches in to the Cereal Box and pulls out a counter. If it is the same colour as your comic strip, you add it to your strip. If it is a History Eraser counter, add it to the History Eraser comic strip in the middle of the table. If it is none of these things, place it back into the cereal box and shake the box well.
If you pull out a log, various things might happen. All players might have to slide their comic strip to the person on their right or left. Or you might be able to take one counter of another player's comic strip and put it back into the box. And so on.
One really annoying rule - if you draw one of your comic strip counters, before you add it to your strip you must quote a line from the show indicated on that particular counter. If you cannot or will not do this, you don't get to keep the counter - it goes back into the box.
The first player to complete their strip, wins.
However, if the History Eraser comic strip is completed before any player's strip, then the game is lost by all players.
For die-hard Ren  Stimpy fans only.

title: A Cold Day In Hell
description:
It's the day nobody thought would come, especially the Devil. Temperatures in Hell have taken a real nose-dive. For the first time ever government offices in Hell have turned off the air conditioning.

It's downright COLD!

While everybody is loving this break from the eternal heat, there is one problem: the Devil can't find his winter coat. He swears he put it in his closet after his last ski vacation in the Alps. But, it's been an eternity since then, and how often does he really need his winter coat in hell anyway?

Your task is to find the Devil's winter coat before he gets his panties in a bunch.

(This is an e-game; you can purchase it for download, and print it out.)

title: Trap Tennis
description: Action/dexterity game based on tennis where, I guess, players try to trap the ball after their opponent serves it to them.

title: Penguin Freeze-Tag
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Penguin freeze tag is a game of strategy and adventure.  Players race their penguins around Antarctica in a mad dash to catch some fish and return to the Penguin club.  But watch out...another player can freeze you and stop you in your tracks.  That's where the excitement begins.

The hungry penguins roll the die and waddle around the board to reach the Fishing hoels.  When they land exactly on one of the squares with fish printed on them, they catch a fish of that color and move it to their Fish Freeze.  Each time that they catch a fish, penguins msut return to the Penguin Club through one of the four blue entrances marked Start.  Penguins must catch the fish of their own color last.
 Penguins who land on or next to another penguin can freeze that penguin by covering it with a Freeze-Tag Ice Cube.
 Frozen penguins stay frozen, and may not move, although they roll the die on each turn.  On the turn that they roll either a one or a six, frozen penguins thaw out, and roll again and move.  Penguins get an extra turn whenever they freeze another penguin.
 Penguins may move in any direction that they choose, although they may not move diagonally or move through a square that they already moved though on that turn.  Penguins who start their turn on a Swimming Hole may move to any other Swimming Hole, then roll and move.
 To reach a Swimming Hole, the Penguin Club, or one of the squares with a fish printed on them , penguins must roll the exact number of squares needed.  Swimming Hole spaces and the Penguin Club count as one square.  The first penguin to catch one fish of each color and return to the Penguin Club is the winner.

title: The Tooth Fairy Game
description: You have lost a tooth.  Put it in your backpack.  Go to bed.  Put the tooth under your pillow.  Spin.  Will the tooth fairy come?  The tooth fairy is here.  Like magic you've got a coin.  Four coins win the game.  Contains:  1 gameboard, 4 playing pieces, 16 teeth, 1 magical bed, 13 coins and one tooth fairy.

title: Nerf Slamkick Soccer
description: Striker slam kicks soccer ball at goal while goalie tries to block/save ball from getting in the goal.  After the striker has shot all three soccer balls, switch sides and repeat.  Keep score on the base of the goal.  The first player to score nine goals is the winner.

title: Nerf Goalie Showdown
description: Block and shoot at the same time.  Move the goalie to the right or left by moving the handle.  Even make him jump to block a shot.  All while you are watching for an opening to fire and get one past him to score a goal.

title: Rotten Egg
description:
This is an action game inspired by the Musical Chairs. Before the game, the electronic egg records each player's name. During the game, players toss the device to the player called by the egg. Players are eliminated if the egg stops on their name a few times.

From the box:
Gather all players.  Three? Maybe more?  And form a circle on the floor.  Then talk to Rotten Egg and tell him your name.  Now we're ready to start the game.  One by one, your names he'll shout.  You toss him to the person whose name he yells out.  When Rotten Egg stops on your name, You are one step closer to being out of the game.

title: Treasure Trap
mechanisms: Hand ManagementPick-up and DeliverPoint to Point Movement
description: Try to catch the treasure before the trap catches you.  Electronic burglar alarm sound with action.  2 skill levels.  Retrieve most or all of the treasure to win.

title: KooKooNauts
types: Children's Game Science Fiction Space Exploration
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
In this Roll and Move game, players try to escape the planet as quickly as possible. The first player to shoot three KooKooNauts into the ship using the launcher wins.

From the box
We KooKooNauts landed on a kooky planet.  It was fun, but now we're done, and we want to blast back to our spaceship.  Spin the spinner to march us toward our ship.  Or take a chance and move us into a short-cut pod.  But watch out.  We might end up landing on an angry alien or worse.  When we make it onto the launch pad, hit the blaster-upper to shoot us into the ship.  Be first to get three of us into the ship to win.

title: Comic Crusades
description: The evil and powerful necromancer, Syntari, has accidentally been set free from an ancient castle ruin and is threatening all of humanity.  These heroes and heroines have bravely come together to put an end to Syntari's reign of terror.  Players will answer multiple choice questions dealing with all aspects of your favorite comic books and comic book characters. Each correct answer increases your power in speed, strength, intelligence or energy blasts.  By increasing your power and avoiding Syntari's attacks, you may be the one to save the Endgame Universe.

title: Treasures and Trapdoors
types: Ancient Children's Game Fantasy Maze Mythology Racing
description:
CONTENTS
Pyramid frame, pedestal, golden cobra, 16 jewels (4 are spares), 4 baskets in 4 colors, 4 ankhs, circular turntable

OBJECT OF THE GAME
To collect 3 jewels and an ankh, seize the Golden Cobra and be the first to escape with it to the stairs leading from the pyramid to the outside world.

A simple luck driven children's game based on the Egyptian pyramids.
What is very unique in this game, is the turntable device. It operates as a dice, dictating the moves of the players, and at the same time it opens and closes the traps, causing some pieces to fall into the snake pit and start again.

Additionally when the turntable moves some windows will show the Pharaohs eyes in one of these 3 positions:

OPEN = trapdoor is open
HALF CLOSED = the trapdoor might open next turn
CLOSED = the trapdoor will not open next turn

title: Pirate's Choice
description: The object of the game is to get the most gold. Each pirate sails his ship around the game board recovering treasure chests which contain varying amounts of gold. The game ends when a pirate with at least one treasure chest sails across the finish line. That pirate gets a bonus for finishing first but does not automatically win the game. The winner is the pirate with the most gold. The decision to end the game is a risky one and the game remains exciting right up to the last move when all the pirates reveal how much treasure they have recovered and the winner is determined. In this 'nautical' game, each pirate must 'sail' his ship to where the treasure chests are. Each pirate chooses the direction to sail his ship on the hexagonal board and which treasures to go after. How many spaces he can move in each direction depends upon the direction the wind is blowing. He can sail more spaces if he goes with the wind and less if he sails on an angle into the wind. Since the direction of the wind changes according to the roll of the dice, and is somewhat predictable, a good part of the strategy of the game is learning how to use the wind in order to sail your ship to where the treasure chests are. No special prior knowledge of sailing is needed.

title: Playoff One-On-One Hockey Challenge
description: You have before you a truly unique Card Game. It gives you the opportunity to play a game of hockey with the NHLs best. A Starter Deck provides a randomized selection of 50 cards and 3 dice. A game requires two players, each with their own Starter deck. Actually you can play two different exciting game variants, Quick Shot or Playoff One-on-One Hockey Challenge, with a starter deck. Both games employ similar game mechanics, but the overall game play, strategy level, and details for each are very different. Quick Shot is a fast action, easy to learn, quick playing contest while Playoff One-on-One Hockey Challenge is a more complex game and it will take time and practice to understand its complete strategy and play possibilities. The rules for Quick Shot are presented to give newcomers the opportunity to get started quickly and become familiar with many of the basic game mechanics. For most Collectable Card Game players and as newcomers gain experience we invite you to give the complete Playoff One-on-One Hockey Challenge game rules a shot.

title: TV Guide's TV Game
types: Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
mechanisms: MemoryPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: How much do you really know and remember about your favorite TV shows?  Test your knowledge with this challenging question and answer quiz.

title: Fat Chance
description: The object of the game is to lose the lard.  Each player starts with 20 unwanted pounds of lard and the goal is to lose them.  Players move around the board answering questions in categories such as Calories count, Nutrition matters, Exercise and the body and Largely trivia.

title: Game of the Millennium
description: Teams must answers questions posed from all 10 Decades of the Twentieth Century.  Categories include: The World, Pastimes, Firsts, People,  Trends. First team to make it to the 21st Century wins!

title: The Word
mechanisms: MemoryPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: The Word is a vocabulary game which expands and builds the players knowledge of vocabulary.  The object of the game is for players to race around the board answering questions whenever they land on The Word spaces or At a Loss For Words spaces.  The first player to finish is the winner.

title: How to Get to Sesame Street
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Spin and move your character along the game path to matching color spaces.  Row across the pond, stop for checkers and slip down the slide to the letter X.  Then hopscotch your way to Sesame Street.  The first player to reach Sesame Street wins.

title: The Honeymooners VCR Game
types: Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia Word Game
description: Watch an actual scene from the Honeymooners, then race to be the first player to unscramble a short word puzzle and answer two memory-teasing questions about that scene.  You score points for each right answer, and bonus points if you get them all right.  The player with the highest score after five rounds wins.

title: My Dog Can Do That
description:
From the description on the back of the box:

My dog can do that is an antic-filled race to Hollywood for the whole family.  Yes, including the dog.  The fun begins when you select a trick card such as: doorbell dash, Mexican hat dance, synchronized walking or any one of the 72 tricks included.  Then you have 30 seconds to get your dog to do the trick.  If you like to play with your dog and you can think on your feet, you'll have a ball.

There's also a notice on the back of the box that says: Dog Not Included

title: Going! Going! Gone! The Flea Market Auction Game
description:
This is an auction game set in a flea market in which players try to gather the highest total net worth. Players bid on items in multiple categories such as glassware, furniture, toys, jewelery or art. They must be careful, however, as items could be forged or defective.

An interesting feature is the plastic gavel accessory.

title: Married With Children: Act Like...Think Like...Be Like a...Bundy
types: Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
description: What would you do if you were Al?  How would you scheme if you were Bud?  Can you walk like Peggy?  Think like Kelly?  Bark like Buck the Dog?  Do you have what it takes to be a Bundy?  Players, working in teams or alone, compete for Bundy Awards by answering hilarious questions like Al, Peg, Bud, Kelly, Marcy, and even Buck the Dog would.

title: Wide World of Sports Auto Racing Game
description: A fun filled game combining the excitement of moving cars in a race with the element of skill in overcoming obstacles in your path, which have been placed there by your competition.  The object is to be the first driver who reaches the end of the race, by overcoming obstacles and using successful strategy.

title: Numbers Up
mechanisms: Pattern RecognitionPoint to Point MovementTile Placement
description:
Numbers Up is a fast, fun game for the whole family.  Each player competes by showing his skill in memorizing where the pegs are, and placing them numerically on the peg board before his time is up.

Re-implemented by:

    Top 15

title: Things in My House
description: Each player has a house and an attic and tries to find all the matching rooms.  The first to do so is the winner.  The houses are filled with familiar objects and depict daily activities that are sure to stimulate verbalization and imaginative play.

title: Speedy Graffiti
description: A wild and hectic letter battle to see who gets the last word.  While the timer ticks away, players try to change or lengthen the word on the table by rearranging the letter cards and adding new ones.  But when the bell rings, and time is up the player who made the last word wins.  Everyone plays at once in this intense, new action word game.

title: Orient-Express
mechanisms: Co-operative PlayDice RollingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
In this Roll and Move cooperative racing game, players help detective Sir Henry reach Constantinople by train before the Admiral's ship. Unfortunately, some track sections are damaged and must be repaired before Sir Henry can move forward. On their turn, players roll a die to determine whether they will move the Admiral's ship or their own locomotives. Players pick up repair pieces at different train stations but Sir Henry can only travel on locomotives without repair pieces.

Players win if Sir Henry reaches his destination before the Admiral.

title: Diamant
description:
The mystic board is in itself enticing. Almost hand-wide in height with ponderous bulges, in magical midnight- blue with glittering diamonds. The game is to light up the individual diamonds with invisible beam. This is done by clever placing of the silver colored stones on the board thus directing the invisible beam onto the right diamonds.

Contents
1 plastic board
12 mirror playing pieces
16 colored diamonds
19 cards

title: Dice Prix
description:
Roll just one race
Whether racing against your own best time or racing against other players, feel the thrill as you cross the finish line. Don't spin-out, and be sure you re-fuel at the Pit Stop in time!
Or play for Track Circuit Points, and Race your friends for the cup! Choose the number of races in your Circuit, run Time Trials, then score your Finish Points, Finish Spread, Lap Points and Race Points to win it all!
(License not required)

title: Monaco Grand Prix
description:
A forerunner of Formula Dé.  6 teams (Brabham, BRM, Cooper, Ferrari, Honda, Lotus), two cars per team. Each turn, pick a gear and roll on the relevant table (one table per gear chosen) to see how many squares you move.

Also in the mix are some Advantage cards which are roughly similar to the Driver Cards in Waddington's Formula-1.

title: Cuban Missile Crisis
mechanisms: Campaign / Battle Card DrivenHex-and-CounterSecret Unit Deployment
description:
Description from Microgame Design Group:

Cuban Missile Crisis is a simulation of that crisis, where players, acting as Kennedy or Khrushchev (along with their staff), must confront the issues and either arrive at a peaceful solution or end in a holocaust. Political and strategic decisions and actions are captured by 40 cards. Rules cover air and ground operations, photo-reconnaissance, convoys, accidents, world opinion and nuclear warfare.

The 17 x 22 map (with 3/4 hexes) covers the island of Cuba. The 448 1/2 counters (die-cut and back-printed) show US, Soviet and Cuban ground troops, air forces, convoys and more. The 40 playing cards reflect the political and strategic options open to the national leaders.

An innovative approach to simulator the Cuban Missile Crisis in which players use cards denoted specific alert statuses and actions that allow players to win the game without ever actually going to war (which was historically the case).  The American player must use his recon resources to uncover all the Soviet assets in Cuba while building up his forces for a possible invasion.  The problem is ending the threat to the US posed by the Soviet weapons in Cuba without provoking World War III.

title: Graphos
description:
A Brazilian adaptation of Tryce, a game by 3M.

This card game is played in seven dealings, divided in three phases. To win a dealing a player has to use all his cards to complete a number (ever increasing) of three types of matches: groups (three or more cards of the same number or color), sequences (four or more number-ordered cards of the same color) or words (four or more cards forming a word). The 4th and the last dealings are called direct: only words can be formed (no groups or sequences), and the winner must get rid of his last card without discarding it. After each dealing points are awarded based on the matches made (cards with hard letters give are worth more).

It's a fun game for families or groups of friends who enjoy word games.

From the back of the box:

GRAPHOS is an  intriguing  game that combines letters, colors and numbers. With a little luck and a lot of thought, players seek to build groups, sequences and words that are required for each dealing. 
Gradually, dealings become more defiant, requiring increasing mental agility for envisioning that combination.
Evah nuf, that is, have fun!

title: The Wheels on the Bus
description: The Wheels on the Bus song helps tiny tots work on their matching skills while theyre having a great time. To play, youll drive the bus along the outer edge of the gameboard until you get to your stop. When the bus is in front of your stop, press the hood to find out what token youre looking for. The bus will sing it to you in a song. Then all the players get to act it out. It keeps kiddies moving to maintain their interest while they work on their matching skills. Comes with electronic bus, large gameboard, four character pawns and stands, 20 bus tokens and instructions. For 2 to 4 players.

title: The War in Virginia: 1862-1865
description:
The War in Virginia is a military board game based on the action in the Virginia Theater during the War between the States. The product of extensive research, it is designed to simulate the major strategic options available to the supreme commanders of the contesting forces at the beginning of the second year of the War.

A game of generalship encompassing the elements of strategy and grand tactics. Designed for historical accuracy in an easy-to-understand format.

Components include:
22x26 map  
140 counters   
2 combat cards   
16 half-page rules

title: Bigfoot 4x4x4
description:
The object of Bigfoot 4x4x4 is to crush the other players cars with your monster truck before they crush you.

Your weapon against these high priced European sports cars - a tiny molded plastic Bigfoot, the king of the 80's monster trucks. The battlefield - an 11x11 grid, with both off-road terrain and an oval track. The goal - drive around the board, crushing the other cars without pity, whilst trying to keep your car away from the other players. The winner - the first one to crush four cars of the correct color.

title: Kapture
description: Abstract strategy game with a science-fiction flavor.  The goal of the game is to surround opponent's pieces with certain capturing formations.  A player wins if he surrounds the same opposing piece three times, if he captures all of the opposing pieces, or if he surrounds more pieces than his opponent does.

title: Fleece the Flock
description: You take on the role of a televangelist trying to amass your empire of TV stations, theme parks, stretch limos, record companies, missions, and corporate jets. Starting with 50 million dollars, look out for Devil, Angel, and God's Will cards. Through it all you will be gripped by intrigue, strategy, and subterfuge that is sure to keep everyone in tingling suspense!

title: Diamondback
types: Bluffing Card Game Comic Book / Strip
description:
Created by Dave Sim for the comic book Cerebus, Diamondback was published in a separate edition and given to the masses who demanded it.  It's a variant of poker and other betting games, but without suits or sets.  The cards have a specific point value, and whomever has the highest total points is the winner of the hand.

Each player is given two cards from a deck of 15, 29, or 43 cards (depending on the number of players in the game), and the dealer reveals one of his cards and initiates the betting.  Once the dealer decides the betting round is over, all cards are revealed, and the player with the highest point value wins the pot.

title: Starbattles (mainline)
description: 20 pages of rules, one 24x24 map, 18 sheets of diagrams, 180 counters.  An intermediate-level game of tactical space combat.  The Designer's Notes state Starbattles is a game that was originally designed as a modification of another game, but meant to be a separate game.  That other game is clearly Task Force Games' Starfire.  The ship component system here is similar, but components are positioned on a hex diagram rather than being written in a single line.

title: Campaigns and Battles from the Age of Reason
types: Age of Reason Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame
description:
63 pages of rules and scenarios for Warfare in the Age of Reason.  
Bohemian Blitzkrieg is a smallish 2-player campaign, Spain is added to the Sport of Kings campaign from the original game, and there are seven stand-alone scenarios.  
Includes errata and QA for 1st edition Warfare in the Age of Reason.

title: AstroNavis Merchant
description:
AstroNavis Merchant is a solitaire PDF boardgame set on the frontier of human space in the 2310s.  It's designed to provide a realistic game of tramp freighter shipping in an original science fiction setting.  Closer to how small, ocean-going merchants really operated in the 20th century than most SF games, it uses history as a guide while reflecting the changes that interstellar shipping might bring.

Now part of:


    AstroNavis Merchant Advanced

title: Tower of Bunnies
description:
Also called Bunny Paletti or Villa Rabbitti. Build a tower out of little plastic bunnies and cardboard discs. Roll a special color die, and pull out a bunny of the appropriate color. Most bunnies when the tower falls wins!

Notice the year of copyright. Which came first, the bunny or the Spiel des Jahres?

This game was created by Asten Games. 
1861 is a 2-player Civil War game. The objective is to capture your enemy's capital. There is a built in clock of 10 rounds, at which time the Confederate Player wins an automatic victory. The combat system is very similar to Axis  Allies with some small changes. Both sides begin with 3 generals to command their troops. The game comes with 25mm (generals) and 15mm lead miniatures.

title: Campaigns of Napoleon
description: The Emperor Napoleon I fought valiantly to unite the whole of Europe under French rule. The foremost military genius of his time, Napoleon's campaigns swept across the breadth of the Continent, and very nearly toppled the world's oldest monarchies. Each player represents France or one of her enemies during the Wars of the Empire. Playing pieces represent the actual military formations of the time, and are maneuvered across an accurate terrain map of central Europe. Many unique rules capture the flavor of the period, including the economics of war, diplomacy, fortresses, leaders and much more.

title: Swords of Glory
description:
From the box cover:

It is a time of legends, an earlier time when men are just beginning to learn the art of war. It is a time for conquerors and warlords. On fierce battlegrounds, brave warlords go out to tame and protect new domains from other would-be rulers. Each ambitious leader tests a lifetime of military training against other fierce warlords. Which commander will emerge victorious?

Come back to a time when mighty conquerors and warlords clash in great battles for land and honor. As a commander, you either lead your troops to heroic victory or suffer ignoble defeat! Conquer new territories and guard them from warlords striving to wrest away what you have earned. Each enemy, each battle, calls for a different strategy. Is brute military force enough to protect your domain? Will your opponent honor your offer of truce? Would a sudden cavalry raid or archery barrage pay off?

You can conquer the world! Choose your strategies wisely. Each victory will bring you one step closer to glory, but only one player will emerge triumphant. Do you build great cities to feed and protect your people, conquer land and the valuable resources it contains ot build mighty armies with which to defeat your foes? Failure means certain defeat at the hands of your enemies. The time is yours, fight on!

title: Air Force Game
types: Abstract Strategy Aviation / Flight Modern Warfare Wargame
description: A strategy game using small plastic figures representing strategic bombers, fighter bombers, fighters, AA missiles, and  long distance missiles. Although the cover art depicts a dramatic B-25 bombing mission from World War II, the pieces and artwork on the mapboard reflect aircraft from the sixties, and the aircraft playing pieces are jets. Played on a square grid with the units moving from point to point. The object is to destroy the enemy headquarters with a long distance missile or to eliminate all enemy air power.

title: Jewishopoly
types: Humor Negotiation Party Game Political Religious
mechanisms: Area MovementDice RollingModular BoardPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveTrading
description:
Wouldnt it be nice to explore places and people, historical facts and funny anecdotes? We thought so, and want to share this with you!

If you can relate to your mother burning the latkes at Hanukkah or your Aunts matzo balls coming out like rocks, then JewishopolyTM, is the game for you. But thats just the tip of the iceberg. At Opoly Enterprises, Combining the history and humor of people TM, is what we are all about. As opposed to other companies who are looking to turn a fast buck on Opoly style games, we at Opoly Enterprises are working closely with religious and community leaders to bring family values and history to games without offensive or controversial content. These games are under development, with trademarks in the application process of the USPTO.

The careful undertaking of JewishopolyTMand our other game titles: Christianopoly TM, IslamopolyTM, Latinopoly, TM, and ArmenianopolyTM, are all a labor of love. We are sure you will be able to share these games and play them time and time again with family and friends. The games we produce at Opoly Enterprises are so much more than a board, a couple of dice and some cards.

title: Togoland 1914
description:
Game covering the Anglo-French campaign to capture the radio station in German-controlled Togoland at the outbreak of World War I.

The pressure on the Germans is to set up a defense that will prevent the Allies from taking the radio station in the alloted time - they also need to defend their supply dump, as once they lose it they cannot raise new units or attack anymore.  The Allies need to take ground, but they must be careful not to spook the Germans into blowing the radio station before they can capture it.

Units stacked with a leader are deployed on a hidden unit display and a traditional odds ratio CRT is used.  As the units present in this campaign are inexperienced, casualties are quite heavy in combat, with one side generally being wiped out.  An attack can be modified for the presence of entrenchments, machine guns or artillery, all of which played a role in the battle, and a successful attacker can see his units advance and attack again in the same period.

Each hex is 15 miles, each game turn is two to three days (there are nine turns in total) and each unit is a platoon, company, combat group, artillery section or machine gun section.

title: Car Wars Tanks
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Fighting Racing Science Fiction Transportation
description:
Tanks Expansion for Car Wars

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

    Car Wars

title: Word Rich
description: Make a word by selecting letters from the board. High scores are obtained, by turning over face down letters from the bonus squares and using them in your words. You are able to choose the types of bonus you want to go after. Bonuses are given for word lengths, and words using one color of letters. However, if you can't make a word using all of the letters selected, you score minus points.

title: Pinnacle
description: Pinnacle is a rummy-type game using a standard deck of 52 cards, valued Ace - 9 = 1/2 pt. and 10 - King = 1 pt. Each player draws a hand of 7 cards and on his turn, may draw from the face-down draw pile or from the perfect knowledge discard pile, taking any card plus all others above it. When the player has a sequence of at least 3 cards of the same suit, he may meld it and score the appropriate value. The player may also add to existing melds, both his and the opponents. The value is used to move pawns on the board. The board is a large molded plastic piece with a raised area in each corner for starting areas and a raised area in the center for the goal area. Pawns may move in any direction and also jump other pawns. The winner of the game is the first person to get all his pawns into the center area.

title: Le Royaume des 5 Couronnes
description:
King Arthur is dying and plans to leave his throne to the Prince who will do best in the quest to retrieve five crowns kept by Kraddoch, the evil Dragon. To do so, players (the Princes) fight over the control of five Knights who will perform the quest.

At the beginning of the game, Princes each receive a secret card indicating the order in which King Arthur would like to see the five Knights bring the crowns back. This order is different for each Prince. Player turns consist of multiple phases involving dice rolls during which they move Knights and resolve encounters and events.

Once a Knight defeats the dragon, he brings the crown of his color back to the castle. Princes earn points for each crown making its way back to the castle in the exact order appearing on their card and for any accumulated treasure. The Prince with the highest point total inherits the throne.

title: Ascension
description:
In this beautiful wooden game, you have to climb on top of the mountain (the wooden cubes) and go back to your starting point before the other players. Some of the cubes have a symbol, which means a special power : the ladder helps to climb faster, the abyss must be avoided. Some cubes may be passed through only by the players represented on the cube.

Ascension won the Pion d'Or award in 1982.
A winner of the 1982 Concours International de Créateurs de Jeux de Société.

title: Saint Paul and the Unforgettable Journeys
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: The Unforgettable Journeys is a game designed to appeal to players of all ages. The challenge, competition, and excitement it presents is surpassed only by its educational content. The game has a twofold purpose. First, it provides excellent family entertainment as each player attempts to follow Paul's journeys from Antioch to Rome. Secondly, it can be used as an instructional tool by Sunday Schools to teach the book of Acts and the Apostle Paul's missionary travels.

title: Hokej 92: Společenská Hra
Durch Die Republik
description:
A trivia game about the German Democratic Republic (DDR = Durch Die Republik) published after the reunification of Germany.

6000 questions with 3 multiple choice answers included.

title: Shipbase III
types: Electronic Miniatures Nautical Real-time Wargame World War I
description:
(from the Critical Hit Website:)

Shipbase III is the game of naval warfare from 1890-1945. More than just a set of rules, Shipbase III is a computer program that handles all the record-keeping and serves as an interface between you, the gamer, and thousands of lines of code representing years of technical research, allowing the players to concentrate on tactics...and fun!

200 Game Pieces ... Shipbase III includes everything you need to play in one package. You receive 200 color, mounted cardboard game pieces representing ships and aircraft, as well as game markers, torpedoes and more.

Shipbase III is designed to run on any PC. It runs under Windows 3.x to 9x/ME/2000/XP. and can be run using PC emulation software on the Macintosh.

Shipbase III is a complete game. You receive all the game pieces you need to play. Use of naval miniatures is purely optional.


(from BGG user breakmanynecks:)

This looks like a very appealing game system. A computer assisted Naval Combat System for table top gaming, using miniatures or cardboard counters.You enter in the unit attacking, the ship that's being attacked, and the software gives you the results. I wonder if factors like; move allowance compared to ship's damage, or aircraft are included. I've been shopping for a Tactical naval rules system, this might be it!

title: Das Deutsche Raumfahrtspiel D1
description: A game inspired by the first German space shuttle mission named D1. The players compete to get the most funding for their scientific experiments by moving scientists on the inner ring of the board, while managers of the corresponding industries move along the outer ring. On some marked fields on the board the player has to answer trivia questions about space exploration and the science in order to get another move for his scientists.

title: Slogan
description:
A trivia game about German commercials. The players have to guess/know, which company advertised its products with the slogan in order to get victory points.

The active player chooses one of the two slogans on the current card and asks the player to his left after betting up to 3 chips from his own supply. If the asked player is able to  answer correctly he get the chips and moves as many fields on the board as he has just gained. If the question is not answered correctly the player who asked the question may keep his chips and move accordingly.

When a player is not able to answer a question he may call for a chance card (Spieer Alfons-Card) or ask for a hint.

Whoever has the most chips at the end of the game is the winner.

title: Missing Link
description:
Ages 12 and up
No. of Players: 2 teams 
Game Concept: Every list is missing something. Uncover the Missing Link and you're on your way to winning the game. Two teams compete to see who can find the most Missing Links. If a team answers correctly before time runs out they collect links to a chain. The team that answers the most questions correctly (and has the longest chain) by the end of the game wins.

Special Features:

Over 590 questions from a variety of topics including music, literature, geography, sports, movies, television, history and more. 
Time limit makes even easy questions more challenging 
Fun score-keeping device with the links

title: Meeting Room
description:
The represenatives of 3 Italian game companies Acqui Comics, Mucca games and da Vinci Academy have decided to have run the game convention of all conventions, the Con-Con. The plans are held in a tiny Meeting Room. Each player is a secretary of the CON-CON (i.e. the CONvention of the CONventios), managing the MEETING ROOM and his goal is to organize qualified and prestigious meetings, gaining points in the process.

Using cards from their hand, the player tries to fill three chairs in the meeting room. Hands are built by drawing face down and face up cards, collecting sets of characteristics which are found on each card in different combinations (game company, favorite game type and job). Completing sets is worth various amounts of points and players earn bonuses for filling up all three chairs with cards from their hand.

The first player to score 30 points wins.

title: Cluedo, After Dinner Mint Edition "Death by Indulgence"
description:
A simplified version classic detective game, but with a chocloate twist. The rules are basically the same, the exception being that mint chocolates are placed in each room at the start of play to entice players to enter the rooms. The first person in each room gets the reward!.

The game comes in a small box, (perfect for picnic hampers) and the playing time and board are reduced by dropping a few of the rooms.

title: Star Fighter
types: Aviation / Flight Card Game Science Fiction
description:
At the beginning of the game, players are dealt a hand of five cards and receive 9 shield tokens. On their turn, players must play or discard a card. They may play attack, defense or special cards. Players must always keep a hand size of 5 cards.

Players are eliminated when they lose all their shields. The last player with at least one shield token wins.

From the website:

Buckle up
Engage engine
Activate targeting system
Energize laser defense grid
Prepare for the battle of the stars!

Launch missiles, mines and blast away with laser cannons while deploying counter measures and performing special moves to re-route power to weapons and shields or even cloak yourself for a sneak attack!

Star Fighter is a card game for 2-8 players.

Quick and easy to learn.

title: Naval Warfare '39-'45
types: Miniatures Nautical Wargame World War II
description: 28 pages of miniatures rules for WW II surface, carrier, and submarine combat.  No unit data or scenarios - just rules.

title: Flowers & Butterflies
description: First assemble a flower patch with colors that match -- then land a butterfly with numbers as high.  A creative matching game for Ages 5 - 9

title: Tens
description:
Match colors and join numbers, but be sure they add up to ten!  For ages 6 and up.

The game pieces like a bit like Tri-Opoly only the numbers are on the flats of the triangles instead of the points (and are segmented into colors).

title: 15 Love
description:
The Tennis game where you determine whether you win or lose.

15 Love is a unique, fast moving dice board game where strategic placement and knowledge of odds play a most important role. Imagine yourself at Wimbledon. The first thing is to get your serve in bounds and that is not as easy as it sounds...nor is it terribly difficult. More often than not your opponent will reach your serve and that's where the fun begins.

Where will you place your players? Can you plan two, three or even 4 moves ahead? Your opponent may hit a short lob with one die or try a passing shot with two dice. Don't get too close to the net. On the other hand don't be too far away. And all the while you're watching your position, your opponent will be trying to force you out of position.

There are two dice for each player so it's super fast moving... You'll have to think quickly on your feet. control your two players and your opponents two players and you'll win!

title: Road Hog
description:
Players race to be the first to New City while simultaneously trying to run their opponents off of the road.

Each player initially receives a hand of five cards. On their turn, players play a card then draw a card from either the draw pile or the top of the discard pile. They move on the track by playing mileage cards on their play pile. Mileage cards are numbered from one to four and come in four colors but may only be added to the play pile if they match the previous mileage card in either number or color. Players must put a card on the discard pile if they are unable to play but they they also have the option of playing obstacle cards on other players' play piles. These can be avoided by playing ambulance cards, green lights, and tow trucks.

The winner is the first player to reach the tenth space at the end of the track.

title: Crazy Crocodiles
description:
The bad red monkey claims the Islands of the Fruits to be his. The players now try to reach this island from their starting point. Therefore they have to cross the water, but four crocodiles with big open mouths occupy the path, two of them are sleeping, two of them are very awake... and hungry. If a player's monkey happens to land in the mouth of the crocodile, the other players test if it is indeed awake. If that is the case, the crocodile tries to bite the unlucky monkey, who has in turn go back to the starting island. The player who reaches the Islands of the Fruits wins and can throw the bad red monkey into the water.

Players try to be the first to move their monkey to the island of fruit.  Along the way they have to move across the backs of four different crocodiles.  Two of them have magnets in their mouths and will snap shut on a monkey that lands there.  If your monkey is eaten, you have to return to start.

title: Escape from Frankenstein
description: Each player moves around Frankenstein's castle, picks up the key of their colour and hopes to reach the laboratory. Frankenstein may come alive at any moment and capture any player. On reaching the laboratory the key shuts off the power. The first player to do this wins the game.

title: Equals
description:
A Scrabble-type game in which players build mathematical equations, using number and operator tiles, instead of words.

Contents:

game board
182 counters with numbers  signs
4 counter holding bars
rules in English  French

title: Bombshell
description:
It's a simple game, in which four bomb disposal soldiers (thick cardboard cut-outs) with names like Major Disaster try to defuse a bomb. The bomb is a red plastic shell in two parts with a spring inside. Players turn the top of the shell click by click, and eventually it will 'explode' and wound the soldier whose turn it is. Plastic bandages clip onto parts of the soldiers to show how wounded they are. Eventually the winner is the last soldier left.

This game is quite rare; as weeks after its release, a bomb disposal man was blown up by an IRA bomb, so the game was taken off the shelves.

title: After School
description: The bell has rung, lessons are finished and the kids are ready for fun. It's After School from Waddingtons, a quiz based game with a delightful twist designed with children (and parents) in mind. Children move around the colorfully animated board on skateboard playing pieces and discover that if they learn their ABC's and 123's there is fun to be had after school. By answering questions correctly children earn Smart Points that help them start a paper route, car wash, or open a lemonade stand for extra spending money. The first player to buy all the things that children like - comics, games, toys and a bike - wins the game.

title: Addiction
description: Lettered dice are rolled down a stepped slope and placed one per turn into a squared grid to form words in crossword fashion.  Each letter has a point value and players score for completing valid words.

title: Solar Conquest
description:
The major governments in the world are in a desperate race to be the first to conquer all the planets in our solar system.

First, players build launch pads on earth. Then launch Space Wheels into orbit. Now they begin send rockets to the moon and planets. They can even, if they wish, establish a base on the moon from which to launch rockets to the planets. To get the upper hand you can even sabotage the other countries

This fun game consists of a board, dice, cards, and plastic launch pads, space wheels, and rockets.

Do you have what it takes to be the first to succeed in conquering space?

title: Hercules: The Legendary Journeys
description:
Fantasy-based component game system with an expandable board game system that merges flexibility with an assortment of game mechanics in an easy to use system. It features Hercules, Iolaus, Autolycus and Salmoneus as the main characters. Contents include 4 character control sheets, 14 map pieces, 50 playing cards, 1 rulebook, 2 dice, 80 tokens.

Can be played together with Xena Warrior Princess: The Board Game, which expands the playing area and increases the potential number of players to 8.

Part of the Component Game System.

title: The Cat in the Hat Comes Back Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description: Players pile up little cats A-Z in alphabetical order to clean up the mess that the cat in the hat made.  The more cats they play, the faster they win.

title: Grand Army
types: American Civil War Miniatures Napoleonic Wargame
description: Rules for miniature wargames in the American Civil War and Napoleonics Periods especially designed for use with large armies of 9mm or 15mm figures.

title: J.E.B.!
description: A set of miniatures rules covering the American Civil War. 5cm = 40 yards, 1 figure = 20 men, 1 turn = 15 minutes.

title: Rally 'round the Flag
description:
Miniature Rules for the American Civil War.

Rally 'round the Flag puts the individual player into the role of a brigade commander, and simulates the problems that would face such an officer during the American Civil War. Thus, although the rules are tactical in nature, they are designed to be tactical on a brigade level.

Scale: 1 = 25 yards (25mm scale) or 1 = 50 yards (15mm scale). 1 move = 2 to 20 minutes. 1 figure = 20-25 men, except 1 gunner figure = 5-6 men.

title: The Very Fashionable Miss Piggy Card Game
Oonie Moonie Goonie!
description: Turn over your cards one at a time.  Watch your opponents turn over theirs.  Match three-of-a-kind and shout OONIE MOONIE GOONIE.  Children and adults alike will love playing this fast-paced matching game.  The one who collects the most cards is the winner.

title: Kermit the Frog Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: A fun, fast-action game with special cards that picture Kermit the Frog performing some mighty entertaining acts, everything from flying high on a trapeze to making magic.  The cards are numbered 1 to 9 in four color suits which are dealt out into face-down piles in front of each player.  Players on their turns try to get rid of their cards by playing them on an opponent's pile or on the piles in the center of the playing area.  The first player to get rid of all his or her cards, wins the game.

title: Where's The Beef Card Game
types: Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
At the beginning of a round, the First Out card is set aside for later use and players are dealt the remaining cards. Players place face-up on the table all the food pairs found in their hands. On their turn, players draw a random card from the player on their left. If the card matches a card in their hand, they place the matching pair face-up on the table. Play continues until a player has matched all the cards in his hand. The first player to do so takes the First Out card. After the first player goes out, play continues until all pairs are matched and a single player holds The Beef card. Each matching pair is worth either 1, 2, or 3 points. The pair of Clara Peller cards is worth 5 points, the First Out card is worth 8 points and The Beef card is worth 10 points.

The player who scores the most points at the end of 3 rounds wins.

title: Cabbage Patch Kids Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
On most days, the Cabbage Patch is a quiet, peaceful place. Stumble Bumble BunnyBee and the BunnyBees buzz about, sprinkling their magic crystals onto row after row of ordinary cabbages. And it's these cabbages that magically grow up into The Cabbage Patch Kids! The BunnyBees carry all the Cabbage Patch Kids to BabyLand General Hospital. And from there, Colonel Casey, the Stork, delivers them to caring people like you. But today, Cabbage Jack, the mean old rabbit, is trying to make the Cabbage Patch Kids work in Lavendar McDade's gold mine nearby.

It's up to you to rescue the Cabbage Patch Kids from the mine and then bring them home from BabyLand General Hospital. The BunnyBees will help you as much as they can  pointing you in the right direction. Colonel Casey, the Stork, will help you too. Good luck!

title: Barbie Shopping Spree Card Game
description: The object of the Barbie Shopping Spree game is to match identical cards into pairs; the player with the most pairs at the end of the game wins.

title: Race to the Sun
description: You are in an interplanetary race around the solar system.  The map in the center of the gameboard tracks each player's progress in the race.  Space stations have been positioned along the way to mark your route.  Correctly answer questions about space and blast from space station to space station.  To help you answer the questions, important flight data is displayed on control panels on the sides of the gameboard.

title: Ostatnia wojna Cesarzy
description: Emperors' Last War (Eastern Front 1914) is a strategic war game concerning the battles in Poland during World War I. There are 3 introductory scenarios included, each of which is designed to be played in 2-3 hours. The campaign game simulates the whole Eastern Front campaign of 1914. Two additional scenarios simulate the most important parts of the campaign. There are rules for a 3 player game as well. This game is entirely in Polish, but includes an English translation of the rules.

title: Golden Trivia Game: Disney Edition
types: Card Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
description: The object is to be the first player to reach a predetermined number of points by answering Disney trivia questions.  The questions are divided into six categories:  Animated Films, Live-Action Films, Disney on TV, Disney Directory, Entertainment Worlds and The Disney Story.

title: Chick-A-Boom
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverPoint to Point Movement
description: In Chick-A-Boom, players roll the special game die to see what they have to do.  Roll the Chick and you're in luck.  You don't have to place any marbles in the nest.  But roll a number and you do.  The nest gets heavier and heavier with every marble placed.  If you place the marble that makes the chick fall through the nest, it's a fowl.  Make him fall three times, and you're an egghead.

title: Mork & Mindy Card Game
types: Action / Dexterity Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
The game is based on the Happy Days science-fiction spin-off Mork  Mindy which was broadcast from 1978 to 1982.

This is a simple card game very similar to UNO. Standard cards feature a color and the name and picture of a creature from Ork while special cards feature characters from the show. Players are dealt 7 cards and eggs are placed on the table (there is one less egg than the number of players). The rest of the cards form a draw pile and the top card is flipped over onto a discard pile. On their turn, players discard a card which matches the upper card of the discard pile in either name or color. As they discard their card, players must call out the name of the card. If they fail to do so and are challenged by another player, players must draw cards. When a player is penalized, he must call out Shazbot and can be penalized again if he fails to do so. If someone plays a Mork Na-No Na-No card, each player must immediately grab a styrofoam egg while shouting Na-no Na-no! The player that is not able to grab an egg is penalized and must draw cards.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the game.

title: London Bridge
description: Become the remaining player after all the other players have caused London Bridge to fall down.  Players spin the spinner and move vehicles onto the bridge till it falls.

title: Snake Dance
types: Action / Dexterity Ancient Animals Children's Game
description:
The first player to remove all of his/her jewels from the twisting, twirling, dancing snakes wins.

The gameboard has a spiral-shaped plastic snake in each corner which is spinning, courtesy of battery power. Over each snake there are various items of treasure, such as rings, crowns or chains. The players need to pick up the treasures by aid of a Pharaoh's Sword, a kind of plastic fork. The player who manages this first, wins.

title: Romantic Journey
mechanisms: ActingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
The goal of this game is to experience romanticism in board game form.

The host of the game must invite his guest by sending out an invitation with the specific gaming date and time. At the start of the game, players must record their ideal romantic journey that they would receive from the other player should they win the game. Players move together in a 21 room mansion and earn privileges they can perform with their partner who has a right of refusal.

The rooms in Romantic Journey do not have furniture - they come alive as you fill them with your thoughts, hopes, dreams and desires.  There is only one movement piece because both players share all experiences in Romantic Journey; for instance, it wouldn't be very romantic if you were in the utility room and your partner was in the game room.  There are no losers in our house.  Everyone is a winner who travels through Romantic Journey.

title: Sexual Trivia Strikes Again
mechanisms: MemoryPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to score 100 orgasms (points) by moving around the board and answering questions correctly.

title: Dance Party
description:
What do you get when you mix dancing, music, crazy stunts, and fun? Dance Party. Turn on the radio or your favorite tape, pick a partner, and try to do dances like the Plunge while back to back with your partner. Sounds crazy? It is.
 Do the moves correctly and win charms to add to your Dance Party bracelet. Be the first to fill your bracelet and become a finalist in the Dance Off. The dancer who can keep up with the crazy dance steps and stunts is the winner.

title: Pig in the Garden
description:
This is a Roll and Move game. After each spin on the Finger Move Dial, players move the corresponding number of spaces. When a player lands on a space showing a vegetable, he may add it to his garden. However, when the spinner lands on the pig, the animal enters the player's garden. Once the pig is in a player's garden, the player must use the Pig Dial. If the Pig Dial shows Feed the Pig, the player must feed the pig one vegetable from his garden. The player uses the Pig Dial until he spins Chase Pig, the pig eats all the vegetables in his garden or another player brings the pig to his own garden.

The first player to fill all 12 sections of his garden wins.

title: Tilt'n Tumble
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and MoveTile Placement
description: On your turn, roll to see what color disk you have to move from the bottom playing board to the top.  Roll a Tilt and you have to lift the board with one finger until the disks roll to the other side.  The player who makes the last safe play before the big spill wins.

title: Side Track
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
This game features the Pop-O-Matic bubble, a clear plastic hemisphere placed over a flexible sheet which prevents the die from being lost and allows for quick die rolls.

The first player to move all four men from the start position around Side Track and back to the Finish position wins.

title: Quick Chess
description: Quick Chess is a minichess variant played on a 6 x 5 board, with five pawns and one each of king, queen, bishop, knight, and rook.  The game is promoted as a learning tool for children and adults, as well as a chess variant. With fewer pieces and less area in which to play, games are generally finished more quickly.

title: Population Game
description:
Each player starts with seven Population Units, two Agricultural Production Units and eight hundred dollars.

Players, in turn, roll the dice and move their pawn around the gameboard. A player will take an event card, be forced to make a decision, gain or lose money or gain population depending on where one's pawn lands.

A player wins by careful, controlled growth of resources and population.

title: Where's the Ostrich?
description: 24 cardboard ostriches are placed in slots in the game board. Their heads are in the sand, so the color cannot be seen. Six slots remain empty. Additionally, each player has nest of six slots in the six colors used in the game. A player now pulls out one ostrich. If the color matches that of the first empty slot in the player's nest, he or she gets to place it in the slot and try for the next color. If there is no match, the ostrich is put back in any of the empty slots on the game board. The first player to fill his/her nest is the winner.

title: Win By A Nose
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Win by a nose features Mr. Nose - the funniest, most far-out way to pop the dice you've ever seen.  Just give a pull on his bright orange nose and watch the dice bounce up in his hat.  He's so much fun to play with that you'll want to pull his nose over and over again.  To win you have to be the first player to get your nose piece to the top level of the game board and complete the face.

title: Sharks!
types: Animals Children's Game Educational Memory Trivia
mechanisms: MemoryPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Race through the oceans of the world on an adventure to find the Great White Shark.  Be the first and Professor Smarty will award you a real fossilized shark tooth.  Test your knowledge and learn about sharks as you play.

This is a Roll and Move and trivia game. On their turn, players roll a die and move accordingly. If they land on a Question space and answer the question correctly, they win an Action card. Players may play some Action cards instead of rolling the die.
 The first player to end his turn on the Great White Shark space at the end of the board wins the game and the shark tooth.

Components:
Game board
49 question cards
40 action cards
4 playing pieces
1 die
1 shark tooth

title: Oh Nuts!
description: Object is to be the first player to collect each of five colors and fill your card.  Each player chooses an illustrated squirrel-away card and takes a nut catcher.  Now place the colored balls in the game tray and turn on the game.  The balls will now be whirling around the tray.  Each player races to try to catch the whirling balls by coming down directly on top of them with the nut-catcher.

title: The War to End All Wars: WWI Axis & Allies Variant
types: Dice Economic Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War I
description: New rules and maps for Axis  Allies system. Includes new rules for unit types specific to WWI and a more divided map for the whole world. There is a setup for: Germany, Austria-Hungary, The Ottoman Empire, British Empire, French Empire, Russia, Japan, Italy and the United States.

title: Wacky Blasters
description:
Each player chooses a Wacky Blaster - Squeaky, Corky, Schnoz or Wheezer and a puffball matching the colour. The board is a mountain trail obstacle course. In a turn the player rolls the die. If a player rolls a 1 - 5, he/she may puff the ball 1 - 5 times. Players can follow the main path or choose to use the shortcut. The 'blaster symbol' allows the player to puff another player puffball backwards, with 1 puff only.
The first player which puffs his/her ball to the top wins the game.

title: Arithmetic Bingo
description: Players cover places on their cards based on what space is called out by a caller as is classic Bingo. But in this game the number is Number One plus/subtract Number Two. Good for children Ages 4 - 6 to learn addition  subtraction.

title: The Munsters Card Game
types: Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
The Munsters Card Game is a game based on the popular 1960's tv series The Munsters.

In a four player game, players are dealt 10 cards. Each player then puts one card face down on a yellow space found on the game sheet. On their turn, players put one of their two markers on a small number space (1 to 7) or on a Bonus picture space (All 0's, All 1's or All 2's). Once each player has placed one marker, the process is repeated so players can place their second marker on an unoccupied space. Cards are then turned face up and the total value of the four cards is added up. If there is a marker on the winning number, its owner wins the round and picks up the four cards which he places face down in front of him. When all four cards are the same, this is a Munster combination. If a marker is placed on this combination, its owner collects the four cards and a 10 points bonus.
