Game of luck and a little planning. The rulebook provides various rules for this game, to enjoy many levels of playing fun.

Aim of the game is to find the fastest route for your car from one house to the other. But beware, on your way you might get stuck in a traffic jam, get stopped by a traffic light or will have to wait while some construction is going on right in front of you.

title: Max & Michi
description: Max  Michi is a memory like game in which you must try and find all the right pieces of  Max or Michi, with the help of a color dice.

title: Tresoro
description: Memory game. There is a treasure hidden on the bottom of the ocean. Peel of the layers of air and land, and find the matching treasure chests.

title: Road Block
description:
In Roadblock, players try to build the most wide-spanning road network while blocking their opponents from doing so.

The players begin the game with 5 road tiles in hand and each turn they draw a new one.  After laying down their first tile, they extend their road network each turn by playing a tile to continue the road from the tile played in the previous turn.  Players can also take their turn to play their tiles on their opponent's road.  If a player is unable to continue from a tile played in the previous turn, he or she can continue his or her road from the last intersection or the very first tile.

The game ends when a player has built a road network that spans at least 12 tiles across; curves at the ends are excluded from the count.  The player that has completed such a road has won the game.  The game also ends when all tiles have been drawn and played.  If no players have not completed a road in the manner mentioned before, then the one whose network spans across the most tiles is the winner.

title: Satellit
description: Space exploration race game, where players work to reach a destination in space and return to Earth first.

title: Schmugglerjagd
description: Two player game, where one player plays a ring of jewel smugglers and the other player plays a team of custom agents.

title: 5 Star
description:
Quoted from the box cover: 5 Star is an exiting but fun travel and business game in which the budding entrepreneur attempts to be the first to not only build an empire but also amass a fortune of $100 million.

Players trade in gourmet restaurant chains, holiday clubs, airlines and luxury hotels. Each player has a different set of objectives and can manipulate the buying and selling price of each of the four types of business to enable them to be bought and sold at a profit to that player. At the same time players may manipulate these prices to, hopefully, cause the other players to trade them at a loss.

In this way players use their entrepreneurial skill to amass a personal fortune but must use business skill and strategy to avoid the consequences of bad dealing.

title: Legion
description:
Legion is a new skill and strategy game. It has 81 unique playing tiles and is played on a 9x9 board with 81 squares. each playing tile is square, and has either two, one or no stripes marked on each side.

Players have seven tiles and take turns to form lines of tiles on the board. After a turn, a player replenishes his seven tiles from the tile bag. Each side of every tile played must match the sides of every tile already on the board that it touches. Pieces score 1 if played onto a white square. The board has a grid of bonus squares. Pieces played onto bonus squares score the number of stripes on the piece played times 2 (blue), 3 (silver), or 5 (gold). Each tile has a red dot on one face, and must be played with this side facing the red dot on the board. The game ends when no player can place any more of their tiles on the board. the number of stripes on pieces still held by each player is deducted from their score at the end of the game. The player with the most points wins.

title: E-Z Run
description:
The object is to score the lowest number of points while trying to get rid of all your cards.

There are four different colored suits numbered 1 to 11, four E-Z Run cards, and four different symbol cards. The board has four E-Z Run columns, four different symbol card spaces and a stockpile card space.

Symbol cards are 25 points each, E-Z Run cards are 15 points each, and cards 1 through 11 are 10 points each. The cards rank from high to low as E-Z Run, 11 - 1, symbol card.

Each person is given five cards and then one card is put on each E-Z Run space. Players may play a descending card of a different color on the E-Z Run columns. Symbol card columns are built same color in ascending order. Entire E-Z run columns may be moved to another to free up the column and allow an E-Z Run card play. When a player does not have a play, they draw a card, and do so every time they run out of plays until three cards have been drawn. Then the turn passes. When someone goes out, the scores are tallied. 100 is the end of game with the lowest score the winner.

title: Car Tricks
description:
Car Tricks is a unique car racing game in that no one person controls a specific car. Instead, players try to predict the entire order of finish for all the cars in the race. All players can influence the speed of a car through their card play. Cards are played in tricks that are used to determine what car can move that round, how far it will move, who will drive the car, and finally what player will lead to the next trick. The track itself is far from any ordinary race track with various short cuts and back tracks scattered throughout the circuit allowing for drivers of the cars to have quite a bit of control over their progress. In the end, the player that most closely predicted the finishing order of each car will emerge victoriously.


A note about how to short cut a homemade version:
Use the cars from Knizia's Formula Motor Racing game and the cards from Sticheln. Using the cards from Sticheln is a real time and work saver! Granted, they won't have the cool race car look but it's a nice trade off if you have the game sitting around.

title: A Game of Thrones: A Clash of Kings Expansion
types: Bluffing Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Negotiation Novel-based Political
mechanisms: Area MovementAuction/BiddingCampaign / Battle Card DrivenPlayer EliminationSimultaneous Action SelectionVariable Player Powers
description:
Publishers description:

Fantasy Flight is ready to deliver A Clash of Kings, the first expansion to "A Game of Thrones: The Board Game"!

This new expansion and will include rules and components for the following:


     The new House Martell (for playing the game with 6 players; includes new cards, tokens, and a large gameboard overlay. 
     An alternative higher-powered set of House Cards for all six Houses. 
     Rules and components for managing the ports of Westeros, 
     New wooden tokens for the powerful but vulnerable Siege Engines.
     Wooden Fortification tokens. 
     Special order tokens for every house.



A Clash of Kings will require the main A Game of Thrones Board Game to play.

title: The Face of Battle
description:
The Face of Battle is a new WWII Skirmish Miniatures Game for 15mm to 28mm figures.
The Face of Battle game simulates the action that occurs during
the peak of battle -- the moments of sheer terror, panic, bravery, and intense combat.
The game is fast, fun and exciting to play. Players are always involved in the action during the game.

title: Hemskyddsspelet
types: Political Trivia World War I World War II
description:
Hemskyddsspelet (Home Defence Game) was designed by Riksluftsskyddsfrbundet (Swedish National Air Defence Association) during the 1930s. The purpose of the game was to combine business with pleasure - let people learn about national war preparedness and community home defence while having fun.
The game is played on a coloured square board with several stacks of event cards. It include elements such as bomb shelters and hospitals, with dud bombs that can block parts of the board. The first Home Defender to reach the goal is the winner.

title: Espinosa
Diabolik: il Colpo Perfetto
description:
Diabolik - il Colpo Perfetto is a board game based on an Italian comic series about a master thief.  The players assume the roles of characters on opposing sides in this game.  On one side are the title character, Diabolik, and his sidekick/wife, Eva Kant.  On the other are Dane and his criminal gang.

The goal of the players in control of Diabolik and Kant is to steal one of the objects on the board and escape unscathed.  Dane and his gang are to prevent the theft and capture the thieves.  The object of theft is randomly chosen (drawing a Mission card) at the start and kept secret from the criminals.  Players can play cards to help themselves or impede their opponents, e.g. deploying and disarming traps.  The die makes movement and the effects of certain cards random affairs.

The game ends when a side has won by achieving its objectives.

title: Passaparola
description: Game based on the Italian TV show Passaparola

title: Verba Game
description:
Verba Game is a word game played with cards.

The cards are split into decks, one for each player.  The players then draw cards from their own deck into their hand.  One player leads off by playing Letter cards (each with a letter of the alphabet) to form a word, replenishing his or her hand from his or her deck after the play.  The other players then try to change the word into another by playing their Letter cards in front or behind the word.  They can also play Anagram cards that allow them to rearrange the letters, or the Erase cards that let them throw away a letter in the word.

The game ends when a player has run out of cards in both his or her hand and deck, making him or her the winner.

title: Click!
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

Click! is a sophisticated strategy game for two players. The players represent two photographers willing to take pictures of neat subjects, like animals, in order to gather the most points. The game is played in two rounds. During each round, each player plays his own deck of cards: the deck is used both to move the photographer along the path, and to take a picture at the right moment. Animals turn out along the circular mountain trail, and a photographer needs to be ahead of the other if he wants to take a good picture: it is important to have a clear view, i.e. not blocked by anyone. Each subject is represented on a tile, and it is worth a certain amount of points, i.e. cameras, in this game. At the end of the round, the players exchange the decks so they will both have the same chance of playing, then new subjects are drawn, and a new round starts. At the end of the game, the winner is the photographer with the most cameras.

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

title: Ascowt
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

In Ascowt the action is set in the exciting world of racing... cows! The aim of the game is to cross the finish line first with your cattle, thus earning the most points possible: but will this be enough in order to win the game? Before the race starts, players lay secret bets on the final standings of the race: well-placed bets on other players' cows may give you the extra points you need to win... or will you dare betting everything on your own cattle, going for broke? At his turn, the player rolls the die: if he rolls a number between one and four, he moves the relevant cow forward one square. On a five, the player may move a cow of his choice, and on a six, the player may choose either to move a cow of his choice, or to milk one. A milked cow usually loses ground and possibly positions in the race... Some special squares on the course give this fast paced and unusual race an extra twist; the race ends when one of the cows crosses the finish line. Each player earns points according to his cow's final standing, plus extra points if he won any bet: whoever has the most points at the end will be nominated Dairy Farmer of the Year!

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

title: Power of Two
description:
Power of Two is an abstract board game in which each player has sixteen pieces and the point of the game is to add them all to the board. You start with two (or in some variations four) pieces and new pieces are added by moving your pieces adjacent to each other. However, there is a catch. Each piece has two lives and using a piece to bring another onto the board uses one of those lives. Therefore, the game has a unique two steps forward one step back feel. In your turn your move may cause your own pieces to be removed but you never capture your opponent's. However, you can leverage your opponent's pieces as you add yours and he does not expend a life doing so.

An alternate winning strategy is to cause your opponent to have no legal move and even if you do not accomplish this, a large part of the game consists of maximizing your own mobility at the expense of your opponent. As with many Kadon games, multiple variations are provided.

title: Eichhörnchenbande
description: Squirrel Gang is a bluffing game for children - if you will, Liar's Dice for kids. The game uses a number of tiny dice  plastic tree trunks to hide them, as the game theme is squirrels hording nuts for the winter.

title: Libertas
description: A tile-laying game of point gathering - the 'theme' is Liberty, which involves using flags on the tiles. The game includes wooden tile holders.

title: Rabatz auf dem Riesenrad
description:
Rabatz (Ruckus on the Ferris Wheel) is more than just a game: it's a game system. It contains 20 plastic rats in four colors, 20 chips in four colors, a die w/rat feet instead of pips, and a 3-D plastic ferris wheel on which the games are played.

The simplest are roll  place games for young children; the best are very tricky memory games mad even more difficult by the continual movement of the ferris wheel.

title: Moves
description:
Moves is a simple, turn-based game but also a mastermind brain cracker. The game starts with 8 stones (7 pawns and a king) on each side. You try to defeat your opponents by taking the opponent king or 6 of the opponent pawns. The number on the stones tell you how many tiles it can move straight or in an L-Bow. The idea for this game is taken from Shogun, but its not entirely the same. Set the Moves Mastermind option when starting a game to show numbers on the board and you will know what number your stone will get next when you move it. This games comes with 5 imaginary friends of fine-tuned artificial intelligence to play off line against your computer, but also allows for multiplayer over LAN or Internet.

You can find more information here:
http://www.codeimp.com/moves_info.php

You can download the game here:
http://www.codeimp.com/moves_download.php

title: Dalton City
description: Dalton City is a western-themed Monopoly-like game with some added chrome, including a figure-8 shaped board path, historical characters for pieces, and a golden nugget that offers special powers to the player that holds it.

title: Nightmare II
types: Adventure Dice Horror Party Game Zombies
description:
He's coming back for more! More frightening fun! More atmosfear! He's the outrageous Zombie, Baron Samedi and he's going to thrill you with another hour of HI-FI shock treatment in this lightning-fast Sequel Game.
This Sequel Game comes with new sets of Time and Fate cards and a 60-minute interactive VHS video cassette. Simply replace the Time and Fate cards in your Master Game Set with these two new sets of cards and you're ready to press play and take on The Baron.
Nightmare II. Scare tactics for 3 to 6 even gamer players aged 12 to adult.
So turn the volume up and the lights down and experience another new dimension in home entertainment. The Interactive Video Board Game Nightmare II. Have another one - TONIGHT!

title: Nightmare III
description:
Welcome to the witching hour! Another 60 minutes of spell-binding interactive entertainment with Anne de Chantraine. Nightmare III- the Sequel to The Video Board Game Nightmare that turns a maiden into a monster!
This is hot-tempered HI-FI horror in a VHS cassette, with new sets of Time and fate cards, twice the dice and three times the fun.
We are on a witch hunt and ugly has a new name. Anne de Chantraine.
Anne de Chantraine was 17 years-old when convicted of witchcraft and burn alive at the stake. She was, naturally, innocent, hence the players response of Mea Culpa Anne. Latin for I am culpable.
Simply insert the new cassette, press play and meet the girl of your dreams in your worst Nightmare.
Anne de Chantraine. Witch. Nightmare. Time to turn up the heat!

title: Nightmare IV
description:
Once bitten, twice shy! Take a turn for the worst and sink your fangs into another 60 minutes of HI-FI fright with The Blood Countess Elizabeth Bathory! - the Sequel to The Video Board GameNightmare that's literally shocking the world!
The Blood Countess Elizabeth Bathory is one of the most murderous Vampires in the history of horror. Born in Hungary in 1560, Bathory killed more than 650 young women, and took early morning baths in their blood in a quest for eternal beauty. Imprisoned in her own castle for her perverse crimes, she died at 64. Or did she?
Now, it's not just a race against time but a game of sheer survival as this bat out of hell bares her teeth in the most challenging sequel in the Nightmare series. No game ever plays the same twice!
Press Play and scream the night away with new sets of Time and Fate cards plus additional Black Rose cards and an interactive Book of Rules.
Countess Elizabeth Bathory. Vampire. Nightmare IV... to love and perish forever!

title: Waterloo
description: Waterloo is vaguely related to Stratego, in that each player moves pieces representing soldiers around the board, and that each piece has a value which can only be seen by the owner. However, this is more of a deduction game - when soldiers end up on the same space, instead of simply comparing values a complicated bidding process takes place which provides the players with information, which they have to use to guess the opposing piece's value.

title: Balancing Bears
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Educational Math
description: Players take turns placing 3 different sizes of bears onto a balance beam (based on the roll of the dice). The player who wins is the first player to balance it perfectly.

title: Trail of the Brotherhood
types: Bluffing Card Game Deduction Horror Novel-based
description:
Trail of the Brotherhood is an adventure game with a deductive element set in the world of H.P. Lovecraft in the 1920s as the Investigative player teams work as a group to discover the Old One the Sorcerer players is working to summon. In a race against time the Investigators will span the globe seeking to uncover clues, attacking cults that have joined The Brotherhood, and working to obtain the keystone magical item required for the final ceremony.  Will they succeed in this desperate quest, or will the Sorcerer player prevail, joining cults together to create the rituals power while wielding the required magic item to open the gate and wake the Old One they worship from slumber?  
 Trail of the Brotherhood is a game for 2  5 players designed by Richard Launius and published by EOS.

title: Vimieiro
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot GREEN Booster
types: Animals Card Game Expansion for Base-game Humor Negotiation
description:
We don't want to split hares, but we have no choice with our new Half Color Bunnies. Featuring the weird world of the Zodiac, the Killer Bunnies Green Booster Deck adds 55 cards to your existing set, plus a twelve-sided Zodiac die!

Other cards include: Snowball which will send a chill down your spine, Fingercuffs to promote teamwork, Leif Carrotson to send your bunnies on a journey around The Bunny Circle, Zodiac Terminator (he'll be back!), and Albino Baby 5000 the world's most powerful radiation protector (and sun tan lotion).

Contents: 55 Large Cards, 12 Small Cards, A Twelve-sided Zodiac Die, and Instruction Book

Expands:

    Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot

title: Hannibal: Rome and Carthage in The Second Punic War 219-202 B.C.
description:
This game covers the Second Punic war fought between Rome and Carthage. The War lasted from 219BC to 203BC with the main emphasis of the game being Hannibal's campaigns in Italy. Each player assumes the role of the leaders of this war, one side being Roman and the other side being Carthaginian. Because of the political decisions made by the Senate of each side, the players may not always have the freedom or strategic choice they desire. Nevertheless, both players must attempt to make the best decisions to gain victory.

Option cards, 38 Roman and 38 Carthaginian, are used by the players to influence the Senate, add reinforcements, cause your enemies units to desert, etc. Most of these cards force you to make a choice between 2 options, which adds an element of command.


     Reimplemented as Hannibal: Rome and Carthage

title: Don't  Quote Me
description: Players race their pawns around a pentagon shaped board. To move, a player must correctly identify the speaker of quotations on cards drawn during play. The player to the right of the player draws a Quote Card. She then reads aloud the quote which matches the category of the player's current space. Players move 3 spaces for guessing without a hint, 2 for guessing with one (biographical) clue or one for picking the right name out of three suggested names. The first player to return to her starting position wins.

title: Mayhem
types: Expansion for Base-game Racing Science Fiction
description:
Mayhem is an expansion for Vapor's Gambit. This expansion includes 6 expansion boards and 6 chits. There are additional turns and straight aways as well as a 4 way intersection and a narrow (2 spaces wide) straight away. Of the chits, there are more ramps and the addition of 2 damage repair chits.

This expansion allows you to build larger and more elaborate tracks.

title: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: The King Takes a Dare
description:
Midnight in the city of New York. It's raining. Three miles away from each other, two men make exactly the same decision at exactly the same time.

One is Daredevil, the red-costumed fighter for justice, who uses his uncanny senses to fight evil where he finds it.

The other is Kingpin, the pinstripe-clad warrior, who has followed his own code of ethics while fighting and clawing his way to the top of a criminal empire more powerful than many small nations.

Each has decided to eliminate the other in a duel to the death on the streets of New York.

One player is Daredevil. The other, Kingpin. Each has his own book of scenarios and choices in this 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks episode of the Marvel Super Heroes Adventure series.

title: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: The Amber Sword of World's End
description:
The game consists of two books, one for each player. One becomes Garth, a monk, Master of the North Wind. The other is his rival Uthrac, a powerful warrior. The two of you have been sent on a quest to the perilous place known as World's End to try to gain possession of the magical Amber Sword.

Race to be the first to win the magical and powerful Amber Sword.

An easy, diceless combat system simulates battle.

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.

title: Himalaya
description:
Heartpounding high adventure cleverly designed as cards.

Whiteouts, Avalanche, Frostbite, The Yeti,..... you'll face them all on your climb to The Summit.

Game includes Meter, Camp, Shortcut, Summit, Gear, Danger,  Avalanche, and Yeti cards.

title: Super Mario Bros. "The Great Ladder Race Game"
Jigsaw Mystery Pack
description:
From the publisher:

Play the detective card game to put the Jigsaw together -- and then have a picture mystery case to solve. Each case has 40 clues and is 8 x 14 inches. The sealed envelope contains the Solutions, and a secret coded message for crime fighters everywhere. Lots of play value!

Rules included for a group co-op game for 12 to 36 players, using all four cases together.

Contents:
36 action cards
4 jigsaw mystery cases
solutions
rules

title: Zoo Train
description:
From the publisher:

Sixteen felt pieces that when put together make a train of zoo animals. The body parts are the same size so a child can create some new kinds of funny animals! If a friend comes over or if it's a Birthday Party, rules are included for using the puzzle as a Group Co-op Game.

title: ZByte
description:
ZByte: hightech playing cards

ZByte is a modification of a normal 52 card deck that replaces the standard suits with logic gates:  and, or, byte, and not.  This not only changes the form, but it also changes the function of the cards.  The symbols allow the cards to interact in new and different ways.  The number cards also display the bit value and binary representation on the face of the card.

Included with the cards is a booklet outlining the functions of the gates as well as games based on the applications of those gates.

From the back of the box:

ZByte is a revolutionary new design in playing cards based on computers - the first logical change in 500 years!

Create and play a new generation of games for the twenty-first century.

Or play all your favorite traditional games, such as Solitaire, Black Jack, Poker, and Gin Rummy.

This 52-card deck contains the standard number cards, aces, jacks, queens, kings, but  with four special suits, and two robot IF jokers.

Enclosed 32-page book has rules for eleven new games and instructions for ZByte game designers.

title: Tokar's Arcana
description:
From the White Mask Productions website:

Tokar's Arcana is a simple, yet in-depth game of strategy and warfare. For the most part, it plays very similar to Chess. Each player has 8 common units and 8 special units, each with their own unique abilities. The object of the game? To capture the other player's general, of course. However, if you are playing a worthy opponent, this will not be an easy task...

title: Vimy Ridge
description:
From the MGDG website:

At 5:30 AM, April 9, 1917, the artillery of British First Army unleashed the greatest barrage to that date. Half an hour later, 48,000 Canadian soldiers left their trenches to assault the impregnable Vimy Ridge. The French and the British had previously tried to capture the ridge but to no avail. On this battlefield the Canadians were to prove themselves. At 2:00 PM the Canadian troops held the ridge.

Vimy Ridge is a simulation of the Canadian attack. The game covers the battle from the initial barrage to the final objectives reached by 1st Division.

Vimy Ridge is the re-release of the game Vimy Ridge: 1917 formerly published by Pacific Rim. There are minimal changes in the rules but the graphics have been substantially changed.

title: Inka
description: Abstract game in which players try to form a pattern on the playing board. In the first phase of the game pieces are placed on the game. In the second phase pieces are moved around the board; Opposing pieces can be removed from the board in a rock-papers-scissors fashion.

title: Walking with Dinosaurs Card Game
types: Educational Movies / TV / Radio theme Prehistoric Trivia
description: A dinosaur trivia card game, based on the popular and award winning BBC series Walking with Dinosaurs.  Includes 70 large cards and rules.  For players Ages 7 and up.

title: Anatomix
description:
Calling all budding doctors and nurses. Anatomix is a fun way to build a body on your playing board. Choose from the skeleton, nerves, muscles and organs, the object is to be the first to complete your body. For younger players simply flick the spinner and take or trade body bits. For older players a multiple-choice question needs to be answered to gain, swap or take a body part. Play and learn more about your anatomy in this fabulous resource.

Learn and improve your knowledge of the body in this biology based game. With 2 different levels perfect for 5+ and 12+ players, this game is great to play with the whole family. This game is made from recycled materials. All questions are in English, French and Spanish.

Players    2 - 4 players or teams,
Ages    5 - 105,
Contains    48 Puzzle pieces, 4 player boards 84 question cards, 1 spinner, 1 rule booklet.,

title: Codswallop
types: Bluffing Children's Game Educational Word Game
description:
CONTENTS

1 Codswallop Console
258 Codswallop description cards
6 Joker Cards
50 Wallop tiddlywinks
6 Yes/No Vote Cards

Object:

Simply put down description cards on the playing console, in turns, across a row or down a column to build a profile of almost anything! But beware of bluffing, because you may be Codswalloped and called on to name your object.

When 3 cards have been played on a line, shout the word they described and claim the points.

title: Walking with Prehistoric Beasts
description: Walking with beasts is a safari style game set in prehistoric times.  Each player controls a group of prehistoric animals that battle opponents.  Inspired by the BBC television series.  Ages 7 and up

title: Walking with Dinosaurs
types: Adventure Educational Environmental Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Walking with Dinosaurs is a game based on the award winning BBC series of the same name. Players Ages 7 and up race around the board attempting to evade the T-Rex and other evolutionary casualties so that they may evolve and survive the Late Cretaceous period.

Box back blurb: Includes a fast, fun version for ages 5+!

title: Quintet
types: Abstract Strategy Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Created for the movie of same name directed by Robert Altman. A commercial version of the game is available in Brazil, translated as Quinteto.

title: Deckmatch: The Unofficial Quake 3 Card Game
types: Card Game Fighting Science Fiction Video Game Theme
description: This is a do-it-yourself card game based on the computer game, Quake 3 Arena.  It can be played with an ordinary deck of cards, but works best if you have a way to create cards with the correct graphics (weapons) on them.  To find the rules, try doing an internet search for 'quake deckmatch'.  The game is a fast paced, turn-based simulation of a first person shooter, where the objective is to kill (or 'frag') your opponent, by reducing his life points to zero, as many times as possible.

title: Papperlapapp
description:
Components include 18 figures, 2 bells, 20 cards, 1 die, 1 sack 1 musical compact disc.

This game pack which retails for DM 59 actually includes 5 different games. The cards depict animals which match the figures. In the game which uses the CD, one's CD player is put into random mode and players must be the first to grab the animal who matches the sound.

Intended for Ages 3 and up.

title: Director's Cut 2
description: Test your movie knowledge in questions on films from the 1960's to present, this trivia game asks questions in various forms from straight knowledge of films to first person who-am-I. If you get the question right you get to roll again. There are some variations listed that punish you for wrong answers by moving back spaces moved forward in that roll and giving other players the chance to steal if incorrectly answered incorrectly.

title: The Star Trek Make-A-Game Book
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
Start Trek: The Motion Picture license published in book form with punch out pieces.

The rules state that the goal is to circle the ship spaces on the board until you get six deflector shields. Then you are supposed to go up the special corridor spaces that lead to the bridge. The first player to reach the bridge wins.

Unfortunately, I see no special corridor spaces that lead to the bridge, so this game is broken right from the outset.

_____________________________________

(NOT SHOUTING - USING CAPS TO MAKE THIS COMMENT EASIER TO DIFFERENTIATE FROM THE ONE ABOVE).

THE CORRIDOR IS THERE, BUT IS NOT OBVIOUS; IF I'D BEEN WRITING OR EDITING THE INSTRUCTIONS, I'D HAVE DESCRIBED THINGS DIFFERENTLY.

ON THE BOARD/MAP, THERE IS ONLY ONE SPACE WHICH IS NOT OFFSET WHEN YOU LOOK AT THE BRIDGE (THE BRIDGE IS THE ENTIRE CENTER SECTION, AROUND WHICH THE SPACES GO). THIS ONE SPACE IS MARKED BLAST, AND IS BETWEEN CREW'S QUARTERS AND WEAPONRY ROOM.

SUPPOSE YOU ARE ON THE YELLOW IMPULSE POWER UNIT SPACE, AND SPIN A 4: 1) BLAST, 2) WEAPONRY ROOM, 3) BLAST, 4) TURN THE CORNER = LANDS YOU INSIDE THE CIRCLE: THE BRIDGE (WHERE YOU SEE ALL OF THE PICTURED CREW MEMBERS AND THE LETTERING THE STAR TREK MAKE-A-GAME BOOK).

THIS IS PROBABLY AN EXAMPLE OF LACK OF TESTING. THE PEOPLE WHO CAME UP WITH THIS LUCK-BASED RUDIMENTARY GAME, WERE SO FAMILIAR WITH ITS LAYOUT THAT THEY THOUGHT THE CORRIDOR WOULD BE OBVIOUS TO EVERYONE ELSE. IF THEY'D ONLY PRESENTED THIS TO SOMEONE ELSE, THAT SOMEONE WOULD HAVE BEEN AS CONFUSED AS THE REST OF US, PROMPTING IMPROVEMENT TO EITHER THE MARKINGS, THE INSTRUCTIONS, OR BOTH.

IT DOES APPEAR TO BE THAT, ONCE YOU LAND ON THE BRIDGE BY EXACT COUNT, THERE IS AN ADDITIONAL ROLL OF A 1, REQUIRED TO REACH THE CREW.

ALL THE BEST!

title: Bells of War: Conquest Series
description: WWII European theater  conquest game. Modeled closely on the Axis and Allies system with 3 levels of complexity. The first level being slightly more complex the Axis and Allies. Adding more units types, rules and complexity all the way up to level 3. Key variations from Axis and Allies include many more unit types, rail movement, Petroleum Production, neutral armies and military  leaders.

title: ShanJari
description:
From the box:
An intricate challenge to build and create winning sequences of colors and combinations. Strategy builds as players place their colored beads. Find a winning combination before your opponent.

A sequence/pattern is decided on by all the players.  The players then attempt to create this pattern by either placing new colored beads on the board, or by moving other previously played beads.

title: 21 Letters
description: 7 cards are drawn from a deck of 54 cards (with three letters printed on the cards) and placed face up on the table. Players must create words using as many of the letters as possible in 2 minutes.  Bonus points are awarded for longer words and for using all 21 letters.  Winner is the first one to an agreed point total.

title: Kwa-Dô
description:
From the Game Box:

Who plays Kwa-D?  Spirited, Fun-loving players have been challenged by the historical beauty and design of Kwa-D for over 400 years!  Kwa-D is an exciting, easy-to-learn matching game ideally suited for up to six players - ages 8 to 100+ years.

Players capture points by matching up cards whose brightly patterend images reflect the seasons and months of the calendar year.  There are 48 playing cards in the Kwa-D deck.

Point cards consist of consist of colorful red and blue scrolls, wild birds and animals, and a mystical dragon.  The dragon is the highest point card in the game.  Players strive to match these valuable point cards during their turn, thus preventing opponents an opportunity to score.  Most games can easily be played in less than an hour.

An illustrated rule book and score pad are included with each game.

title: Boom Box
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

In Boom Box you are challenged in balancing your Boom Box right and left audio channels. Boom Box can be played by 2 or more players at the same time: each player just needs the supplied deck of 27 cards (print and cut them); the faster the player gets rid of his cards, the better! The cards represent different notes in three different colours and different lengths. After each player has flipped over the first card from their decks (this card representing the Boom Box itself), they must play their cards to the left or right of the radio, respecting these two easy rules: if you want to place a card on the Boom Box left channel, this card does not have to have any characteristic in common - number of notes, colour, length - with the preceding one; on the other hand, if you want to place a card on the Boom Box right channel, it must have at least one thing in common with the previous one. It is easy, isn't it? But what if the goal is to have the same number of cards on the left and on the right? Things get interesting and slightly harder, but funnier as well! Challenge your friends in this fast competition, and you will see! As soon as cards are placed, players draw new ones from their decks: when a deck is emptied, the round is over and points are scored. After three rounds, the player with the most points is the winner.

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

title: Freestyle
description: FreeStyle is a game of competition in a swimming pool. Players (from 2 to 8) move their athletes on the board representing a pool: athletes must dive, swim to the other side and back, just as in a real competition. In order to play FreeStyle, you need, beside the board supplied with the file, six dice and a token for each player. FreeStyle has some basic rules, intended for children, and some advanced ones, for adults and children smarter than adults.

title: CromoGnomo
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

CromoGnomo is a game for four players, playing in two teams of two players each, that deals with four painter gnomes.  Each gnome/player begins the game with the same hand of twelve colour cards. During his turn, each player either plays in the bucket one of his card, or passes. The colours in the bucket blend to form other colours: at the end of each round, one of the team may score points if the resulting colour is one of his favourites.

An elegant and fun card game created during the event Create a Game from Scratch (Gradara Ludens 2003) by:  Andrea Angiolino, Roberto Cestaro, Claudio Del Pizzo, Emiliano Liverani, Giovanni Galanti, Silvano Sorrentino.

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

title: The Artifact
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

The Artifact takes us in a fantasy world far away, where humans, magical and evil creatures can be easily found walking around, just as in any Tolkien-inspired game. Players take up the role of one of these heroes (a Human, a Dwarf, an Elf and a Hobbit, indeed) and must recover their weapon, which is proved to be the only mean to destroy a powerful Artifact that is trying to put under its control the whole world. The path to the Mountain of Fate, the place where the Artifact is giving out its will, is full of dangerous creatures such as Trolls, Orcs and the mighty Black Knight. During his turn, the player rolls two different colored six-sided dice, thus determining both his hero movement and which of the evil character will be moved by the player sitting to his right. You got it: players are trying both to win advantage for their heroes and to stop the other players' ones at the same time. And if it's not your lucky day, you may even change the outcome you have rolled, but are you ready to pay its price, giving your opponents a free move? The game gets even more interesting because each evil character has its own special ability, and the map represents different types of terrain: each hero has a favored type of terrain (e.g. woods for the Elf) where he can peacefully rest and plan his next moves. Last but not least, there is also the possibility of casting a powerful spell and then bend evil characters' wills to yours...

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

title: 12 O'Clock High Card Game
types: Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme World War II
description: A fast playing card game like Go Fish but with pictures of popular World War II planes in Europe. A group of 4 cards of the same letter group is called a Squadron. One player asks for a particular card from one player. If successful another request can be made. Once a squadron is completed they are placed face up on the table and are out of play. When all players are out of cards the game is over. The player with the most squadrons is the Wing Commander and winner.

title: Word Spin
description: 8 ten-sided discs have letters on each face; the consonants have points values. The discs are magnetic and hold together, allowing the player to quickly rotate the discs back and forth to make words. You can easily break the whole thing apart to re-arrange the discs for variety. Includes various rules for different word games.

title: Battle Rider
description:
Battle Rider is a stand alone scifi game, maps are compatible to Brilliant Lances.

From the box:
Battle Rider is the game of squadron and fleet combat in GDWs Traveller universe.
Battle Rider gives you fast-moving fleet combat without the need for roleplaying levels of detail.
Interactive game turn sequences and hidden task force rules emphasize decision-making, tactics, and bluffing instead of game mechanics.
Unique diceless game system utilizes battle resolution cards for all sensor, evasion, and firing tasks.

title: Slime Monster Game
description:
From the rules:  The Slime Monster has invaded the town.  You've got to stop him!  You must get from the High School to the Armory, pick up a land mine and knock the Slime Monster over.  But be careful that the Slime monster doesn't knock you over with his slime.

Movement is directed with a spinner. Each spin is used twice: once for the player and the same amount for the monster.  The players try to manipulate the monster so that he winds up standing over an opponent.  He then slimes the player and moves.  If the slime covering the player causes the player piece to fall over, the player must start again.  Yuck!

title: Cold Feet
description: The Squirt Game!  A very unusual game that has a water gun attached to the game board.  Spin the spinner on the game board and fire the water gun, but it only fires once or twice out of every six trigger pulls.  Players start the game with 5 tokens.  Trade in small water drip tokens to avoid getting shot and collect tokens when the trigger is pulled but does not fire.  Tokens are small, medium and large sized plastic water drops.  Trade in 5 small tokens for a medium token.  Trade in 2 medium tokens for a large token and win the game by trading in 2 large tokens for the Big Shot button.  Just the game we want to play in a room filled with cardboard game boxes!

title: Pot Luck
description: Buying and selling of pot in a Monopoly-like game where you want bales of pot rather than Hotels.  The game board and the Bum Me Out and Far Out cards have colorful cartoon art, but the Pot (property) cards have color photos of the different types of pot you can own.  Simple game with little substance.  Great for collectors of contraband games, but doesn't get played very often.

title: Fleet Action
types: Book Miniatures Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Fleet Action is a game concerning large struggles in the Babylon 5 Universe.

From the cover:
Fleet Action is a fast-paced game of starship combat on a fleet scale. No longer are you simply concerned with the actions of just one or two warships. Now you must guide the actions of three dozen at once.

title: Times Table Snap
description: Time's Table Snap uses a unique deck of cards to teach children multiplication concepts through games of pairs and snaps.  Great for children practicing their multiplication tables. Ages 6 and up

title: Four Function Snap
description: A unique card deck designed to teach children children basic math concepts using snaps and pairs.  Covers addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, as well as a few square roots, squares, and cubes.  Ages 7 and up

title: Like It or Lump It
description: All the players are dealt 5-8 cards, depending on the number of people playing. Each card lists a thing to which a person is likely to have some emotional response. The cards have things as varied as hip hop, the smell of oranges, Brad Pitt, scoring the winning point, and breakfast in bed. One player is the Lumper. The other players must give the Lumper a card from their hand that they think he/she will like a lot. The Lumper then arranges the cards on a board, which has spaces for Like It (10 points), Thumbs Up (7 points) A-OK (5 points), Not Bad (3 points), So So (2 points), Whatever (1 point), and Lump It (negative 5 points). The players earn (or lose) points depending on where their card was placed. The role of Lumper moves to the left, and when everyone has been a Lumper a prescribed number of times, the game ends. The highest score wins.

title: Arena
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

The cost of life is increasing every day, and you do not know what to do with the coins in your pockets? Then Arena is the game for you! All the matches in this particular Arena are fought using nothing but coins and some dexterity: the White player and the Black one, on their turn, grab one of the twenty coins available and drop it in the Arena, trying to cover their opponent's dots while protecting their owns. Each move can mess up the board, because you are not only challenging your friend, but also the force of gravity itself!

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

title: Landwehr 1438
description: Tactical, topological tile game. It's set in medieval Northern Germany where four merchants set off to sell their goods in other towns and have to discover the safest and shortest roads for themselves, thereby avoiding many obstacles and roughness.

title: Pounce
description:
Two-player abstract played on an 8x8 grid.  The basic pieces are tall columns belonging to either player.  When a player jumps another player's column, he places one of his discs on it, claiming it for himself.  Columns can change ownership repeatedly in this way.  The winner is the first player to move his remaining columns into his opponent's home row.

Can a game with sixteen pieces and simple rules provide the action of checkers and the strategy of chess?  The answer is yes, if the game is Pounce, the game that takes minutes to learn--and years to master.

title: Fortune's Colony
types: Action / Dexterity Dice Humor Print & Play Science Fiction Space Exploration
description:
In the far off distant future, corporations vie for control of new worlds and the resources they comprise. Using five 8-sided dice printed with colorful icons, players vie to land explorers, miners, bases, and supply ships on a newly-discovered planet. Watch out, though - your opponent's dice can knock into yours, disrupting your carefully laid explorations!

You need to print and assemble the dice yourself. Paper is OK, but 110lb cardstock is better. Surprisingly, once folded and glued, the dice have a fair bit of weight to them - not enough to put someone's eye out, but enough for the game to be playable.

The commercial PDF also included a cut-n-assemble box to keep the components in once you've cut and folded. The free version does not.

title: All-in-the-Dice Baseball
description: All-in-the-Dice Baseball is an exciting dice game that simulates all of the action found in professional baseball. There are hits, outs, walks, steals, and erros. Although the results of each play are in the dice, it is the player who determines the strategy to be employed. The game has been statistically perfected so that it is accurate within 2% of professional baseball. Anyone with an understanding of the game of baseball will have endless hours of fun playing the game. AITD can be played with 1 or 2 players. The rules are below in the image section.

title: Bridgehead
description:
Bridgehead is a game of military tactics a two teams maneuver to build and control a bridge of men across the board between two base positions.

Simple abstract game with a 5x8 position board and 6 pieces per side.

title: Girl Power
description: Players take turns rolling the dice and collecting tokens representing spirit, loyalty, pride and girl power.  The first player to get ten girl power tokens gets to decide to take a solo win, or to continue the game until everyone has ten girl power (a group win).  The various spaces and cards all reflect scenarios tending to stress the game's unabashed message of cooperative endeavor.

title: WarCraft: The Board Game Expansion Set
types: Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Fighting Video Game Theme Wargame
description:
Only the Ruthless Survive!

Warcraft: The Board Game receives its highly-anticipated expansion! The Warcraft Expansion Set includes a multitude of exciting and flavorful new options for your Warcraft board game experience.

* New rules and components for the sixteen Warcraft heroes
    * Random creep encounters
    * New special race decks
    * New specialized board tiles
    * New scenarios
    * New resource system

For countless hours of brutal fantasy fun!

The Warcraft Expansion Set requires WarCraft: The Board Game to play.

Expands:

    WarCraft: The Board Game




Microbadge:

title: Zamitar
description:
Zamitar is a chess style game with very 70s inspired sci-fi acrylic pieces. Each piece has its own move, as in a normal chess game. The difference being that a few of the pieces can bounce their moves off the walls.
To win you must take the opponents Space Station piece. The astronaut piece definitely has a Danger - Will Robinson (from the old LOST IN SPACE TV Show)  feel about it. It is possible to purchase two other forces so you can have a four-player version.

title: Crosshand Poker
description:
Crosshand Poker is a cross between scrabble and poker.
108 (two decks including jokers) traditional playing-card symbol tiles being played on a scrabble-esque grid board inclusive of double and triple scores.

Players draw and update 5 tiles in their rack and play poker 'hands' of tiles branching from the center of the board. Each type of hand has a different score as set out in the. Very much like scrabble except the scores are not on a per-tile basis. 
Winner has most points when pool of tiles is depleted.

title: Alphabet Squiggle
types: Children's Game Educational Memory Word Game
mechanisms: Line DrawingMemoryPaper-and-PencilPattern RecognitionRoll / Spin and MoveSimulation
description:
Alphabet SQUIGGLE introduces letters to kids in a fun and clever new way. Kids will learn and improve letter recognition, stimulate their creativity and even strengthen their vocabulary. Children who are just learning letters and those who already know them well will enjoy playing. Watch how surprised they get when they see how much they can do with letters.

Players move along a path of letters. For every letter they land on, the players must find that letter on the outside edge of the board and either trace it or write it from memory on the sketch paper provided. If they're feeling creative, they can turn their letter tracing into a picture, write a word that begins with that letter, or create a drawing that begins with and reinforces that letter.

title: Words from Words
description: Roll the die and move around the board. If you land on a letter square, draw a card with a long word on it. You have 60 seconds to find the longest word using the letters in the card word. You move a variable number of spaces depending on the length of the found word. The other players can challenge you by spelling out a longer word. There is a small dictionary that lists all spellable words for each card word. Game includes over 400 word cards, 25 tokens for scoring, 1 d6 and a 1 min sand timer.

title: Three Blind Dice
description: From the box: Three Blind Dice combines the excitement of a sharp shooting dice game with the thrill of a high stakes card game. Out smart other players in an attempt to keep your dice. Out bluff the same players into losing their dice. However beware! One wrong bid and you lose a die, lose all five and the game is over.

title: Dispatch: The Airport Strategy Game
mechanisms: Area MovementDice RollingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: The aim of the game is for players to get all aircraft into the airport and airborne again as quickly as possible to beat the other players.

title: Black or White
description:
Abstract game on 6x6 grid that folds up to form the box. Players have 6 pieces each with one side black, the other white, like Reversi/Othello pieces. Pieces may move in any direction and when they jump an opponents piece, it's turned over to show your color. 
An uninspiring variant on Reversi which lacks clear rules. Can you make multiple jumps? How far can you move? Can you make a better game with the contents?

title: Rock the Boat
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Nautical Pirates
description: A children's game where the object is to be the last player in the game.  A plastic and cardboard boat (divided into colored quarters) is balanced on the corners of the box.  A spinner dictates the placement of a pirate mouse on a colored section of the boat.  If all the pirates are placed onto the boat, the spinner then dictates which pirates are removed from the boat.  A players that causes the pirates to fall into the ocean (box) is eliminated from the game.  The remaining player is declared the winner.  Game art was done by Richard Scarry.

title: Soccer
description: Each of the two players is a captain of a team.  The team is represented by 11 wood units with a peg on them where a wood ball may sit.  The soccer field is represented by circle spaces for movement.  The active player rolls 2d6 to determine movement allowed.  Movement allowance is spread out as desired between your players and determined by whether a player has the ball or not.  It's all very simple, but works fantastic!   Currently out of print.

title: Play Grimm
description: Its a Race over several Tracks and if you came late, you get more Points. But if you are too late you get no Points.

title: Railway Rivals Map CH: China
description: Railway Rivals Map CH: China, a map for use with both Railway Rivals and Dampfross, covers from Shenyang in the northeast, the Mongolian border in the northwest, the Laos/Vietnamese  border in the southwest, and the Pacific Ocean in the southeast/east.

title: Bagpuss
description:
Help Emily, Bagpuss and friends find homes for the lost things.

This game is based on the childrens TV series, Bagpuss about an old toy cat and his friends; toys that come to life to study the lost things their owner Emily brings into her special shop. Players move around the board taking penalties, extra goes or collecting cards with pictures of one or more of the characters from the series on them. Whenever a player has a complete set of all of the characters they can trade them in for a card from the 'lost things' pile. When all of the lost things have been drawn the player with the most wins.

title: The Last Straw
description: Load the camel with straw, but don't be the one to add the straw that breaks the camel's back! Two piece camel on wheels, held together with a rubber band, will eventually collapse under the weight of the wooden sticks.

title: Roundabout
mechanisms: Dice RollingGrid MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
This abstract game consists of five concentric rings divided into sixteen sectors (bars).  Each player has a home sector that is four bars wide.  Ten directional playing pieces start in the center bars of the home sector facing outwards.  Each turn players roll two dice and use each dice roll to move a piece either in its facing direction or along its bar.  When a piece starts a turn outside of it home sector and then is moved within the sector it is removed from the game.  The first player to run out of pieces wins the game.

Additional complexity comes from blocking, capturing (freezing pieces while simultaneously preventing other opposing pieces from entering the bar in which the capture occurs), removing pieces from the board through `ringers' and special moves from rolling doubles.  Variant rules exist for more cutthroat games and games with more than two players.

title: Campaign Secrets
description:
Campaign Secrets is a political card game where you are a candidate in the race for the White House. You must out-campaign your opponents to win the favor of your constituents. And most importantly, don't let those voters find out about your dirty little secrets!

Campaign Secrets is a fun educational game. Each card has tidbits about real presidential elections. In addition, the campaign strategies and secrets in the game, are all taken from real-life strategies and scandals. Playing the game can give many children and adults alike an insight into how a real election comes together.

In the game, you play a series of campaign strategies trying to get more percentage of the vote than the other players in the game. Eventually, through game play, you'll either choose or stumble into your running mate. Together the two of you must do your best to wrangle as many votes as possible away from the other players, and to hold on to your secrets so you can pick up a few extra votes at the end of the game.

The game was designed for families and classrooms, so while it can be fun and educational for hard-core gamers, it's still simple enough for everybody to play. If you're looking for a fun way to learn about the election process, or just a fun game to play with your family, then this is the game for you. If you're looking a hard-core strategy game then you might want to look elsewhere.

NOTE: You may have played the First Edition of this game, but the Second Edition plays considerably different. The first edition was a quick and dirty version put out as a free give away for trade shows, the second edition is the real game.

title: Touch and Feel
description:
From the box:
Each player has 6 coloured stickers attached to their body.  Turns are taken to throw the giant coloured dice, and a hand or foot is placed on another person's sticker of the colour thrown.
Before long there is a mass of writhing bodies in the room!
How embarrassing it gets depends on where people put their stickers!
CONTENTS: 200 Touch and Feel Stickers, one giant wood dice
Produced for CA shops.

title: Pig Dice
description:
Pig Dice, an ancestor of Pass the Pigs and a descendant of Pig, is a jeopardy dice game, where the dominant type of decision is whether or not to jeopardize previous gains by rolling for potential greater gains.  In particular, Pig Dice is a jeopardy race game, where the object is to be the first to meet or exceed a goal score.

One die is a standard die with a pig head replacing the 1.  The other is a standard die with a pig tail replacing the 6.  Such rolls are called Heads and Tails, respectively, and modify the value of the roll.  The goal score is 100, yet after a player has met or exceeded 100, all other players have one more turn to achieve a higher score.

title: Nak Naks
description:
Each collectable Nak Nak figure can be posed in over 80 different stacking poses. Object is to see how many NAKNAK figures you can stack. 
Each Player takes turns rolling 2 dice, one die determines if u stack your Nak Nak on the ground or on the stack on top of another Nak Nak. The other die determines what body part of the Nak Nak that need to be touching the stack or ground. 
If a player drops the stack the player who went before him takes the Nak Naks that fell of the stack, Last player with Nak Naks Wins.

title: Lass nichts fallen, Kleiner Rabe
description: Don't Drop Anything, Little Raven!  How much can the little raven carry?  The small raven is moving house. There are many things from the old nest that must be brought to the new nest. And because the small raven wants to carry everything all at once, the children try to attach as many different objects as possible on the raven's figure. The screen over the wing, the pocket to the tail, the cake on the head... Pay attention so that nothing falls off.

title: National Geographic Mystery Voyage Game
description: Explore the world! You've been transported to a mystery location - now figure out where you are. Race around the board to collect clues...the first player to put clues together and figure out the mystery location wins the game.

title: Reich: The Iron Dream of German Unification
description:
REICH portrays events in Germany between the Reformation and the unification engineered by Bismarck. Players are not bound to a pre-determined sequence of events; rather, major social forces are used to compose game elements. These include Marxist agitation, religious riots, peasant uprisings, revolts, Papal recognition, key ministers (like the Iron Chancellor himself), foreign intervention and aid, mobilizations and wars, etc., making up a game system both exciting and flavorful.

Each player becomes a Prince attempting to unify a fragmented Germany by means of adroit diplomacy, cunning bargains, and sudden mobilizations and armed strikes. Each turn allows for card play and interaction, then demands that the phasing player choose one of four exclusive policies in the ensuing Action Phase. Player intelligence, elan, and flexibility determine a game's outcome, with little reference to luck. Opportunities for conclusive action are many, but must be seized decisively and courageously. Winning or losing, REICH is a memorable and enjoyable experience for every player.

title: Time Travel Baseball
description: Time Travel Baseball included players from early 1900s to the late 70s. Expansion sets included players in the early 80s. The game also had special rules to allow you to play in various eras of baseball. These special era rules allowed you to see how players of the 70s may have fared when playing in the dead-ball era. One of the expansion sets you would even included a player card with your name on it when you ordered from the manufacturer.

title: Global Supremacy
types: Card Game Modern Warfare Print & Play Wargame
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

In this heavily  armed card game, you take on the role of  a military superpower. Your mission: To  obtain 100 points worth of property. And  we're not talking property like your grandmother's 2 story house, or a Ford  Pinto with 56 thousand miles on it, we  mean Washington D.C., Moscow, and Rome to  name a few.

Game play wise, don't expect to see  the honorable warfare that died off in the samurai centuries.  Now-a-days, we've got spies, blackmail,  market manipulation, terrorism, and of  course, the ever popular nuclear bomb,  which has the ability to completely  annihilate any city quicker than you can  yell HEY! What the?!?! Now THAT's a great Sunday family activity!

With Global Supremacy, expect to lose  your mind The speed of the game is  fast, so keep a clear head or you'll lose  it, along with any chances of winning the  game. Sound fun? It does to me, too! So  pick Global Supremacy up, since the price  matches all other products here at  WM Nothing.

Global Supremacy can be downloaded at whitemask.com

title: I Bet I Know
description:
From the box bottom:

This entertaining information game combines risk-taking and strategy.  A roll of the giant 12-sided die determines the category you'll answer, or which special instruction you'll follow.

If you roll a category, you must decide how much you know in that field.  Is Sports your best category?  Then bet you'll win the maximum $100.  Not sure about Entertainment?  Then select $50.  Totally adrift in Science?  Then try the easiest $25.  Keep in mind you're trying to be the first player to win $750 in game chips.

Each side of each card has three clues, all leading to the same answer.  The clues range from difficult to easy, but all will be informative and fun.  There are 1,200 different answers and 3,600 clues in all, so the game can be played many times.

Special instructions on the die, such as Double or Their Choice, give the game real variety.  As an added twist, you can challenge your opponent if you think he or she has bet more than he or she knows.

title: Xevoz
types: Collectible Components Dice Fighting Science Fiction
description: A one-on-one fighting game that uses highly articulated, customizable, fully interchangeable figures based on the Stikfas line of figures. Various factions duke it out using customizable dice to determine battle outcome and effect with the players removing parts from their figures as they take damage, and adding back as they heal.

title: Chifoumi
description: A hybrid of rock-paper-scissors and checkers in which players move pieces of four kinds over a cross-shaped board.

title: No Middle Ground
description:
Most wargames come to us with a comfortable distance in time, covering events that happened long ago. We can explore the details in history books and commemorate the decades or even centuries that have passed since the end of the war.

There is no such comfortable passage of time in the Arab Israeli conflict, which sometimes feels like one long campaign, with pauses. We see as much in the newspaper as we do in history books.

So it is that ATO #46 is announced at a time when both Israelis and Syrians are at war, but not so much with each other.

No Middle Ground, by Paul Rohrbaugh, covers the most decisive actions on the northern front of the 1973 Arab-Israeli Conflict.

There are three scenarios, from the opening Syrian attack to retake Golan, to the daring Israeli counter-offensive that drove into the heart of Syria and took the war to the doorsteps of Damascus. Plus a Grand Campaign game that covers the entire campaign for the Golan.

Each copy of No Middle Ground includes a 22 by 34 map and a full sheet of colorful die-cut counters that represent brigades from the Syrian and Arab Allies armed forces and the battalions of the Israeli Defense Force. Air units on both sides are potent weapons but must dodge the enemys AAA and SAMs. Map hexes are 4 kilometers across and each turn represents 8 hours. Plus a well illustrated rulebook and charts, complete with designers notes and historical commentary.

Rules for No Middle Ground include, among others, Time-on-Target artillery barrages, Combined-Arms tactics, Improved Positions, Minefields, Airborne and Commando assaults, as well as optional units that could have been deployed by both sides. The interactive, chit-pull formation activation recreates the chaos of battle while still allowing players to deploy and fight their armies.

No Middle Ground will test the resolve and skills of game novices and veterans alike. Although designed for two players, solitaire play is quite easy.

No Middle Ground and issue #46 of ATO:

Map - One full color 22x34 mapsheet

Counters - Over 200 full color 9/16 die-cut pieces

Rules length - 12 pages

Charts and tables - 2 pages

Complexity - Medium

Solitaire suitability - Average

title: Armies of Oblivion: ASL Module 12
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
(from MMP website :)

Armies of Oblivion is the long-awaited module adding the Axis Minors order of battle to the Advanced Squad Leader tactical game system.

Contents:

4 8x22 geomorphic mapboards 48,49,50,51 ( STARTER KIT STYLE MAPBOARDS ; Mounted Map (old-style) Version OUT OF PRINT)
Overlays Hi8-Hi12, Rv1, Wd12, Wd34
6 Counter sheets
11 ASL Scenarios 111-121
Axis Minor Chapter H pages (H143-H172)
Errata pages A51-A62; D21-D26; S27-S34
2 SASL Axis Minor (Generation and Random Event) cards

Scenario List:

111 Balkan Sideshow, Szenttanas, Yugoslavia, 1941
112 Out of Cowardice, Senta, Yugoslavia, 1941
113 Liberating Bessarabia, Branzeni, Bessarabia, 1941
114 Cautious Crusaders, Lipovic, Ukraine 1941
115 Huns of Steel, Uriv, Russia, 1942
116 The Sixth Blow, Skopce, Poland, 1944
117 With Tigers On Their Tail, Saturnia, Galicia, 1944
118 Downsizing the Uprising, Vrutky, Slovakia, 1944
119 Ancient Feud, Cluj, Transylvania, 1944
120 Return to Sender, Nish, Serbia, 1944
121 End Station Budapest, Budapest, Hungary, 1945


(BGG original summarized description :)

Twelfth module for Advanced Squad Leader system, adding Minor Axis (Romanian, Bulgarian, Hungarian) infantry, vehicles, and ordnance.

title: ASL Action Pack #2
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
The ASL Action Packs are expansions for ASL that are more 'lightweight' compared to the standard boxed modules. Each Action Pack consist of a couple of boards and scenarios that expand the ASL game system without requiring new rules sections. Pack #2 includes boards 46 and 47, eight scenarios, an overrun flowchart and two sheets of overlays.

Note: Ownership of ASL, Beyond Valor, Yanks, Code of Bushido, and Gung Ho is required.   Additionally, one of the eight scenarios requires the British (West of Alamein) and one requires the Italians (Hollow Legions).  Some overlays from Croix de Guerre are required and the following boards are utilized in one or more scenarios: 4, 10, 13, 41, 42, and 43.

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader
    Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1
    Yanks: ASL Module 3
    Code of Bushido: ASL Module 8
    Gung Ho!: ASL Module 9




(all are required for expansion play)
2 Scenarios also need:

    West of Alamein: ASL Module 5
    Hollow Legions: ASL Module 7
    Croix de Guerre: ASL Module 10




Scenarios:
AP 9: Red Storm
AP10: Closing the Net
AP11: Swamp Cats
AP12: Cream of the Crop
AP13: Shielding the Moscow
AP14: Ace in the Hole
AP15: Broken Bamboo
AP16: Danger Forward

title: Trhyme
description:
Trhyme (pronounced Trime) is a word game with a triple twist: you're given three clues for which you must provide three answers within a specified time, and the three answers must rhyme with one another.

Example: Birds do it, bees do it, bells do it.
Answer: Sing, Sting, Ring

The first player/team to the center of the board by answering the correct trhymes wins.

title: Wide Open
description: Race fans! Your goal is to collect all of the cards that will allow you to run WIDE OPEN and race to the finish line. Roll the dice, hit the right combination and take the checkered flag. It's real racing action! You must qualify to race, roll out of pit stops, and beware of racing hazards that may shift the lead on any turn. Watch out! There's always the chance of a wipe out. Have fun... It's Awesome!

title: Cartel: The International Oil Game
description:
In CARTEL: The International Oil Game, you try to become the wealthiest player, and therefore, the winner. You will try to invest in oil fields throughout the world, and sell any crude oil that you obtain for the most profit. The first player to obtain ten million petro-dollars in cash is the winner of the game.

Note: This is not the same thing as the Philip Orbanes game Cartel.

title: Army Group North: The Summer Offensive Against Leningrad, 1941
description:
Army Group North: The Summer Offensive Against Leningrad, 1941,  is a World War II division level strategic game of the Barbarossa offensive against Leningrad from 22 Jun to 12 September 1941.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 week
Hex: 18.6 miles / 30 kilometers
Units: Regiment to Division

Game Inventory:
One 17 x 22 three color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (228 9/16 counters)
One 12-page Army Group North rulebook
One 6-sided die

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 3-10

title: Chariot-Race at Carthage Circus
description:
The game consists of a game board representing the race track at the Carthage Circus, a long, oval wooden piece separating the center of the board and used as a lap counter, 4 wooden chariots, 28 Fates Cards, 45 Chance Cards and 2 dice.

At the start of the game each player selects a color and the Fates Cards are distributed evenly between the players. On a players turn they roll the dice and move that many spaces forwards. On the roll of an even number, movement must be straight ahead. If an an odd number is rolled, the player can change lanes. The game ends once a player has completed 7 laps of the track.

The innovation that stops this from becoming a roll and move game are the Fates Cards and the Chance Cards. The board spaces are marked with either a C Chance symbol, an F Fates symbol, or a Fatum symbol. If your piece ends its turn in one of the spaces, then you follow the directions. If you land on a Fatum symbol and have the corresponding Fates card then you follow the directions on the Fates card either good or bad. If you land on an F symbol then you can swap a Fates card with the player on your left. If you land on a C symbol then you take a Chance card and the instructions are followed by the player indicated on the card.

This game is not to be taken too seriously and has a large element of luck.
The most unique thing about this game is that it is a Tunisian production released for the 28th century anniversary since the founding of Carthage, and as such was produced for the tourist market.

title: Clash of the Titans Game
description: Spin and move game based on the 1981 MGM movie, Clash of the Titans has each player taking on the role of Perseus.  Each Perseus is trying to gather the Medusa's head and the five magic items needed to pass the five obstacles in a race to the finish where he will show the Medusa's head to the Kraken and win the game.

title: Bastogne or Bust (second edition)
description:
Battle of the Bulge, December, 1944

Bastogne or Bust! recreates the Battle of the Bulge at the operational level of scale. The units represent companies, battalions, and regiments that either participated in the battle or were available for committment by their respective commanders. Althought the game is moderate in complexity, it can be easily taught to those who are new to wargaming. Bastogne or Bust! has numerous special rules to deal with situations that were unique to this battle. There are German Fuel Shortages, the Einheit Steilau Commandos, Skorzeny's 150th Commando Brigade, and a Von Der Heydte Parachute Battalion that actually gets onto the map! A system of off-board movement and combat ensures that the action is no confined to the game map.

title: Number Quest
description:
Number quest is a game of making numbers from the combination of the roll of 4 dice.
The game consists of a Diamond shaped board separated into 100 hexes numbered 1 to 100.Numbers 1 and 100 start at opposite ends of the diamond and the rows in between are filled in by the following combinations.
Coloured orange 1,2-3,4-6,7-10,11-15,
Coloured turquoise 16-21,22-28
Coloured yellow 29-36,37-45
Coloured  blue 46-55,56-64
Coloured green 65-72,73-79
Coloured purple 80-85,86-90
Coloured red 91-94,95-97,98-99,100
All of the numbers are printed in black except for the prime numbers which are printed in white.
On a players turn they roll 4 dice and try to make a number by addition,  subtraction, multiplication or division using each number once and all four numbers.Once the number is made they cover the number with a token and receive a reward dependent on the numbers value.The reward given will be orange section 10,turquoise section 20,yellow section 50,blue section 100,green section 200,purple section 300 and the red section 500.It is then the next players turn to make a new number by rolling the dice.However numbers covered over are out of the game.
If a player places a token to form a triangle of 3 hexes then they gain a bonus of 100,If the number covered that form the triangle is a prime number then the bonus is 200.
If a player can not form a number on their turn then they miss a go.

title: Four Battles in North Africa
description:
Four game in the Western Desert 1941-1943. Standard rules and Exclusive rules for each of the four games.

    Crusader, Battle for Tobruk, November 1941
    Cauldron, Battle of Gazala, May 1942
    Supercharge, Battle of El Alamein, October 1942
    Kasserine, Baptism of Fire, February 1943.

title: DMZ: The Battle for South Korea, late 1970s
description:
DMZ is a hyphthetical battle during the Cold War era. Part of the Modern Battles II: Four Contemporary Conflicts.

Re-implemented by:

    DMZ: The Next Korean War

title: Fantasy Rules!
description:
(From the Publisher)
 Fantasy Rules! 3rd edition 2004 
Chipco's Fantasy Rules! lets you game in the worlds of fantasy and mythology with rules that are easy, flexible, innovative, fast, and fun. Fantasy Rules! may be played with any figures currently in your collection and playing time is around one hour for typical armies. Armies are generally made up of 30 to 50 figures. Characters are included in the system, but are not so powerful as to overly influence and unbalance the outcome of the game.

* FR!3 may be played with any figures you have and is very well suited for use with figures mounted on slotted bases
    * FR!3 is designed for use with 15mm or 25mm armies
    * FR!3 is tied to no figure manufacturer
    * The movement system is based on previous, proven Chipco game systems
    * There are over 60 army lists included, featuring both mythical historical and pure fantasy - from legendary Ancient Egypt, Greece, and Rome to new lists for Napoleonic, American Civil War, Buffalo Soldiers, Native Americans, Faerie, Automaton, Arabian Nights, and Victorian armies. From Gnomes, Elves, and Orcs to Hive Queens and Arch Angels or Demon Lords
    * FR!3 streamlines the 2nd edition magic system, adds new units and abilities, and makes characters more flexible while keeping the core system
    * Battles are not limited to open ground. FR!3 includes rules for flying, swimming, and burrowing troops
    * FR!3 adds a whole new dimension with rules for cities, walls, and ships
    * Gamers upgrading from FR!2 will appreciate that a version of FR!3 is available with any changes from the 2nd edition marked
    * The rules take advantage of the book-marking capability of Adobe Acrobat and are also indexed
    * FR!3 can easily be played on the typical kitchen table (3' x 4'). It can be expanded to battles of any size, and used to resolve large battles in RPGs
    * Approximately 150 pages, with reference tables, etc.

First edition - 1996
Second edition - 1998
Third edition - 2004
Fantasy Rules! Tournament & Campaign Edition (TCE) - 2008

title: Munchkin Blender
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Fighting Humor
description:
Overview

Munchkin Blender expands every card game in the Munchkin family. It's intended for games with multiple base and expansion sets (now known as blender games).

				
					Publisher's Description

Stir Things Up!

It's the ultimate party kit for Munchkin fans! Munchkin players really like to combine their sets... Munchkin, Star Munchkin, Munchkin Fu, all in one game. That gets really weird... but it can also slow the game down.

There are a lot of ways we COULD have addressed this problem. But this is Munchkin, so the solution we chose was to create a lot of really overpowered new cards. Why be a Super-Munchkin when you can be an Ultra-Munchkin? If a Half-Breed isn't enough, you can be a 1/3-Breed. And if a single Cheat card doesn't do it for you, you can Cheat With Both Hands!
