There are also a lot more monster enhancers... and ITEM enhancers, too. There are several new low-level monsters to help you get those easy kills. Unless somebody takes that Sock Puppet and turns it into the Ultra-Rare Extremely Sneaky Sock Puppet With Extra Cheese . . .

Munchkin till you drop! Munchkin Blender -- just add players!

This is an expansion, not a stand-alone game. It is meant to be combined with at least one Munchkin game, and preferably two or more, with or without other supplements.

				
					Other

This set was updated as part of The Great 2010 Munchkin Changeover but was never reprinted. Many of the updated cards are available, however, via Munchkin: Go Up a Level.

Part of the Munchkin series.

This set is permanently out of print and has been superseded by Munchkin 7: Cheat With Both Hands, which has all the same cards but with the fantasy Munchkin color scheme.

title: Endpoint
description:
From the Kadon web site:

A gameboard like no other  the grid is a swirl of arches, a network of intersections. Three intriguing games of positional and movement strategy employ a unique element:  a piece flips on every move from slider to jumper and back again. In Endpoint your goal is to exit all 15 of your pieces from the board through the opponent's home row. In End Jam you win if all the opponent's endpoints are occupied. In End Rush each player seeks to capture the board's center space. Some solitaire puzzles are also included. Cylindrical wood playing pieces have felt on one side to indicate their status. The 24 gameboard is offered in two formats, recommended for Ages 10 and up.

title: Sinn Sens
description:
Two teams try to describe and guess ideas - nothing could be simpler!

Or perhaps not,  as each player in the team must say one word in turn.  And his word and those of his fellow team members must make a grammatically correct sentence.  Not so easy if each person is thinking along different lines!  For each correct answer,  that team's playing token moves nearer the goal.

title: Jerry Springer Show
description: You are a guest on the Jerry Springer Show who has temporary amnesia after a wild on-stage scuffle. You can't remember who you are. By using the insults and various other clues provided by other players, the first to figure out exactly who the (bleep) they are will be the winner

title: What's My Line?
types: Deduction Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game
description:
From the old time television show of the 1950's. (remember Dorothy Killgalen and Bennett Cerf!).

That's one down and nine to go.... From the show that coined the phrase, is it bigger than a breadbox? What's My Line is the classic guessing game. Players ask yes or no questions to unravel the unusual occupation of the guest contestant. Get a no answer and play moves on to the next guesser. With photos of actual people, a TV screen to put them in, and blindfolds like the ones on the classic game show, What's My Line is destined to evoke memories, laughter and hours of endless fun.

title: Wild 'Ahi
description: Rummy game with a Hawaiian-fish theme.

title: Skillcat: The Nine Lives Card Game
description:
Trick taking card game (capture a specific amount),with new scoring system ( 1st-4th place in bid accuracy). No more great cards dealt determining winner here, as each player has control over his own scoring. Each player has 9 lives to begin game,if you lose them all you are replaced by a Computer player and game continues. (internet version) Game play is 6-12 hands, approx.20-40 minutes
CP has exact rules of play. Game has 6 tie-breakers, as scoring is close (12-10-8-6)Also has ahalo rule. Game is singles play, no partnerships, spades always trump suit. web add is www.skillcat.com

title: Shrink
description:
Every Player (Patient) get 4 Symptom Cards that show their Brain disease. 
On the Symptom Cards is a List of Treatments that you must take step by step from the Top to the Bottom to heal the disease. 
To heal you must visit some Places in turn (First the Doctor,Then the Drugstore, ect...)and pay there Money for the Treatment.If more than one Card need the same Treatment at the same Time, you must only pay once for all same Treatments. That save Time and Money.
To win the Game you must Cure all 4 Diseases.

In the Game box:
 1 Gameboard
 1 Bottle with Clips (To mark the last Treatment of Symptom Card you take.)
33 Symptom Cards 
54 Brainstorm Cards (17 Good,17 Bad)
A lot of Game money

title: Swastika
description: Swastika was published in 1907.  It is described as a popular new Indian card game.  The deck of cards is composed of 55 cards in five suits:  bows, arrows, peace pipes, tomahawks, and swastikas.  (The swastika is a Indian symbol with lots of history before its use by Nazi Germany.)  Rules and photos to be posted.

title: Snuggly Bugs
description:
CONTENT:
a central board
a number of square tiles depicting parts of caterpillars: heads, bodies, tails

OBJECT 
to match the heads, bodies and tails to score the number of points shown on the bodies.

An entertaining game for children which plays very similar to Carcassonne. Place a tile wherever it matches and claim the points.
I introduced the variant of providing each player with a counter, so they can claim one bug as their own to be finished later, like in Carcassonne. That way, players are not exposed to be stolen their bugs and encouraged to build longer bugs.

It turns to be quite fun due to the pictures and also when any child by mistake place two heads or two tails together....  X-Mutant bugs!!

title: Happy Ever After
types: Children's Game Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
CONTENTS
gameboard
4x playing pieces (Snowhite, Beauty, Cinderella, Sleepy Beauty)
4x Plastic books for each Disney story, with 4 pages each 
a magic plastic 3D castle, Pink!
4x plastic keys
1 die

OBJECT

To complete your story book and with your special key, unlock the correct door to find your handsome prince and live happily ever after!

Every girl (this game is only for girls as you try to reach for your prince!) start the journey around the gameboard collecting all the pages of your one special story. 
Once you have completed your storybook you can open the secret compartment to find your key.

With the key in your hand, race to reach the right tower door as quickly as possible. Your key will only fit one lock... only when you open the lock will the door be opened, uniting you and your prince forever!

I bought this game for a present. The bits, castle and board are very nice, so I decided to add the entry. It will only appeal to 5-8 years old girls.

title: Spin to Win
description:
CONTENTS:
colorful board
plastic transparent over board with holes to hold the spinners
4x 3 spinners

PLAY
Each player takes 3 tops of the same color and spins one top per turn from his colored bay, which is his starting area.
The tops will stop in one of the numbered holes (2-3-4 o 5)
The players write down their scores after the 3 turns and start all over again.

You can play to 100, 200 or more points.

title: Creepy Cauldron
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Fantasy Horror Humor Racing
description:
CONTENTS
Playing board
4x player pieces (boys) with bases and 1 witch
16 rubber creatures (ingredients): 3x spiders, bats, lizards and snakes; 1x skull, bone, toad, rat.
1 green frog head
1 cauldron with spring handle
1 special d6 (1|2|3|4|witch|frog)

OBJECT of the GAME
Collect the 3 particular ingredients you need from the creepy cauldron (as listed in the spell book in your home base); once you have them, obtain the key from the mouth of the ugly witch's cauldron and make it to the exit.

But there are terrifying dangers: both the witch and the cauldron will try to get you before you escape!

A children's game with a fright!

title: Splash
types: Abstract Strategy Animals Children's Game Racing
description:
CONTENTS
2x big lily leaves (homes)
6x small lily leaves
2x 4 frogs numbered 1-2-3-4

OBJECT 
To race the 4 frogs from one home to the other.

PLAY
The starting leaf of player A is the finishing leave of B and vice versa. While all the small leaves lay in between as a path... quite pretty effect.

The movement is indicated by the number on each frog. Therefore the frog of value 1 will move or jump 1, the frog with a 4 will move or jump 4 leaves.

There is not luck involved, all the moves take place on that way. A frog is allowed to leap over other frogs and only unoccupied leaves will count as a move. Frogs can also knock off opponent's frogs when jumping over.

title: NOVA True Science
description:
From the box:

Like the popular NOVA television program on PBS, the NOVA TRUE SCIENCE game will intrigue and entertaining science-phobes and science-philes alike. Players wander around a Big Brain Game Board and earn points by answering simple true-false questions or tougher genius questions. The 900 questions fall into six science categories: Life, Earth, Physics, Technology, Science  Society, and Random Access (anything goes). Players can use Brain Boost and Cross Current spaces to take strategic shortcuts. Plus, they can even bet on their opponent's science knowledge by taking an Einstein's Gamble.

Game includes Big Brain Game Board, 4 playing pieces, 200 True/False cards, 100 Genius cards, 1 die, and Rule Booklet which includes a brief glossary of science terms.

A joint effort by Aristoplay and WGBH-Boston Educational Foundation, producers of NOVA.

title: Stadtgespräch
description:
Here is a description of the game the publisher:

This game needs people who know people! How many women would rather be a man? How many singles go to a party with a condom in their pocket? Spicy questions ensure heated debate and exciting times! Whoever knows the likes, habits and traits of their fellow human beings the best scores the most points. That the discussion should turn to the likes and dislikes of the players themselves, that's hard to avoid...

title: Variello
description:
Here is a description of the game from Selecta Spielzeug:

Using their imagination and power of perception, children learn to recognize the whole picture by seeing only a part of it. Put all the guessing cards in the box and remove one puzzle piece after the other. All players guess diligently until the image on the first card is recognized. Contents: 1 wooden box, 6 puzzle pieces with wooden knobs, 10 double-sided guessing cards, 1 illustrated picture card, instructions

title: Elefantastico
description: This is a tile placement game involving the metamorphosis from an Indian to an African elephant. Mainly for children but fun for the whole family.

title: Al Aflaj 1245
description:
Here is a description of the game from Spielbox:

The game tries to simulate the development of farms and canals, irrigation and agriculture in the realm of the Sultanate of Oman. The game demands foresight from the players, as well as a balanced approach to land and water. The farmer family which, after the set number of game rounds have ended, has most successfully worked their land is the winner. The clever mechanic that determines how much water each family gets is the same as the actual rules about irrigation in use today. Before the winner is determined, players have to overcome sand storms, landslides and locust plagues. The game will appear in cardboard form around the middle of 2004. A wooden version, limited and numbered, with glass and semiprecious stone components, will also be made available for the discriminating gamer.

title: Nasca
description: Players take turns placing wooden planks of varying length onto a 10x11 square grid. Each player plays planks of one color. Neutral planks may be distributed on the grid prior to the game, creating variable starting positions. Players' planks may be played directly onto the gameboard, or on top of other planks at equal height. Planks may intersect over only one square, and a plank must be played on top of at least one plank of its own color. The game ends when neither player can place further planks; scores are assessed according to the area enclosed by each player's planks. Because it is often advantageous to place last, matches are played in pairs where each player goes first once.

title: The Peninsular War 1808-14
description:
The Peninsular War is set in Spain and Portugal during the Napoleonic wars.The hex map represents a map of Spain and Portugal with most of the major towns and cities represented.One player takes the role of the French whilst the other plays the allies (Britain, Spain. and Portugal). Both players seek to control 8 of the 15 major cities at a set time period in order to win the game or gain an automatic win within the time scale by controlling 12 cities at any time.

A do-it-yourself kit version of the game (Watt's description) was made available in 1973; a more elaborate version (with wooden pieces) was produced in 1988 in an edition of 400 copies.

title: Holiday
description: Players roll and dice and travel along a road track representing activities, opportunities and costs associated with a family holiday. Players must manage their money, make route selections and try and be the first player to get back home.

title: Elcanto
description: In this game, players have a set of U-shaped pieces that they are trying to maneuver into a line of 5 in a row (each having a flat side on top).  Once the pieces are placed on the board, they can be rolled along the board along the U-shaped spine.  Another intriguing abstract from the master.

title: The Wizard of Oz Family Board Game
description:
Box Description: 100 years have past (sic) since L. Frank Baum first told this classic American tale, capturing the imagination of millions.

Pick a character and relive their fantasy as you journey through the enchanted Land of OZ.

Step carefully along the Yellow Brick Road, soar to the Emerald City with the Flying Monkeys, or dare to enter the Wicked Witch's Castle.

With the flip of a card, and the call of OZ you may find yourself rich with emeralds! But beware of the Wicked Witch, or your treasure will be gone!

This family game never plays the same way twice. Whether played by adults or children, everyone will be challenged, ensuring the Wizard of Oz will become a classic game your family will enjoy time after time.

title: Earth One
description:
The object of Earth One is to be the first to to complete one complete suit.

The deck consists of 60 hexagonal cards, 12 of each suit (colour), 1 wildcard (Starbender) and 11 purchase cards (Zambuk). Each suit consists of one Level 1 card (Hexrex), 2 level 2 cards (Commander and Chancellor), 4 level 3 cards (Skyrine) and 5 level 4 cards (Dade).

To win, a player must table the Hexrex, Commander, Chancellor, 3 Skyrine's and 4 Dade's of the same colour.

title: Gone Bush
description:
The object of the game is to rid one's hand of all cards and not be caught holding the crocodile card.

Includes an oversized deck of attractive Australian animal and gumtree themed cards plus special Bushfire, Crocodile and Hunter cards.

title: Slap Jak
types: Action / Dexterity Card Game Fantasy Real-time Science Fiction
description:
OBJECT: To win all the cards you need to capture Jak, Earl of Evil, by being the first to slap your hand over his picture.

THE PLAY: Each player in turn puts a card face up in the center of the table.  The first player to find Jak, slaps the card and collects all other cards in the center pile.

There are 8 different kinds of cards, each with a picture of a character.  These are original Sci/Fi - Fantasy type characters in the same vein as He-Man and the Masters of the Universe or Krull, although the Corel the Leader of Good card has a more distinguished Battlestar Galactica look.

title: Juden Raus
description: A sort of amalgam of Monopoly and Halma, where the objective was to collect as many Jews as you could, and get them off the board. The pieces were little pawns wearing pointed medieval Jewish hats; the players moved them by rolling dice; the child winning was the one whose Jews scurried out, 'off to Palestine!' through the gates of a walled city.

title: Orgy
description:
Each player is a Roman noble trying to attain the position of Consul, and enjoying themselves as much as possible along the way. To win, the noble must gain sufficient wealth -at least 150,000 sesterces, 6 slaves, 1 villa and 1 chariot- only then can the noble travel up the Consul Route (on the board) to claim the Consul's laurel crown (Hosts may like to provide one)- by throwing a six on one dice.

Listed as 2-6 players in the Second edition, the First edition featured at least eight player tokens.

From the rules:

In the game of Orgy, players take the part of wealthy Roman nobles living in the heyday of the Roman Empire. These nobles would compete for the powerful and prestigious title of Consul. However, pampered by slaves, often intemperate and gluttonous, they enjoyed a hedonistic life-style and plentiful supplies of rich provender that were the spoils of conquest. Players are encouraged to enter into the spirit of the game - Roman dinners could be anything from a frugal meal to a riotous party.

Players move around the board as a result of dice rolls and following the instructions on the square on which the piece stops.Players aim to become the Consul by gaining wealth, 6 slaves, 1 villa and 1 chariot before moving up The Consul Route.

title: Busted
description:
From the game box: 
BUSTED is a game about selling marijuana on the streets.  A player will find himself in a situation similar to that of a marijuana dealer.

Day of Destiny

When each player reaches the end of his dealing career, his destiny will either be death, because of bad money management; the Slammer, because of his bad luck; or Marijuana Mountain because of his good fortune in dealing.  The last remaining dealer in the game will automatically go to Marijuana Mountain.  Mr. Big feels that you've learned a lesson from all the players and will allow you to turn in all your money and marijuana and go to the Mountain alive.

title: Volcano
description:
Race to Build Your Temple Before the Volcano Erupts.

The Angry Rumble of the Erupting Volcano,the Cascade of Boulders and the Ensuing Threat to Buildings Are Captured in This Exciting Action Game.

Push down the Volcano centre piece. Players then take it in turns to take a building piece. Check the value on the piece. Place the correct number of balls into the crater. One ball too many and the volcano will erupt. The erupting volcano may destroy your temple.

The first player to build their temple wins the game.

title: Meeting of the Minds
description:
Meeting of the Minds is an educational board game specifically designed to teach students important knowledge and skills in conflict resolution.  In the game, students answer questions about conflict resolution and must use a win-win strategy to resolve conflicts.  It is designed for students in grades 5 - 8.

Players earn points in two ways.  They can earn points by answering questions correctly.  These questions come up when the players pick Conflict Resolution and True-Flase cards.  The game creates conflicts among the players and they can also win points by successfully resolving these conflicts.  As a result, the players are involved in two learning processes simultaneously - (1) learning the knowledge and skills for successful conflict resolution and (2) applying the knowledge and skills while playing the game.  Players are therefore cooperating in finding solutions and competing at the same time.  This dynamic relationship leads to a very exciting game.

(Taken from the rules book)

title: Yesteryear: The Nostalgia Trivia Game
description: A trivia game for all those who enjoy waxing nostalgic. Question categories include radio, tv, movies, sports, and misc.  Players may also create their own customized categories and questions for their friends and family.

title: Benji Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
In the Benji Game, players are rolling dice to attempt to get their wooden token to the middle of the board.

Players take turns rolling two dice and moving. If they land on a square with a picture, they either take another turn, roll again, go back to the start or draw a card. The cards aid to manipulate the movement of the pieces.

The first person to reach the center of the board by exact throw is the winner.

from the Waddington ad from 1977 for the game:

Now you have the chance to join Benji, the world's most huggable hero, in an exciting chase to meet Tiffany. You will try to be the first player to pass all the obstacles. The first player to meet Tiffany is the winner.

2 to 6 players ages 5 to 10

title: Nuttsy Tennis
description: Nuttsy Tennis is a action packed tennis game for two players.  The tennis court is downsized to 16 by 32.  The tennis ball is attached to a long wire that lets it swing freely over the net, and the miniature tennis rackets are attached to handles with buttons that make them swing.

title: Bent Outta Shape
description: Players spin and move around the board trying not to get bent out of shape.  Includes a body bender marker to make this easier.  Ages 6 and up

title: America's Funniest Home Videos Game
description: In the boardgame version of the popular TV show, 3-6 players move around the board trying to be the first to $100,000.  The game includes 250 clips from the show on a VHS tape, and players must remember parts of the clips in order to advance.

title: Death & Destruction: The Russian Front 1942-44
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Death  Destruction: 1942-44 on the Eastern front is an add-on gamette that allows extension of the play of Proud Monster through 15 April 1944.

The components [...] include rules, one 13.5x18.5 mapsheet, one cardstock chart and table sheet, two cardstock turn record sheets, a card with holding boxes [...], a German replacement Army roster sheet and 1080 die-cut counters.

(source: rulebook)

title: Bastogne: Crossroads of Death
description: Bastogne: Crossroads of Death is a simulation on the American defense of this town during the Battle of the Bulge. 100 counters, 22 x 34 map and 16 pages of rules.

title: German Eagle vs. Russian Bear
types: Print & Play Wargame World War II
description:
German Eagle vs Russian Bear is a war game that covers the action from 1941 to 1944 on the Eastern Front during World War 2.  The game offers several scenarios that let players recreate and replay the battles between the German and Soviet forces, such as Operations Barbarossa and Bagration.

The players alternate their turns to move and attack with their forces, rolling dice and consulting tables to determine if they have routed or eliminated enemy units.  Their combat is further affected by weather, terrain, and fortifications.  Supply lines also play a part in the players' strategic concerns.

A game lasts until it has reached a pre-agreed turn or a player has won by achieving his or her victory conditions, which usually involves controlling a certain amount of cities.

PLEASE DO NOT JUDGE/RATE GEvsRB BY ITS ANDROID VERSION!

title: Strip
description: A spinner with ten areas (5 blank alternating with 5 clothing symbols) is spun.  If the spinner lands on a blank area, the turn is over.  If the spinner lands on a clothing symbol, the player must throw the seven dice.  The dice have articles of clothing some of the faces and some die faces are blank.  The player must remove the articles of clothing shown on the dice if possible.  If the dice show clothing that is still unrevealed it is treated as a blank face and ignored i.e. the dice show 3 blanks, 2 socks, 1 undershirt and 1 jacket, but the players shoes and shirt are still on.  The player just removes his jacket and his turn is over. The last person wearing a vital piece when the rest have stripped bare is the winner.

title: Hot Matches
description: A 49 card deck is shuffled and arranged in six rows of eight cards with the last row having a ninth card.  Players turn over two cards and if they match, the player must follow the instructions on the card.  When a match is made, the same player goes again.  If there is no match, turn the cards over and play proceeds to the next clockwise player until one card remains.  The winner is determined by the player with the most clothing on and the biggest smile on their face.

title: Tank Command
description: The board is a large plastic base with a movable center slide and movement markers printed on the base.  Each of the players 4 tanks fit into notches on the sliding base.  The land mines (pegs that move up and down through the base) are activated by pulling a lanyard that runs under the base and behind your command bunker.  Shells numbered 1 through 10 are hidden in your command bunker with higher numbered shells having more firepower.  Players simultaneously select one of their ten shells then both players lower the bunker to reveal the value of the fired shell.  The player with the higher value shell totals the value of both shells and moves the slide that number of spaces towards his opponent.  If the shells are of the same value, both are discarded and the tanks are not moved.  If the opponents tanks are moved back over the land mines, the player that had the higher total can pull on the lanyard.  If the opponents tank is moved, it is destroyed and is out of the game.  Both of the fired shells are then removed from the game.  The game is played in two rounds but tanks destroyed in the first round are not replaced for the second round.  The winner is the player with the most tanks on the battlefield after two rounds.

title: Assault on Belgium
description:
A small demo game of Udo Grebe Game design games.

A small teaser/give-away to the Empires of the Apocalypse series. The first game of which was Morsecode

This small game is about the German assault on Belgium in 1939.

title: Dirty Dare
description: Each player rolls the dice and moves around the board landing on one of the four Dirty Dare categories, Physical (e.g. pretend to have a facial tic continuously for one minute), Messy e.g. while the player on your left sprinkles flour over your head you must sing a song), Entertaining (e.g. make up a rap song about your mother) or Hot (e.g. for 30 seconds, seduce the player of the opposite sex on your right.)  A Dirty Dare card of the same category is drawn and a sand timer is started.  The player has until the timer runs out to decide if they are going to complete the dare or pass the card.  If the card is passed all the way around to the player that initially passed, that player must draw a new card and perform the dare without the option to pass.  Players completing a dare to the satisfaction of the other players, get a check mark for that category on their score sheet.  If the dare was passed to another player that completes the dare, that player receives a check mark and the player that passed the dare loses a check mark in the same category.  The winner is the first player to complete 2 dares in each of the four categories.

title: Grab the Green
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
From the rules:  In the truest form of capitalism the object of this game is to make the most money.  You make money by paying the going rate for each green and then turning the green for a profit in designated cities.  He with the most in the end wins.

A Monopoly-like game that allows bankrupt players back in the game.  Since the rules provide for no end or winning conditions, players should set a time or money limit.

Game was limited to a print run of 500.

title: 3 Blind Mice
description:
An action game where moves are made on the roll the dice.  Players must move their mice on a roll of green or stay put on black.  Mice are moved off the playing surface by pulling on their tails and the box top, shaped like a wedge of cheese, is used to catch the mice.  Chips are awarded for each caught mouse. The first player to win 18 chips wins the game.

Three Blind Mice is essentially Carla Cat.

Similar to:

    Hasch mich!
    Carla Cat
    Nopea veto




Object of the Game: First Player to get 18 chips is the winner.

To Start the game each player receives nine chips. First player to roll a green spot is the Catcher. Other players select a mouse and place mouse on base, holding it by the tail. Catcher rolls color cube by using Cheese Wedge as shaker.

Rules of the Game: When a Blue or green spot turns up, the players must pull their mice off the base before the catcher traps them with the cheese wedge. If the mouse is caught, the player pays the catcher one chip. If his mouse is not caught, the player is not paid a chip by the catcher. If all the mice escape, the catcher exchanges the Cheese Wedge for the mouse of the player on his left and this player now becomes the catcher. When a black or white spot turns up, the players must leave their mice on the base. If a player pulls his mouse off the base when black or white turns up, he pays the catcher one chip. However, if the catcher should touch the base with the cheese wedge to the player on his left, and pays one chip to each of the mice still on the base. The player on his left now becomes the catcher. When a player has lost all his chips he is out of the game. As soon as one player has 18 chips he is the winner and the game is over.

title: Hollywood Awards
types: Action / Dexterity Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: A skill game where players vote for the best actresses, actors, directors, movies and songs.  Players draw action cards and decide to use or hold card.  There is no hand size limit.  Used cards are returned to the bottom the pile.  Players then roll a steel ball down the runway twice- first to determine which candidate, the second to determine the cost of the candidate.  After two or more players have a candidate in the same category, one of those players may call for a vote when playing a Contest action card.  Vote cards are drawn until a player decides to stand, but beware drawing the Loser card that puts you out of the contest immediately.  At this point, all players reveal the vote cards they have just drawn and the high vote getter wins a Hollywood Award.  The winner is the first player to get 3 Hollywood Awards.

title: Feng  Shui Game Pack
description:
One player plays the god Yin, the another the god Yang. Players have a selection of square tiles divided into three types: Chi, Remedy and Sha tiles. The basic tiles are the Chi tiles, which are used to develop the flow of Chi across the board. They come in eight types: ten each of connecting tiles which take the chi energy from one edge of the square to one two or three other edges. There are a further eight Chi ending tiles, two each of four deigns which are needed to terminate unneeded Chi paths. There are also eight Sha tiles, two each corresponding to the the four Chi tiles. This can be placed upon the corresponding opponents tile and thereby blocking the flow. However, a player can overcome these blocks by using the Remedy cards, again two each corresponding to the four Chi tiles.

Each player draws a hand of four tiles (called a reserve) and each turn they can place one tile on the 8 x 8 board. (This is decorated with a Maltese Cross, which it appears only has a psychological effect, as there is no reference to it in the rules.) Starting at the entrance to their respective palace, each player seeks to develop a flow of chi to the other side of the board. As they play a tile, each player can replenish their reserve from their stock. If they are unhappy with their reserve they can replace up to the entire four tiles of the reserve, which then constitutes the entirety of their turn.

title: Hey Taxi!
description: A vibrating action game where taxis run around the board by themselves.  A central Garage unit is turned on and off by the players during their turn.  This causes the taxis to move around the board.  All taxis are moving every turn.  Where they stop tells the players what to do.  Players try to pick up and deliver fares to collect the most money and win the game.

title: Jetsons Fun Pad Game
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description: The round PADS are attached to a white dome which is balanced on the center of a tall stand.  The players place cars on the pads one at a time according to to the color spun on the dial, causing the pad to tilt back and forth.  If the cars are not placed correctly, the cars will slip off the pads.  The object of the game is to try to place all the cars on the pads without letting any fall off.  If all the cars are placed on the pads without any falling off, players must remove them one at a time until the pads are empty again.  Any player causing cars to fall off are out of the game.  The last remaining player is the winner.

title: Séance
description:
Players bid on dead Uncle Everett's possessions and the high bidder listens to instructions from their dead Uncle via a record (played on the record player hidden in the deck.)  When all the items have been bid on and acquired, the record in the desk in turned over and Uncle Everett tells the players what each of the items is worth or how is due in taxes for the item.  The player with the most cash at the end of the game is the winner.  This game is a rare sequel to MB's Voice of the Mummy.

Fan Home Page: http://www.voiceofthemummy.com/Pages/MiltonBradleySeance.aspx

title: Police Surgeon
description:
The players each take the part of a Police Surgeon and attempt to help people in trouble at various points on the board.  Each successful arrival at an emergency earns the Police Surgeon points and the first to accumulate 100 points wins.  Game strategy involves gathering the most points while taking into consideration distance to the emergencies, their point value and the likelihood of the emergency cards being returned to the deck.  3 emergency cards are always face up, but one is exchanged from the deck when players land on a red dot.  Green Fate spaces require a player to draw a Fate card and follow directions, but may be held to use at an appropriate time if indicated on the card.

Based on a syndicated TV show from 1970's.

title: Feds 'N' Heads
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Feds 'n' Heads is a fairly basic roll and move game based on the designer's own famous comic strip, The Fabulous Furry Freak Brothers.  The game bears more than a passing resemblance to Monopoly (collect money for passing go, roll a double to get out of jail or pay $50, etc.) but the board is more sprawling and includes several junctions and special squares. Roll dice and move around the board trying to collect a kilo (35 lids) of grass by landing on specific locations and buying as much as they can afford.  When players pass the Home square, $50 is collected from the banker and grass can be stashed at home, protecting the grass from being taken from you by any means.  Red squares require you to draw a Burns, Busts, Bummers  Rip-Offs card, while green squares require you to draw a Weird Trips card.  Players can also wind up in Jail (roll a double, pay $50 or 5 lid to get out) or at the free clinic (pay $15... Hey, it says FREE clinic!)  The winner is the player who, moving his token the number shown on the dice, manages to score 35 ounces and get back Home with it.

Originally published as a fold-out board in Playboy Magazine.

title: How To Be A Complete Bastard
description: The board represents a lavatory system.  Dice are rolled to direct movement on the board.  There are three packs of Bastard cards.  Players start the game with two or three cards.  Bastard cards can be used by any player BEFORE rolling the dice on their turn.  Only one card can be used at a time.  Most cards contain an unpleasant dare which you or your opponent are required to perform,  Failure to perform the dare satisfactorily leads to a move forward as directed down the lavatory system.  Other cards allow you to fend off dares, miss turns or simply move any opponents piece you choose.  To prevent players from hoarding cards, any player who holds more than three cards at the start of their turn must move forward six spaces.  The winner of the game is the player LEAST far down the system when his first opponent arrives in the sewage works at the end.

title: Quips & Quotes
description: Quips  Quotes is a Balderdash-style party game.  One player reads a quote.  If nobody knows the speaker right off the bat, then everybody writes down the name of someone who might have said it.  The reader then reads off all the names that were submitted (with the correct answer mixed in) and players vote for which name they think is correct.  You score points for guessing the right answer and getting other people to guess the name you submitted.  (You also score points if you correctly identify the speaker initially.)

title: Escapades
description: An adult charades games with a risque flavor.  Colored chips with 1 through 12 are selected to create teams.  Men draw from red chips, women from white.  First couple chooses the top card to act out.  Points are scored by having the other players guess the Escapade.  The faster others guess your charade, the more points you score.  If the Escapade is not guessed within 7 minutes, no points are scored and the next couple picks an Escapade card and begins.  The first team to score 15 points wins.

title: Hurry Waiter
description: Players must deliver orders from a spinning tray.  Cards with food items are given to the current Waiter.  The Waiter must memorize everyones order, place the food on the spinning tray and deliver them to each player before the tray stops spinning.  Players tip the Waiter 25 (chips) for each item correctly delivered.  Player with the most money after all players have been the Waiter is the winner.

title: Balancing Clown
description: A clown is balanced on the high wire between two players.  Spin the spinner to dictate the movement of the clown.  The object is to move the clown to the opposite side of the wire.  Knock down your opponents flag to win the game.

title: Sneaky Pete
description: From Pressman's description: Tell the truth or stretch it as you call out your roll of the dice from behind the bluffing shield.  Each roll you get away with moves you closer into opposing territory.  Watch out for Sneaky Pete - he's full of surprises!

title: Brain Quest
description:
Brain Quest is a roll and move trivia game for players in grades 1 to 6.

Players roll a die then are asked a question. Each card has 6 questions on it, one for each grade level. A player may only select a question from a grade equal to the grade he/she has started or higher. If the correct answer is given, the player moves ahead a number of spaces equal to the die roll plus the difference between the lowest grade he/she could have selected and the grade level actually selected.

The board has a few design differences from a simple straight path but is essentially a move from A to B setup.

The winner is the player to make it to the end first.

Additional Rules for older players:
If you are in Junior high, you must answer grade 6 questions and subtract 1 from your die roll.
If you are above Junior high, you must answer grade 6 questions and subtract 2 from your die roll.
You do not move backwards if the result is less than 0.

title: Giant Game Board Book
description: Six giant games (26 x 19 inches when open for play) in one book. An electronic die roller lights up to indicate your 1-to-6 roll. Includes versions of Snakes and Ladders and Pachisi, plus four typical race-to-the-finish games.

title: Mastergame
description:
CONTENTS
Colorful shiny Boardgame
2x 8 playing pieces

OBJECT
To make a line of 4 pieces on touching squares

PLAY
From the starting line, players move one of their pieces one vacant square only in any direction. 
A piece must never be moved onto a square having the same symbol as on the piece.
A piece can not be part of a winning line unless it has made at least one move.

title: Twisty Turtle
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
CONTENTS
a 8x8 squares boardgame with 4 starting corners
5 turtle shells
a spinner

OBJECT
To be the first player to move his turtle-shell across the board to the opposite corner.

A player spins the arrow of the spinner. Sections show a choice of two numbers. If s/he wishes to move chooses one of these two numbers.

The board indicates what direction the pieces can move. If the board shows a turtle heading right, that piece can only move right. If the board shows only the shell the player on that square can decide what direction to follow.

The brown shell acts as a blocker.

title: Weigh It Up
description:
CONTENTS
small board showing red and green triangles with numbers in.

42 pegs of the same color

OBJECT
To gain the most points by placing the pegs on the corners of the triangles.

Each player places a peg in one of the triangles' corners. If a player places a peg which encloses one or more triangles the player placing the peg gains or loses the points for triangle(s) enclosed.

Red triangles are minus. Green are plus.

Alternative names: PLUS OU MOINS

title: Agri-Venture
description: Agri-Venture acquaints players with many facets of farming while encouraging the use of services and loan funds provided by Federal Land Bank Associations, Production Credit Associations and the Bank for Cooperatives.  During the game obstacles and hazards, as well as successes, will be encountered so that any player could become very successful, moderately successful or go broke.  Managing one's assets to achieve the greatest dollar net worth at the end of the game is the objective of every Agri-Venture player.

title: The Return of Heavyweight Champ!
description:
The goal of this game is to pick one of the ten pre-made boxers and attempt to climb to the rank of Heavyweight Champion of the  World.

Boxers have basic ratings of skill, punching power, and defense.  In any given month, assuming you aren't nursing some sort of injury or voluntarily training, you are randomly assigned an opponent according to your current experience level.  You the take on that opponent in an extremely quick fight... it should last only 2-3 minutes.  Based on the outcome, you may have advanced a few levels, earned some money, and pocketed some points to use for later training.

The cool thing about this game is that the fight purse is dependent upon your level, your opponents level, and whether or not it is some sort of title match (British, Commonwealth, European, or World).

title: Foreplaying Dart Game
description: Four dart balls with velcro are tossed at the dart board and players must follow the directions on the space hit.  Space are marked with clothing that must be removed, kisses or massages.  When one of the players is naked, the winner is the player with the most clothing.

title: Strip Chocolate
description: Players roll dice and move around the board landing on either Strip (remove an article of clothing), Chocolate (draw a Chocolate card and paint the simple design on the body part if exposed or as close as possible with the body frosting and paintbrush provided), Dare (draw a Dare card and follow instructions on the card which can be to strip, kiss, massage or eat previously painted art), Kiss, Hug or Massage.  The winner is the player with the most clothes when one of the players has completely stripped.

title: Squeeze Phrase
description:
From the publisher...

Squeeze Phrase - The fast-paced game of word recognition

Start with a famous name, place, movie title or ad slogan or perhaps a popular quote.  Take out the vowels and punctuation marks and you get a Squeeze Phrase!  Then race to solve the fractured phrases!

Should you go for the tougher ones and score more points, or work on getting more of the easy ones?  After solving three answers, any player can press the action and force everyone to pass their cards!

And if that wasn't tough enough, the game end with a high-scoring Super Squeeze round!  Can you handle the pressure?  The Squeeze is on!

title: X-Rated Trivia
description: A deck of cards with 6 adult themed trivia question per card.  Players roll a die to determine which of the six questions is asked.  The player to correctly answer the question gets the card.  When all the cards have been answered, the player with the most cards wins.

title: Talk Dirty To Me
description: The object of the game is to score the LEAST amount of points by using the most words in your hand of cards to fill in the blanks in various stories.  A deck of 98 cards (printed in black and red) is shuffled and each player is dealt five cards.  The current player or storyteller begins to read a story from the story book and stops at the first blank.  The storyteller then flashes the bookmark to let the player know what color card can be used to fill in the blank as indicted in the story book.  If the player has an appropriate word card of the right color, the player reads the card aloud and discards the card.  If the player is unable to play an appropriate card, they must draw the next card from the deck.  That card must be played if possible.  If the card cannot be played, play passes to the next player to attempt to fill the blank.  Each of the word cards is worth from five to fifteen points.  At the end of each story, players add the cards remaining in their hand and scores are recorded.  A full game consists of twelve stories.  The player with the lowest score after the last story wins.

title: Grant Moves South
description:
From the back of the box...

Early in 1862, a little known General named U.S. Grant overran West Tennessee, taking two river forts and the largest bag of prisoners captured up to that time by an American army.  But as the Union troops advanced on Corinth, the Confederates hit back, staking everything on a furious battle in the woods around Shiloh Church.
GRANT MOVES SOUTH puts you in command of the Tennessee campaign.  As General Grant, you must combine river and overland movement to strike deep into rebel territory against the important points of Nashville, Corinth, Memphis, and Columbus.  As the Confederate General, A.S. Johnston, you must use careful maneuver and counterattacks to prevent the ever-growing torrent of Bluecoats from conquering Tennessee.

GRANT MOVES SOUTH shows the critical importance of the road net, water movement and the abilities of individual division commanders.  The fog of war is thick as you know where the enemy is, but not how strong he is.  Gunboats attack river forts, and steamers whisk troops deep into enemy territory.

title: Formula De: Gran Premio d'Italia – Perugia – Circuito Cittadino
description: This is a Formula De course available for download online - created by Roberto Corbelli. It is a course based on his hometown grand Prix course. It prints out on 18 pages.   Has a shortcut to make two different tracks. Starts with a 3 corner at 11/13 (20-12) and then into a 2 corner at 4/6 (16-11) and then 12x 1 corners with one very long straight-away.

title: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Battlesystem
description: Create fantasy armies with counters or miniatures and fight battles. Can be played on its own or with first edition ADD RPG game.

title: The Prestel Art Game
description:
A trivia and party game focused on art.

Goal
Collecting 8 chips in 6 different colours by answering questions or completing tasks.

Game play
Each player gets a little palette which he/she has to fill with coloured chips. Players take turns rolling the die. The active player moves the red pawn on the board and has to answer a question or complete a task, depending on the space the pawn lands on.

Tasks include:

     Answering a question from the card
     True or false? (cards contain statements about artists, techniques or the history of art, and the active player has to guess whether it is true or false)
     Brainstorming (players have to write down 3 things they associate with a picture)
     Have fun with art (terms have to be drawn or described verbally while the other players guess)
     Auction: The active player turns over number cards, trying to get as close to 21 as possible without going over 21. 




Correct answers and successfully completed tasks earn the active player a colour chip. He/she can also lose colour chips during the auction activity.

The game ends when a player has collected all 8 required colour chips. That player wins the game.

title: Quadrivium
description:
Spanish generic board game. The game comes with an amount of generic elements likes color tokens, color pawns, normal dice, colour dice... The more special element is the board.

Quadrivium is really a meta-game: a game that allows to play and create different games by using the generic components.

In the basic rules there are 4 games:

1. El ltimo Gana (The last wins), a quick game of elimination.
2. Quarchs (a word-play with Parchs [Ludo in Spanish]and the name of the game Quadrivium), a variant of Ludo for 4 players.
3. El Color de las Palabras (The color of Words), a crosswords game.
4. El Casern de los Espectros (The House of the Ghosts), an adventure game of strategy and mystery.

In the publisher's website there are four more games: http://www.quiz.es/quiz1/produc/opquad2.htm

title: War Machine
types: Industry / Manufacturing Modern Warfare Negotiation Wargame
description:
From the publisher:

War Machine combines economics, trade, diplomacy and elements of land, air and sea power into an easy to play game.  The object is to gain control of the three major cities on each of your opponent's boards.  It takes some luck and a great deal of skill.  Strategy depends on you alliances and whether you have a Land, Sea or Air Nation.  Each Nation has an advantage in either land, sea or air capability.  Deciding what to produce, where to deploy and when to attack will determine your success or failure.  You can become an effective player after one game and a master player after only a few games.  War Machine is designed for two to three players, but can be expanded to four players by borrowing a board from a second game.

title: Dexter's Laboratory: Race to the Brainergizer!
description:
Players spin a spinner to move their Dexter along the board, taking actions dependent on where they land (drawing an action card, picking up Dee-Dee, grabbing the lab wrench, and some others).  Dee-Dee slows down a player, but the lab wrench will  let a player counteract any negative effect, including having to take her along.

For Ages 6 and up.

title: Lust!
description:
From the box:

Lust! is a game for lovers that allows you to explore both romantic and physical intimacies with your partner! You and your partner begin by placing your markers at the start of the gameboard. As you land on various footstep spaces you select cards that have you and your partner acting out or sharing various romantic and sexual indulgences with each other.

While venturing along the path you also earn love-making cards. The love-making cards explicitly illustrate either a foreplay activity or a sexual position. You and your partner use these cards to build and agree on a sexual fantasy. The first person to reach the bed at the end of the path takes the collected love-making cards and initiates the techniques and positions depicted on the cards. Each game ends with a unique love-making experience because there are over 30,000 possibilities within the love-making cards.

Contents:
1 gameboard
60 Foreplay cards
40 Love-Making cards
2 game markers
1 die

title: Klecks: Kennst Du die Farben?
types: Animals Card Game Children's Game Educational
description:
From the box: Zebra Motley adores coloring everything in different colors. Occasionally he gets the color mixed up. What is red? The sun, leaf or ladybug? By turning over the card you can check your answer.

Contents:
1 zebra rod
30 cards

title: Such, Bello!
description:
From the box: Bello lives on a big farm. Most of all, he likes to play hide and seek with his friends. With his sharp little nose, he goes searching and almost always finds them. If it happens that this is not the case, the cat gives him important hints.

Contents:
1 dog
1 cat
1 game board
18 round searching tiles
18 rectangular walking tiles

ages 4 and up

title: Motley Wheels
description:
A color assignment game for 2 - 6 children Ages 3 and up, with an easy game variation for younger children.

From the publisher:

A lot of vehicles lie on the table: cars, helicopters, bicycles.  But none of them can race away.  Some luck in throwing the colored die will help them get the matching wheels so that they can chug to the player who added the last wheels.  Who can collect the most wheels?

!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!

title: Drei gewinnt
description:
Players take turns adding their pieces to the stand. Whoever gets three of their color in a row wins.

Contents:
1 cup
18 red pieces
18 ecru pieces
10 black pieces

title: Cashflow for Kids
types: Children's Game Economic Educational Math Number
description:
From the publisher : Give your children the financial head start necessary to thrive in today's fast paced and changing world. Schools teach children how to work for money. CASHFLOW for Kids teaches children how to have money work for them. CASHFLOW for Kids is a complete educational package which includes the book and audiocassette titled Rich Dad's Guide to Raising Your Child's Financial I.Q. CASHFLOW for Kids is recommended for children ages 6 and older.

GAME PARTS LIST
Game Board
6 Individual Game Cards

Larger Rectangular cards:
82 Green Asset Cards
30 Red Expense Cards
36 Yellow Sunshine Cards

Small Rectangular cards:
46 Green Securities Asset Icons
20 Green Real Estate Asset Icons
24 Green Business Asset Icons

8 Red (pinkish) Borrowed Money Liability Icons
14 Red (pinkish) Credit Card Liability Icons
4 Red (pinkish) Mortgage Liability Icons

Other Misc Items
Green Circles - $10 (54), $100 (54), $1000 (12)
Blue Triangles - $100 (12), $1000 (12)
Red Squares - $10 (54), $100 (54), $1000 (12)

Paper money - $10, $20, $50, $100, $500, $1000 (40 of each)

Spinner Wheel
Rulebook (24 pages)
6 Cashflow Kid Awards (round, coaster sized)

Plastic Pieces:
6 Teenage Rat Playing Pieces (blue, black, red, orange, green  purple)
60 purple plastic stands for Asset and Liability Icons
2 dice

title: Centrepoint
description:
CONTENTS
Circular Game Board (in 2 pieces), 
76 Army Playing Figures: Each army consists of: 5 Runners . 1 Standard (flag bearer) 4 Scouts . 4 Archers . 1 General . 4 Lancers

GAME
Four armies face each other across a circular chequered battleground to dominate the central point of the board.

title: Wildwechsel
description:
From the publisher:

The players have to collect 5 different colored discs with their animal as quickly as possible. But the animals differ from each other in their ways of walking and their special abilities.

On their journey through the woods, the animals leave tracks that are marked on the board with the special pen. If a space has been entered twice, it acts as a barrier for the next animals, because the frequency of the animals has attracted the attention of the poacher. Consequently, the field of play constantly becomes more restricted and the way more difficult.

With the game pieces, you can cause further difficulties for the other animals or clear away obstacles from your own.

Contents:
1 board
4 animals
24 game pieces: 3 double moves, 6 wolves, 7 worms, 8 gamekeeper's hats 
20 colored discs in 5 colors
1 colored pen
1 die

title: Beer!
description:
From the box:

The hilarious card game where you assign drinks, steal from each other, have blackouts, and even an occasional drunken hookup. Beer! also tests your knowledge of crazy categories like: Types of Liquor, Cartoon Dogs, and Excuses for Not Making Love. You win by holding the highest valued drink cards at the end of the game. And if you win, you get to assign LOTS of drinks to the other players. For 2 - 6 players (add a second deck for 7 - 12 players).

title: All-American Football
description: The football version of Cadaco's All-Star Baseball. Round disks are put into a round holder with a spinner and the spinner gives you the result of the play.

title: Pacific Battles Volume 1, The Rising Sun
description:
Pacific Battles is a wargame series covering the great land battles of the Pacific theater in WWII. Units are battalions, with companies and regiments. Most games in the series have players commanding anywhere from a division to a corps worth of forces, and employment of combined arms tactics becomes critical. The system shows the evolution of tactical doctrine in both the Japanese and Allied armies with Banzai charges, superior U.S. fire coordination, naval bombardment, airpower, amphibious landings, and engineer operations. Games in this volume include:

The Fall of Singapore is a simulation of one of the worst military defeats in British history. From December of 1941 to February of 1942, the campaign is a case study of a smaller but better-lead force of Japanese outmaneuvering a much larger but poorly trained and ill-led British.

Struggle on Bataan recreates the desperate U.S. and Filipino defense of the Bataan Peninsula between 9 January and 9 April 1942.  The defense of Bataan, though ultimately doomed, constituted the only serious disruption to the string of Japanese victories during the first six months of the war.

Turning Point: Guadalcanal is the struggle between the United States and Japan for possession of the island of Guadalcanal in the southern Solomons chain. The battle lasted from August 1942 until early February 1943.  The opponents on Guadalcanal were approximately of equal strength and with control of the seas around the island still to be decided, Guadalcanal was the last time in the war when an American amphibious operation faced the prospect of total defeat.

title: Manege Frei
description: Children's game, Ages 3 and up. Players take turns being animal trainer in a circus. The trainer closes his eyes, and the other players select one of the 8 different animals. This animal is in a bad mood today. Then the animal trainer opens his eyes and starts calling the animals into the ring, one by one. As soon as the trainer calls for the selected animal the other players yell HALT and the trainer's turn is over. For each animal that he succeeded in calling into the ring he scores one scoring stone. As soon as all 80 stones have been won, the player with the most stones wins.

title: Hopple-Popple
description:
Children's game, Ages 3 and up. All players are dealt a sheet depicting a farm. The farm shows the outlines of eight animals (2 cats, 2 ducks, 2 rabbits and 2 roosters).
Goal is to be the first to collect the 8 animals in your farm. The roll of a colored die shows which kind of animal you may take into your farm (if there is still a place for it). First player to collect all of his animals wins.

title: Kopernikus
description:
Wooden board contains four concentric rings in which balls representing planets (Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn) are held and dips where they may rest.  Players get cards depicting planetary positions and attempt to move planets into the correct configuration of their constellation card.  The first to make 7 constellations wins.

In the original Edition Perlhuhn edition, 10 constellations were required for the victory.

title: Stealth: The Game
description:
From game summary on box:

A brilliant dimension lies before you and a cunning battle must be fought. Your powerful Stealth Force has been protecting its portion of Dimension Gemstone for centuries, but the enemy has been looming ever closer; threatening to conquer your territory.

Strategy - You may find that your only protection is your wide array of Stealth Attack Modules and their Concealed Power Pieces as you move through Dimension Gemstone, evading your dangerous opponent. Some of your Power Pieces can be used to destroy, while others can distract and act as decoys. The Starburst, Blaster, Ringer, Decoy and Laser each have special ways of fending off the enemy (see below). As commander of the Stealth Force, you must remember the importance of your mission - defend, retaliate and move with all possible speed. The future of Dimension Gemstone is in your hands.

Under Fire - The longer you wait to retaliate, the more time your opponent has to build strategy and plan the next attack. Keep focused as there are concealed dangers that may catch you unaware.

Escape - Dimension Gemstone has Portals that are the way for you and your Stealth Force to find a route of escape, or as a means of Surprise attack. They can zip you from one side of Dimension Gemstone to another, swiftly out of danger's way.

Your Mission is Clear - and it is of the utmost importance that you keep in mind the dynamics of each Stealth Attack Module. Your victory or defeat may be at stake. As Commander of the Stealth Force, you control the fate of Dimension Gemstone.

Each move is an exciting and strategic challenge to outmaneuver your opponent. Dimension Gemstone needs your protection. Seek to conquer, but be careful not to fall into the hands of the enemy. 
 Each type of power piece is different. While a BLASTER can destroy all pieces and Portals in a 2-space range, the RINGER has only a 1-space range. The LASER has a 7-space range limit and can destroy the first piece or Portal in a straight line. The STARBURSTS have the power to emanate energy in a starburst pattern and can destroy all pieces and Portals within a 3-space, straight line.

title: Sphinx
description:
From the box: 
SPHINX: 2 or 3 players. Contents: 12 yellow, 12 orange, and 12 red pyramids.  The object of the game is to get five pyramids of your own color in a vertical, horizontal, or diagonal row by placing one pyramid at a time. Simple Rules.

From the rules: The object of the game is to get five pyramids in a row, vertically, horizontally, or diagonally, the first player to do so wins.  Pick a color, the person starting first places a pyramid on the board.  With the exception of this first pyramid all others have to be placed next to each other side by side - not corner to corner.  When all the pyramids are used up, you can move any one of your own color again, as long as it has two adjoining sides free.  Looks simple, doesn't it? But there's a lot more to it than meets the eye.  Give it a try - good luck!

title: Ferrocarriles Pampas
description:
British investors and newly settled Argentine immigrants develop the vast fertile pampas of Argentina with broad gauge railroad networks from 1870-1890.

In this game, players invest in companies and try to increase the value of their holdings through cagey track construction choices. Track construction in this game is accomplished via Consortium bidding a unique system that forces players to cooperate to grow their companies.

Ferrocarriles Pampas is the first game in the Prairie Railroads Series.

title: Pop Smarts
description:
From the publisher...

So...you think you know pop culture?  You say you're a music buff, but can you name a rock band if we give you 4 of their song titles?  Or 3?  Or 2?  You say you've rented every flic at your local video store, but can you guess a certain movie just by hearing who starred in it?  That's what Pop Smarts is all about.  It's a game of Pop Culture connections that tests your knowledge of the hip (and not so hip) stuff you grew up with.

The Maestro provides the clues, and you guess the common thread that ties 'em together.  With 1000 questions in Pop Culture categories like Movies, TV, Music, Books and the grab bag we call Pop-Pourri, there's something for everyone.  So think fast, think pop and have fun!

title: Wigwam
description:
The basic idea behind Wigwam is straightforward and players, while enjoying the elements Wigwam shares with classic board games, quickly appreciate the unique character of the game too.
The enemy Indian tribes, the brave and chief pieces, cross each others paths. The different moves and possibilities open to each of these pieces, together with individual role their tents or tepees play, create considerable suspense. Add to this a board on which pieces can move in 6 different directions and you get Wigwam. The aim is to render the opponent's warriors powerless either by capturing the chief or by encircling all his men, thus preventing him from moving further.

title: Missile Crisis
description: An operational simulation of a hypothetical invasion of Cuba in 1962. Contains map, rules and counters. This game came in a ziplock bag instead of a box.

title: 7th Cavalry
types: American Indian Wars American West Wargame
description:
A simulation of the Battle of Little Bighorn. Contains a map, counters and rules. This was a ziplock game, not a boxed game.

The Little Big Horn was not the only battle simulated in this game. In fact it was a generic Indian vs Cavalry game that depicted several actions during the Indian Wars. There was a Fort Phil Kearney scenario and a solitaire Wounded Knee scenario also.

From my notes written in 1995:
The scenarios range from Small Massacres (!!) to Custer's Last Stand, plus an interesting scenario entitled 'What if Custer had brought gatling guns'.

title: Knockout Cricket
description: Play your own limited-overs cricket match! Contains playing board, 12 Cricketer figures, scoreboard, site screens, 5 packs of cricket cards, rules and dice. Ages 8 and up.

title: Natural Selection
description:
From the publisher, Alien Menace:

Natural Selection is the thrilling prequel to the bestselling Alien Menace game, Sucking Vacuum!  Did you ever wonder how that monkey got on the International Space Station?  What trials did our small hairy friend rise above to secure his place on the doomed station?  Its a great story packed with love, drama, intrigue and monkeys throwing poop.  And unlike George Lucas, the guys at Alien Menace know how to make a prequel.

As the role of the great apes in exploration expands, more advanced testing is required to develop a higher level of human/simian synergy.  The International Space Station provides just such an opportunity.  Join the eight great apes in their quest to be chosen for this monumental mission!

Monkeys are funny...Everybody loves monkeys.

title: 38th Parallel
description: A strategic simulation of the Korean War by Simulation Design Corporation. Came in a ziplock bag. Contents: 1 map, 228 counters and rules.

title: Operacao Littorio
description: Wargame covering a hypothetical attempted takeover of South America by Brazil. Contains counters, map and rules. This game came in a ziplock bag instead of a box.

title: Conscience
description:
From the publisher...

Conscience is the fun way to learn right from wrong and help children build the foundation to make the right choices in life! A multi-award winner, the game promotes family dialog  on tough issues that children are facing at younger and younger ages. It's unique, timely and a family essential for 2-6 players Ages 5 and up!

The 9/11 terrorist attack has underscored the importance of talking to children early and often about issues of right and wrong and character. Conscience gets the conversation started around a back to basics framework children remember and apply! It is fast-paced, interactive and lecture-free! It is designed to help teach absolutes and as a jumping off point for deeper moral, ethical and spiritual conversations. It is low cost preventive medicine and children, parents, teachers and counselors love the game!

Conscience includes simplified rules and Jr. cards for younger children (Ages 5 - 7) and more challenging objectives, issues and game play for older children (Ages 8 and up).

title: Beau Monde
description: A card-based game of war with 4 sets of 14 cards each.  Obviously hand management is critical.

title: When Good Neighbors...Go Bad...
types: Abstract Strategy Economic Humor Party Game
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveVariable Player Powers
description:
The object of When Good Neighbors Go Bad is to aggravate all of your neighbors sufficiently that they sell their houses an move out of the neighborhood. Game play proceeds with the players going to work, making purchases (with the intent of inflaming their nosy neighbors), and engaging in anti-social activities.

Each person is assigned a specific neighbor-type and each has a special ability:
The Po' White Trash - can burn any item they possess at the end of the turn (the more smell the more aggravation).
The Yuppies - can call the cops once each turn on any other player for no apparent reason.
The Old Farts - are able to make any single item illegal at the end of their turn.
The Danged Furiners - can barbecue the neighbors pets.
The Psycho Neighbors - can shoot up to four items anywhere on the board.
The Eco-Nazis - do not require a vehicle to move around the board.

title: Monopoly: Milk Chocolate Game
description:
This version of Monopoly plays very similar to the normal rules, albeit with a smaller board containing just 12 properties. What makes this version particularly special is that the tokens, houses, and hotels are all foil-wrapped chocolate candies.

To start, each player is given $1,000 and all properties are dealt out much like a standard Short Game (although it is of course possible to play a standard game). There is only one die to roll, so you cannot get in or out of Jail with doubles; instead, rolling a 6 or paying $100 gets you out. Only two houses are needed before a hotel can be built, and the interest rate is fixed at $40.

The winner of the game gets not only the satisfaction of having won over his or her opponents, but also has the privilege of consuming all the chocolate.

Unlike the later Monopoly: Chocolate, this version is perfectly playable post-chocolate consumption through borrowing the same tokens, houses, and hotels from another Monopoly game.

title: Beach Maze
types: Abstract Strategy Environmental Maze Nautical Racing
description:
Beach Maze comes in a canvas bag.  The roll-up board has to be set up to play: stretch the canvas board over the provided sticks and legs, and it makes a little table that not only stands up well on the beach, it actually requires sand to stand up well as it's a little wobbly on its own...  The pieces are all wooden, and there are no cards to lose or get wet - it really does play well at the beach.  (You can just lay the canvas board flat on your gaming table if not at the beach.)

Each player has four baby turtles, just hatched, which must get to the sea.  These start on your edge of the board, on little cracked-egg spaces.  First player to get all four turtles off the board wins.  (The sea is represented by a space at the center of the board, a little disconcerting ...)  Each turn you roll one die and move any one turtle the number showing, with no backtracking.

Other wooden pieces on the board are dunes.  You cannot cross a dune: you have to land on one exactly.  In so doing, you remove it from the board and must place it on some other space.  Your best option, of course, is somewhere that blocks your opponent ...

Landing on an opponent's turtle sends it back to a start space.

Two of the dune pieces have crabs on the back, which can be used in an optional rule.  (Crabs are the enemies of newly hatched baby turtles ...)

title: Hampshire
description:
Hampshire is a word game made in Littleton, New Hampshire (USA) - hence the name.  The game comes with four dice (red, blue, green, purple), two player letter charts (in color), rules, and a pad of score sheets (which contain simply 25 blank squares in a 5x5 grid).  The whole thing fits in a box 3 x 3 x 2 (7.5 cm x 7.5 cm x 5 cm) and so is touted as being for home or travel.

Each turn you roll all four dice and consult the letter chart.  The chart shows a result from 1-5 for each of the four colors.  The twenty spaces contain the twenty consonants (all except Y).  So a roll of 4 on the blue die gives a T result, for example.

If the player rolls no 6s, he must choose one of the consonants rolled and enter it anywhere he wants in the 5x5 score sheet.  If he rolled at least one 6, he may also enter a vowel (or Y) of his choice.  If the red and green dice = 7, he may use the purple and blue dice as normal (choose one consonant from the blue and purple rows) but may then add a second consonant of his choice.

The letter(s) chosen must be entered onto the score sheet - there is only one score sheet for both players, passed back and forth each turn.  Basic Scrabble rules are followed in the mini 5x5 board.  Every letter placed must be alone or make a word.  You score one point for each word you make.  First player to nine points wins.  When the score sheet is full or unusable, if no one has reached nine points, start a new score sheet.

title: Gunpowder Treason
description:
The perfect game to play November 5, Gunpowder Treason is a game based on Guy Fawkes' attempt to blow up Parliament in 1605.  This in itself is a little spooky, but what's really spooky is that the box says that Aztral Games designed it for Astra Fireworks Company in the UK!

It's a fairly simple game: move one space on your turn and possibly draw a card.  The object is to be the first to get your four barrels of gunpowder at the edges of the board to Parliament at the center of the board - you can only carry one at a time.  The board has lots of squares, some with text on them and some with tunnels for faster (but riskier) movement.

About a fifth of the spaces are of each player color, and the other fifth are white.  If you end your turn on a white space or your own color, your turn is over.  If you end on another color, draw a card.  These range from being good for you (Take another turn) to potentially bad for you or even for an opponent (Counterinsurgency agents raid ...).

Sometimes games end with Parliament being blown up, but more often one player simply has the last uncaptured piece on the board.  This is actually kind of reassuring, in a real-world sense.

title: Blue Chip
description:
Blue Chip (also published as Dow Jones) is a very simplistic stock market game with an interesting twist (sliding pegboards).  There are 12 companies divided into Industrials (such as GM), Railroads (such as Union Pacific), and Utilities (such as ATT).  There are four of each type, and each type has a peg board of a different primary color.

On your turn you may take one and only one action.  An action is either buying or selling stock in one company.  (You don't have to sell all when you sell.)

When you buy stock in a company, you move its individual peg up one, two or three spaces depending on how many shares you buy.  Likewise when you sell: you move the stock price down one, two, or three spaces.

After each action, draw a card and see what happens.  Many of the cards refer to the stock just transacted: a split, or all players holding the stock collect a dividend, or are assessed a fine, or the company goes bankrupt, etc.  (Yes, it's as fierce as the dot.coms a few years ago: five of the twelve companies will be bankrupt by the game's end!)

Other cards are general and refer to the whole board.  Sometimes you roll dice which affect all industrials or railroads or utilities.  In that case, you slide the whole peg board for that particular color up or down as necessary.  There are dice in three colors with sides of +2, +4, +6, -2, -4, -6 on them.

title: Duel Arcane
description:
From the back cover:
When spells and lightning bolts won't do the trick ... wizards get down to the nitty gritty of Duel Arcane.

In Duel Arcane, shapechanging mages engage in individual combat, using the forms of legendary and mythical beasts.  The game is fast moving, with lightning quick shifts of advantage, as the players transform themselves from animal to animal.  Fight as a leopard, a manticore, or even a griffon -- vanquish powerful arcane foes on the road to being the most powerful wizard alive !!

Duel Arcane includes a 28 page rules booklet, 4 pullout character sheets, and descriptions for over thirty different animals and beasts of legend and myth.

So conjure up a few golden coins, and let the duel begin ...

---
(The game consists of a booklet of rules, charts, descriptions and options, plus character sheets.  It's very similar to the combat system of a typical role-playing game, but without the roleplaying element.)

title: Big Bat Baseball
description: Large vertical pinball-machine type game with twelve balls enclosed.  Players shoot the ball the balls up into the machine and play according to the rules of Baseball.  Players alternate turns resetting the machine between each half inning.

title: Mannfolk
description:
A party game for Real Men(tm) where women are meant to be conquered and one-night stands are the rule.
Be prepared to use every possible trick to get something to brag to your friends about.

The goal is to score and you do so by rolling a dice, moving around the (beer-proof!) playing board where. The currency in the game is Self assurance.

title: Arne Total
description:
Choose a color. Accumulate as many value cards of your color before the stack runs out of cards. Deal all the players 8 cards. Each time it is your turn you must first draw a card from the stack. You can only play 1 white card when it is your turn

Game within the game: the black cards. You can play black cards at any given moment, so even when it is not your turn.

family card game to be played by 2-6 persons. 
duration of the game 10-25 minutes
Ages 7 and up

Re-implements:

    Arne.

title: Numbers Count
description: This innovative game will help your child to develop critical thinking and problem solving--important math skills to have at any time of the year. This game was developed by a Kindergarten teacher and a speech-language pathologist. Players flip over a secret number card, listen for clues and use the arrows to uncover the secret number. Youve got three chances to find a strategy and win the secret target. You can play Double Digit Duo and arrange the cards to make the largest double digit number possible. You can play Secret Memory and be the first to claim the most matching number cards. Multi-level play variations include skill building games, 44 self correcting double sided puzzle pieces, 42 secret number cards, 21 English and Spanish word cards and 22 wiggly arrows.

title: Monster Madness
description: Roll the dice and move that number of spaces and follow the instructions on the space.  You may choose to re-roll the dice a second if you want a better roll.  You may also choose to re-roll a third time, but you are then required to accept the last roll and move.  If you roll a lightning bolt at any time, you must go back on the path to the last lightning bolt passed and your turn is over.  The first player to reach the 'lab slab' by exact count and be energized by rolling a lightning bolt becomes a 'Super Monster' and wins the game.

title: Bango! Bango!
description: An H-shaped plastic board has six marbles on each of the sides.  Players hit the ends of the board with their Bango stick to move the marbles up the ramp.  If the marble is tapped properly, it will enter the inside (cross bar) ramp leading to the center section of the game.  When a player's sixth marble enters the ramp, the arrow will point to that player as the winner.

title: Zominoes
